loans.use: to buy guinea pigs, pigs, and hens

loans.name: Julian

texts.es:
Julian continúa con  la ganadería y a la agricultura pero también trabaja para una entidad pública, él en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar semillas y abono. 

Julian nació en el distrito de Challabamba pero vive en la comunidad de Majopata anexo de la comunidad de Carnicero, él tiene 36 años de edad, es casado y fruto de esta hermosa relación tiene seis hijos y pertenece al banco comunal “El Balcon” (La comunidad de Majopata está ubicada en el distrito del Challabamba en la provincia de Paucartambo dentro del departamento de Cusco, Perú).
texts.en: Julian continues to raise livestock and farm. He also works for a public entity. At this time he needs a loan to buy seeds and fertilizer. Julian was born in the district of Challabamba but lives in the community of Majopata, part of the community of Carnicero. (The community of Majopata is located in the district of Challabamba in the province of Paucartambo, Cusco Department, Peru).  He is 36 years old, married and has six children from this union. He belongs to the “El Balcon” communal bank

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Salomon

texts.es: Don Salomón labora como guarda de seguridad para una empresa privada, procreo con su esposa 5 hijos a quienes dio crecer con muchos esfuerzos y  sacrificios, una manera de apoyarse económicamente fue haciendo un cuarto para alquiler, de esta manera ha amortiguado los gastos de la  canasta básica que hoy en día está más cara, este nuevo crédito que solicita es para comprar  portón de hierro y verjas para dos ventanas de un acuarto que tiene en construcción, con el cual lleva una lucha larga para poder terminarlos, pues le hace falta esas tres piezas mencionadas para garantizar la seguridad y condiciones habitables.
texts.en:
Salomón works as a security guard for a private company. He has five children with his wife who they have raised with great effort and sacrifice. One way to support themselves financially is to rent out a room. Thorough this they alleviate the expenses of the basic food basket that is ever more expensive today. 

Salomón is requesting this new loan to buy an iron door and grilles for two windows of a room that is under construction. He has had a long struggle to finish it and lacks these three pieces to guarantee their security and livable conditions.

loans.use: to buy iron grills and an iron door.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
This is Erlinda, 62, resident of Taguig, Philippines. She is single, and she is working hard to provide income for her everyday needs.

Erlinda maintains a direct selling business. She sells clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics and other products through the popular direct selling brands like Avon, Fuller life, Natasha, Boardwalk, Marikina Shoe Exchange, and other direct selling brands. A customer's order is bought in cash by the dealer and then given to the customer with a one-month-to-pay credit. Dealer’s prices are lower than those in the catalog, and these are the profits that dealers are investing on as their income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 2,000 in sales every week.

To help her continue operation of her business, she is requesting a Php 15 000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy additional supplies and merchandise products, such as shampoo, cologne, deodorant, perfume, soap, fabric softener, undergarments and other products needed in her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Erlinda hopes to expand her business and dreams to have a better living. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional supplies and merchandise products, such as clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics needed in her business.

loans.name: Maria Ysabel

texts.es:
María Ysabel tiene 34 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo e hijos en el distrito de Oyotun , una zona rural donde su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta de abarrotes, menestras, arroz, leche, aceite entre otros, son una familia emprendedora que se esfuerza por la labor que realiza, Ella ha solcitado un préstamo de 2 000 nuevos soles para la compra de mercadería para abastecer su negocio y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
María Ysabel is 34 years old. She lives with her husband and children in the district of Oyotun, two hours from the city of Chiclayo on the North Coast of Peru. The people here work in agriculture, business and raise cattle.

María Ysabel sells groceries, legumes, rice, milk,oil, etc. They are a enterprising family who work hard for what they get. She is requesting a loan of 2,000 PEN to buy merchandise to stock her business and in this way generating more income for her family.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to stock her business.

loans.name: Merlita

texts.en: Merlita is operating a small store selling grocery items to the people in her neighborhood. According to her, she earns about 5,000 PHP monthly and uses it for sustenance for their meals and other bills at home. She wanted to increase her merchandise and sell more grocery items that is why she is asking for a loan of 6,000 PHP to buy stocks of canned goods, milk, bread, biscuits, soap and shampoo to sell. From this strategy, Merlita will be able to increase her sales and gain more income as well.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, milk, bread, biscuits, soap and shampoo to sell

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en: Zenaida is 47 years old, married and has three children. She is selling fish, meat and vegetables. She offers them through a house to house selling basis. She hopes to offer more commodities that is why she is asking for the additional capital of 6,000 PHP. This loan will be used to buy more fish, vegetables and meat to sell. Zenaida hopes to keep improving her sales capacity and save some money for her family’s future expenses.

loans.use: to buy more fish, vegetables and meat to sell

loans.name: Shuhrat

texts.en:
Shuhrat is 33-years-old. He and his wife are farmers and have two children. He is very hardworking and kind-natured. He has a lot of friends and all of them love him very much.

Shuhrat has been farming for six years, producing potatoes, carrots, wheat and maize. He has been in this line of work since he was a boy, so all of his experience has been dedicated to producing crops and vegetables. His products are sold at the local market in the region.  

In order to provide his crops with the needed attention, he is currently requesting a loan in the amount of 7,000 Somoni to buy seeds and mineral fertilizers. He awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy seeds and mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Edith Ingrith

texts.es: La señora Edith tiene 20 años y tiene dos hijos que son de las edades de 3 años y un bebe de 6 meses, la  señora Edith se dedica a la fabricación de plumas artificiales desde hace ya bastante tiempo, su taller  se encuentran ubicado en la zona de Dokwalla este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución,  la  señora Edith va a usar este préstamo para la compra de materia prima (tela y palos) por su negocio. su razón para solicitar este préstamo es fuerte demanda de sus productos para las fiestas de carnaval ya que antes usaban plumas de aves que estaban en peligro de extinción y como ya lo prohibieron ella empezó a preservar la naturaleza realizando plumas sintéticas, por este motivo tiene mucha demanda la  señora Edith enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la falta de efectivo para satisfacer la demanda, y va a utilizar los beneficios en ampliar el negocio comprando maquinas ya que ahora lo realiza de manera manual y con la maquinaria podría incrementar la producción, la  señora Edith es una persona joven emprendedora se siente agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Edith is 20 years old and has two children, a 3-year-old and a baby of 6 months. Edith has made artificial feathers for quite some time. Her workshop is located in the Dokwalla area. This is her first loan cycle with the institution. Edith is going to use this loan to buy raw material (fabric and sticks) for her business. Her reason for requesting this loan is the strong demand for her products for carnival festivities. Before, they used feathers from birds in danger of extinction, and since they prohibited it, she began to preserve nature by making synthetic feathers. For this reason she has a lot of demand. Edith faces challenges in her business, one of which is a lack of cash to satisfy the demand, and she is going to use the profits to expand the business and buy machines, since right now she does it manually. With the machinery, she will be able to increase production. Edith is an entrepreneurial young person. She is grateful to the institution for the support given.

loans.use: to buy raw materials (fabric and sticks)

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine works hard to support her family. Josephine is married and has a buy and sell fingerlings business in the Philippines.

Josephine requested a PHP 40,000 loan through NWTF to buy fishing nets and other fishing materials.

Josephine has been in this business for 33 years now.

In the future, Josephine would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and other fishing materials

loans.name: Sandra

texts.en: As the married mother of eight children, Sandra works hard to support her family. She earns a living by making food in the Philippines, and is requesting a loan for PHP 6,000 from NWTF to buy more of the ingredients she uses to make her food. Sandra has sustained her business with two prior loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food-making business.

loans.name: Nornita

texts.en:
Nornita is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy additional stocks for her general store business, like soap, sugar, eggs, milk, and canned goods.

Nornita has been in this business for three years. She earns additional income from food-vending and raising pigs.

Nornita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks, like soap, sugar, eggs, milk, and canned goods.

loans.name: Sheril

texts.en: Sheril is 35 years old, married and the mother of four children, all of whom attend school. She works very hard to provide for them by running a general store in the Philippines. She is requesting a loan for PHP 30,000 from NWTF to buy more items to sell such as sugar, milk and eggs. Sheril has been in this business for 11 years and would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell such as sugar, milk and eggs.

loans.name: Geraline

texts.en:
Genaline is 42 years old, married and has children. She is a resident of Taguig, Philippines. She and her husband manage their household while operating the business. She is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Genaline operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo,  5 PHP worth of cooking oil, or an egg. Genaline earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 PHP in sales every day.

Genaline is requesting a loan for 10,000 PHP, which she will use to buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand her product inventory.

Genaline hopes to have a big grocery store and that her children will finish their education.  She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and God.

All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Juje

texts.en:
As the married mother of three children, Juje works hard to support her family.

She has a manicure/pedicure business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from fish vending. Juje is borrowing PHP 6000 through NWTF in order to buy new tools for her manicure business.

Juje has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy new tools for her manicure business.

loans.name: Mavrupat

texts.ru:
Маврупат  женщина пастух. Она отлично умеет разводить крупно рогатый скот и мелко  рогатый скот. Так как в семье не было сыновей, Маврупат с детство помогала отцу в скотоводстве. Теперь приобретённые навыки и занятия отца стали источником дохода Маврупат. Также она занимается дехканским хозяйством, от которого получает овощи, зелень и фрукты для ежедневного питания семьи. 
Вот уже тридцать лет она приносит "хлеб" в семью занимаясь  скотоводством.  В связи с временными трудностями связанное с финансами, Маврупат решила обратиться за кредитом в МДО "Арванд". С помощью Арванд она надеется,что улучшит  свой будущий доход и благосостояние семьи. На приобретенный кредит хочет купить корм и крупный рогатый скот. Заранее благодарит МДО "Арванд"  за помощь и поддержку.
texts.en:
Mavrupat  tends farm animals. She is very skilled at raising cattle and small livestock. Since there were no sons in her family, Mavrupat has been helping out her father to raise livestock from childhood on. Now the skills she learned from her father help Mavrupat earn a living. She also has a small private farm and grows vegetables, herbs and fruits for her family table.

For over 30 years she has been her family’s breadwinner thanks to raising livestock. Due to temporary problems with financing, Mavrupat has decided to apply to MDO Arvand for a loan.  She hopes to be able to increase her revenue and improve her family’s life condition thanks to Arvand. She wants to use this loan to buy cattle and folder. Mavrupat thanks MDO Arvand in advance for its help and support.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
22 year old Hannah is a farmer living in the Ndaragwa area of Central Kenya. She has one child and has been doing farming for the past three years, where she produces and sells milk, eggs, and some vegetables. Hannah enjoys dairy farming most because it gives her more income as compared to other products. The challenge she faces is experiencing unstable milk prices.
Hannah chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan because their interest rates are affordable and they also give a grace period on their loans. She learned how to invest for her future and also farming. Hannah said that this loan will cause an increase in milk production and sales and thus an increase in income which will improve their living standards.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Arusyak

texts.en:
Arusyak runs a small bakery in Yerevan. She makes different types of sweets, cakes and bread and sells them locally. As a very hard working mother of a son, she does her best to gather good income. 

Because of the financial hardships that Arusyak currently faces, it is very difficult for her to purchase needed materials and tools. Therefore, she has decided to ask for this loan. Arusyak has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. The loan will be a huge support for Arusyak and for her bakery to continue as her small business.

loans.use: to pay for materials and tools needed for her bakery

loans.name: Teresia

texts.en:
Meet Teresia, a farmer living in Kisii, a prime area for banana and sugarcane growing. She is married and has three children; she has practiced farming for 21 years.  She produces and sells milk, tea, and eggs. She says that farming is her source of funds, and that's why she enjoys doing it and producing the best out of her farm. Her major challenge is poor roads, which leads to difficulty in accessing the local market.

Teresia chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan because they help small-scale farmers to grow economically, and they always train farmers before giving out loans to them. And their loans are always at a low interest rate.

This loan will help her purchase a dairy cow, which will lead to an increase in milk production and thus an increase in income.

This will ensure that her children receive a good education, and also improve her family's living standards.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Suad

texts.en: Suad is a married woman who was born in 1960. She lives with her husband in a sector in Jordan called Wihdat. She decided to help her husband financially by selling home products for the past year and found it profitable. Now she wants to buy a larger quantity of home products to raise her sales in order to help her husband in covering their needs. But she doesn't have enough money to do so. For this reason, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: To buy more home products for her business

loans.name: Sukriye

texts.en:
Şükriye is married, with two children. To contribute to her family, she began making and selling lace, decorative towel-edging, and booties. She sells them to her friends and neighbors. 

Her younger son had health problems which led Sukriye to spend a lot of time going to hospitals and physical therapy. She began to sell her work to the other patients there. Along with her handicrafts, she began to sell underwear, as well. To expand her business, she bought and sold sets for living rooms, blankets, and coverlets.

With the loan, Sukriye will buy underwear, coverlet sets, and blankets. "Because I always have to look after my children, I can't be dependent," she said.  "I have to keep working like this. My only wish is to complete my son's treatment in full and fulfill my older son's needs."

Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff 

Şükriye Hanım,evli ve 2 çocuğu var.  Ailesine katkı sağlamak için evde dantel,havlu kenarı ve patik yapıp satmakla başlamış.  Çevresine satıyor.  Daha sonra küçük oğlunun rahatsızlığı dolayısı ile hastanelere ve fizik rehabitilasyon merkezlerine çok sık gitmeye başlamış.  Burada ki hastalar ve hasta yakınlarına da el işlerini satmaya başlamış.  El işlerinin yanında iç çamaşırı satmaya başlamış.  İşi ilerledikçe koltuk takımları ,battaniyeler,pike takımları da siparişi üzerine alıp satıyor.  Aldığım kredi ile iç çamaşırı,pike takımı ve battaniye alacak.  Çocuğunun sürekli bakıma ihtiyacı olduğundan ben bir yere bağlanamaz.  İşime bu şekilde devam etmek zorundayım.  Tek ümidim oğlumun tedavisini tam olarak yapmak onun ve büyük oğlumun ihtiyaçlarını karşılamak.

loans.use: to buy underwear, coverlet sets, and blankets to sell.

loans.name: Analie

texts.en:
Analie is 41 years old and married with two children.

She earns a living by farming sugarcane in the Philippines. Analie is borrowing PHP 8000 through NWTF to buy fertilzer and other farm supplies.

Analie has been farming sugarcane for nine years and earns additional income from fish vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilzer and other farm supplies

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 45 years old and married with six children. With two children currently in school, Marilyn works very hard to provide for them.

Marilyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell in her general store.

Marilyn has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, soy sauce, salt, sugar, coffee and cooking oil. 

In the future, Marilyn would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell in her general store

loans.name: Belle Marie

texts.en:
Belle Marie is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a tailoring business in the Philippines, which she has been doing for five years. She earns additional income from motorcycle transport.

Belle Marie is requesting a loan from NWTF for 9,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase materials such as thread, needles, fabrics, etc. for her tailoring business. Belle Marie has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF.  She hopes to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase materials such as thread, needles, fabrics, etc. for her tailoring

loans.name: Solidad

texts.en: Solidad, 46 years of age, is married and blessed with two children. She owns and operates a retail store where she sells a variety of food seasonings. She also sells plastic bags for additional income. She has been in this business for almost 20 years and earns a net profit of PHP 5,000 monthly. Her profits are usually spent on the school expenses of her son. Due to a lack of capital available for her business, she would like to borrow PHP 50,000 to purchase onions, food seasonings, soy sauce, vinegar, and plastic bags to sell. She's hoping that her requested loan will be granted so that she can able to improve and expand her business to earn more profits.

loans.use: To purchase onions, food seasonings, soy sauce, vinegar, and plastic bags to sell.

loans.name: Nicanor

texts.en:
This is Nicanor, 28, a resident of Bacoor, Cavite, Philippines. He is married to Sheryl, a housewife and a mother to their children. He and his wife manage their household while operating a variety store business. At this time, he is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5 worth of cooking oil or an egg. He earns income by getting stock at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. His store is located adjacent to his house. His regular customers are his neighbors and the local community. He earns a minimum of 350 PHP in sales every day.

To help him continue operation of his business, he is requesting a PHP 20,000 loan. He will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand his product inventory.

Nicanor hopes that his business will grow bigger and dreams to have his own house. He meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his life and business every week and draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Joaquin

texts.es: El señor Joaquín tiene 58 años, estudio hasta nivel primario y tiene 10 hijos independientes. Vive en puerto Villarroel y se dedica a la pesca desde hace 15 años en su pequeño barco, pero en la época de veda es decir donde prohíben la pesca se dedica a prestar el servicio de turismo, para que este sea más eficiente solicita un crédito para la compra de un motor fuera de borda que tiene más capacidad para poder navegar más rápido, así podrá prestar un mejor servicio e incrementará sus ingresos.
texts.en: Joaquín is 58 years old. He studied through Primary school and has 10 independent children. He lives in the port of  Villarroel. For the past 15 years he has worked on his boat, but in the times of  prohibition, that is to say that fishing is prohibited, he works now in tourism. So that he has sufficient funds he is requesting  loan to buy a bigger outboard motor. Then he can travel faster, offer a better service and increase his income.

loans.use: to buy an outboard motor.

loans.name: Leonarda

texts.es:
Leonarda tiene 67 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo en el distrito de La Matanza, una comunidad que se caracteriza por sus bosques de algarrobo, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada a dos horas de la ciudad de Piura, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta de chicha de jora, y crianza de animales menores en la parte posterior a su domicilio, ha solicitado un préstamo de 2 000 nuevos soles para la compra de alimentos balanceados para engorde de pavos y una segunda parte para la compra de harina ya que en las fiestas todos los productos suben de precio y desea contar con un stock, generando mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Leonarda is 67 and lives with her husband in La Matanza, a district known for its carob trees. The people of La Matanza work are agriculturalists, traders and livestock breeders. It is located two hours from the city of Piura on the north coast of Peru.

She works selling chicha, a type of drink made from corn, and she also rears young animals in her backyard. She has requested a loan of 2,000 soles to buy balanced nutrition to fatten up her turkeys. She also wants to use part of the money to buy flour, as during festive periods prices drop, and she wants to stock up so that she can make more money for her family.

loans.use: To buy sacks of flour and balanced nutrition to fatten up her animals.

loans.name: Cecilia Consuelo

texts.es:
Cecilia Consuelo tiene 36 años de edad, vive junto a su hijo en el distrito de Oyotun, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la compra y venta de animales de corral pavos, gallinas y patos en la parte posterior a su domicilio, ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 500 nuevos soles para la compra de animales pavos y cerdos para hacer crecer su negocio, generando mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Cecilia Consuelo is 36 years old. She lives with her son in the district of Oyotun, two hours from Chiclayo on the North Coast of Peru. The people here work in agriculture, commerce and raise livestock.

She buys and sells animals like turkeys, chickens and ducks in an area behind her house. She has requested a loan of 1,500 PEN to buy turkeys and pigs to expand her business and generate more revenues for her family.

loans.use: to buy turkeys and pigs to expand her business.

loans.name: Josphat's Group

texts.en:
Amani Group is a group of five group leader farmers in Kakamega North District, with Josphat selected as the Kiva representative. Josphat has volunteered to be the Kiva group representative and is on the right of the photo with his hand raised. He also joined One Acre Fund because he wanted better harvests. Farming inputs will be delivered to him and the 64 other individual farmers represented in this group. The credit consists of the necessary materials to plant ¼ acre of maize and ¼ acre of millet or sorghum. The individual farmers are not pictured here but will be receiving an average loan of 5,349 shillings.

Josphat is a reliable member of the community. He is married with five children. He is 38 years old and has been working as a farmer for the last 16 years to support his family. In addition to this, Josphat is very active in his community and is involved in the savings group. He described his harvest last year as not being with One Acre Fund. He hopes as a One Acre Fund farmer he will be able to join the ranks of One Acre Fund farmers who have doubled their harvest in their first year of the program!

The 2013 Long Rains season will be Josphat’s first season with One Acre Fund. He joined this year in order to get new farming methods. As an active member in his community, Josphat also volunteered his time to be a group leader and Kiva representative because he likes being a leader. Josphat plans on using future profits from the harvest to save for the future, buy a cow and invest in a business. He believes that his life will improve by working with One Acre Fund.

One Acre Fund focuses on working with smallholder farmers across Kenya. The organization pre-purchases seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings onto the farmers. Josphat and the Amani Group will use the Kiva loan to cover this initial cost of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer package from One Acre Fund. One Acre Fund will continue providing training and support throughout the planting and harvesting season to ensure a good harvest and repayment. With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits, and improved lives.

The field officer is also included in the photo and is standing on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To support farmers in purchasing hybrid seeds and fertilizer to increase better harvests of maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Angie

texts.en:
Angie is 35 years old and married with five children who are in school.  Angie works very hard to provide for them.

Angie runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 19000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock like milk, coffee and soft drinks to sell.

Angie has been in this business for three years.

In the future Angie would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock like milk, coffee and soft drinks to sell

loans.name: Annie

texts.en:
Annie is 33 years old and married with five children.

She earns a living by fattening pigs in the Philippines. Annie is borrowing PHP 11000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Annie has been in the pig-fattening business for six years and earns additional income from selling vegetables.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Emilia

texts.en:
Emilia is 32 years old and single. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Emilia has borrowed and repaid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and earns additional income from rice retailing.

Emilia aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Celia

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Celia works hard to support her family.

She has a business direct-selling Avon products in the Philippines and also earns income from rice retailing. Celia is borrowing PHP 6000 through NWTF to purchase lotion, soap, etc. to sell.

Celia has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase stock like lotion and soap to sell

loans.name: Spartak

texts.en: Spartak is from Shnogh village where he lives together with his wife. The couple has been involved in retail business for 15 years. Spartak, for 10 years, has been also providing transportation of different products using his own truck. Because of financial hardships that the family currently faces, Spartak asks this loan. It is important for him to pay for the renovation of the truck and purchase fruit to resell. Spartak has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business startup loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. The loan is important for Spartak to continue his work and he will be very grateful to all lenders for support.

loans.use: to pay for renovation of the truck and purchase fruits for resale

loans.name: Wayna Orco Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “WAYNA ORCO”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Paucartambo, perteneciente a la provincia de Paucartambo y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Ana Agutina  ella es conviviente y tiene 54 años y tiene; La socia trabaja en su negocio de agricultura,la socia tiene un terreno donde siembra papa y luego los vende en las diferentes mercados,la socia trabaja desde las 8.00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 8 años en este negocio y le va muy bien,el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender las papas. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar papas.
 
 
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de agricultura, negocio de venta de granos, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de animales.


La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the “Wayna Orco” communal bank located in the district and province of Paucartambo, in Cusco department.

One member is Ana Agustina who is married and 54 years of age. She works in her agricultural business and has her own land where she plants potatoes and, later, sells the harvest in different markets. Ana works from 8:00 am until 6:00 pm. She has been in this business for 8 years, and it is going very well. Her dream is to have her own stall where she could sell her potatoes. Ana requests the loan to buy potatoes to plant.
 
The other members are also dedicated to agriculture, including a business that sells grains, another that sells groceries, and another that sell animals.

Ana is very grateful to all those who form part of her dream in this manner, and she promises to comply with her payments as scheduled.

loans.use: to buy potatoes.

loans.name: Nestor

texts.es:
Nestor, es casado y tiene dos hijos de los cules solo uno esta en etapa escolar, viven en casa propia ocupando dos habitaciones,la casa se encuentra ubicada en la zona alto San Pedro de la ciudad de La Paz.
Actualmente trabaja durante ocho horas al dia como empleado en una empresa privada, con los ingresos que tiene debe cubrir los gastos de alimentación , educación y pago de servicios básicos de su familia.
El crédito lo invertirá en la salud de su esposa ya que no cuenta con seguro de salud y se encuentra delicada y necesita hacer unos examenes par hallar la causa de este problema.
Es la tercera vez que trabaja junto a IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Nestor is married and has two children, of whom just one is of school age. He lives in his own house, occupying two rooms. The house is located in the high area of San Pedro in the city of La Paz.

He currently works eight hours per day as the employee of a private company. With the income he has, he is able to cover the expense of food and education and pay for basic services for his family.

He will invest the loan in the health of his wife because they do not have health insurance. She is delicate and needs to do some tests to find the cause of this problem.

This is the first time he has worked together with IMPRO and the first time with Kiva.

loans.use: to pay for medical exams to determine the state of his wife's health, which has deteriorated a lot.

loans.name: Yanti

texts.en:
Yanti is a housewife and a mother of two children. They live in Bandung, a city located about two hours' drive from Jakarta. Yanti runs a small stall where she sells snacks, mobile phone airtime credits, and processes bill payments for her customers. She felt interested in joining Ruma because she wants to expand her business. She is glad that her business was assisted and supported by Ruma agents. 

For the last three months, she has had around $41-$42/day sales in average just from selling mobile phone airtime credits. She hopes to get a working capital loan from Kiva to process more mobile phone airtime credits transactions on weekends. In the future, she is planning to seek more business opportunities. Yanti thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to process more mobile phone airtime credits and bill payment service transactions on weekends

loans.name: Shadya

texts.en: Shadya is a married woman who was born in 1987. She is a mother of 2. Her husband is a mechanic. She decided to help her husband financially by selling clothes the last 4 year and found it profitable. She is planning to open her own clothes store in the future. Now she wants to buy a larger quantity of winter clothes that suit the winter season to help her husband in covering their children's needs. For this reason, she has applied for this youth loan.

loans.use: To buy winter clothes for her business

loans.name: Iwan

texts.en:
Iwan runs a small stall which sells snacks, drinks, and mobile phone airtime credits. Iwan lives in Bandung, a major city of West Java, located about two hours' drive from Jakarta. Iwan is married and living with his wife and his 10-year-old son in the family home. Iwan began working with Ruma because he is interested in selling mobile phone airtime credits. Now he manages a small stall called a "warung", a typical corner store in Indonesia, that sells snacks and mobile phone airtime credits. 

For the last 3 months, he has had around $10-11/day sales on average just from selling mobile phone airtime credit sales. As the business continues, he hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital loan in order to do more transactions on weekends. Iwan plans to use the extra cash for his son's education. He really thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To process more mobile phone airtime credits transactions on weekends

loans.name: Rose Group

texts.en:
“I never pay attention to age or gender. There are just too many other more important things to consider,” shares Juliet who is also the Chairperson for Rose SHG Group. She is only 26 years old but financially independent and determined to be a successful businesswoman. All of the members live in the same neighbourhood which is about 40 kms south of the main Imphal capital in Manipur, which is one of the northeastern states in India. Juliet believes in herself, keeps her faith and is very hard-working.

Juliet runs a boutique in the town market. She sells mostly women's garments like skirts, blouses, tops, tunics, boot cut pants, undergarments, etc. She usually gets the supplies from neighbouring states or places an order from the capital state of India, i.e., Delhi. Her customers prefer to purchase garments from her as they are imported garments and not locally manufactured. She usually fails to meet the demand of her customers due to insufficient cash to purchase more high quality garments. The shop is located in the middle of the town market which gives an advantage for selling. Sales increase during festive seasons and they are slow during harvesting season. Juliet always places an order for supplies before the festive season kicks off to let the customers gets the best items without letting them go to the main market in Imphal. 

With the help of the Kiva loan, she will purchase more stock and cosmetics like sunscreen lotions, facial wash, day cream, talcum powder, etc. She aspires to become one of the successful businesswoman in the neighbourhodd and strongly believes in her dreams. She also joined a savings group and says that she will repay the loan on time. “Thank you so much, Kiva. I also wish to continue working with Kiva even after I am married,” she said, and gave a shy glance. 

The other group members are engaged in paan selling, weaving, poultry, retail store, piggery, tailoring and a photo studio.

loans.use: To purchase more stock for the boutique shop, sell it and generate more income for future use.

loans.name: Nueva Esperanza Group

texts.es: La Alcancía Comunal “Nueva Esperanza” está conformada por 06 socios responsables y trabajadores. Angélica de 44 años es casada con 04 hijos dependientes. Actualmente cuenta con una tienda en su vivienda, negocio que le ha generado ingresos para su hogar. Con mucho esfuerzo Angélica a mejorado su tienda. Es por ello que solicitó el crédito para seguir invirtiendo la cual comprará abarrotes, bebidas y golosinas. El deseo de Angélica es implementar más su negocio.  El grupo “Nueva Esperanza” agradecen a las personas que hicieron posible este crédito y se comprometen a seguir trabajando bien. Angélica se encuentra de pie, es la segunda del lado izquierdo y viste blusa blanca y falda floreada.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Nueva Esperanza" [New Hope] is made up of six responsible and hardworking members. Angélica, 44 years old, is married and has four dependent children. She currently has a store in her house, and this business has created an income for her home. Angélica has improved her store through a lot of hard work. This is why she requested the loan, to continue investing. It will buy groceries, drinks, and sweets.

Angela's wish is to grow her business. The 'Nueva Esperanza' group is grateful to the people who made this loan possible, and they promise to keep working hard. Angélica is standing, the second person on the left side, wearing a white blouse and flowered skirt.

loans.use: to buy groceries, drinks, and sweets

loans.name: Eugenio

texts.es:
Eugenio tiene 48 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa en el Caserío de La Granadilla, una zona rural del distrito de Santo Tomás, una comunidad que se caracteriza por un relieve accidentado, lo que le ha permitido tener diversos pisos ecológicos para el cultivo de frutas, café, papa, yuca entre otros, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería ubicado a cinco horas de la provincia de Cutervo, que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

El se dedica al cultivo de café de la variedad catimor, tiene sembrando 1 ha de cafeto de su propiedad, el se dedica a esta actividad desde hace 20 años, también se dedica a la cría y venta de ganado vacuno, cuenta con mucha experiencia en el rubro, Eugenio comercializa la producción de café en el distrito de Santo Tomás, para luego trasladarlo hasta la ciudad de Jaén que es el centro de acopio de este producto de toda la zona norte del Perú.

Ha solicitado un préstamo de 2 000 nuevos soles para darle mantenimiento a su cultivo, comprando abonos, con ello obtendrá buen rendimiento de sus cultivos y mayores ingresos para así poder mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Eugenio is 48 years old. He lives with his wife in the hamlet of La Granadilla, in the rural district of Santo Tomás. It is a mountainous area which allows for a variety of ecological systems to grow fruit, coffee, potatoes, yucca, etc. It is located five hours from the province of Cutervo, part of the Cajamarca region in the northern mountains of Peru.

Eugenio grows coffee of the Catimor (Arabica) variety. He has one hectare of his own land under cultivation. He has been doing this for 20 years. He also raises and sells cattle. He has lots of experience in this field. He sells his coffee in the district of Santo Tomás, which is then transported to the city of Jaen which is the collecting center of coffee for the northern zone of Peru.

Eugenio has requested a loan of 2,000 PEN to maintain his crops, buying fertilizer. With this he will reap a better crop and will be able to improve his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer to maintain his crops.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma, a 59-year-old married mother of four, has been raising livestock  in the Philippines for three years. She is now requesting her fourth loan from NWTF to purchase feeds, vitamins and vaccines for her livestock.

In the future, Emma would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase feeds, vitamins and vaccines for her livestock

loans.name: Carmen

texts.en:
Carmen, a 59-year-old married mother of seven, works hard to provide for her family. She has been operating a general store in the Philippines for 16 years and earns additional income from raising livestock.

Having received and repaid 15 previous loans from NWTF, Carmen is requesting a new one for PHP 10000 to buy more items such as canned goods, soft drinks, coffee, milk, etc. She aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more items like canned goods, soft drinks, coffee, milk, etc.

loans.name: Hanifa

texts.en:
Hanifa is 30 years old. She is a hardworking woman from the north part of Tajikistan. She is divorced and has two children. She is the only provider for her children. She began her business with a beauty salon two months ago. 

Hanifa took part in a course called ‘To Get Ahead’ through a women's organization and got a certificate. She wants to develop her new business. She wants to buy hairdresser's equipment. She is asking for a loan of 1000 Somoni to buy hairdresser's equipment. She awaits your support. She is sure that her business will be profitable and successful.

loans.use: to buy hairdresser's equipment for her new business

loans.name: Gulnora

texts.en: Gulnora was born in 1985 and is hard-working and industrious. Gulnora is divorced and is raising a child. Gulnora wants to organize her own sewing business because she needs to money for herself and her child. Gulnora completed a course on getting ahead offered by a women's organization and got a certificate. She will sew women's dresses at the house. Her friends and neighbors will be her clients. Gulnora is asking for a loan of 5,000 Somoni to buy a sewing machine and fabric. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine and fabric for organizing a new business

loans.name: Habiba

texts.en:
Habiba is a successful woman. She is married and has a child. 

Habiba always focuses on the well-being of her family. She can sew women's dresses, so wonderfully. That’s why she began her business with sewing, five months ago. 

Habiba wants to develop her business and, with this aim, she took part in a course, 'To Get Ahead’ at a women's organization and she got a certificate. She learned a lot of things about managing a business. 

Habiba sews dresses with her mother's old sewing machine. She is going to buy a new sewing machine and, in this way, develop her business. She is asking for a loan of TJS 4,500 (somoni) to buy a sewing machine for her new business. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine for her new business.

loans.name: Samnang

texts.en:
Samnang is 38 years old and lives in her own house with her family, which is comprised of six members including her. She has a business selling second-hand clothes in front of her house. Her customers are her friends, neighbors and relatives. She likes this business because it gives her financial stability and enough time to take care of her children.

Samnang has applied for a loan to build a household latrine as she realized that HKL provides clients with a special rate for water product loans. Samnang is very happy and thankful since this loan enables her to focus on ensuring healthy living conditions, to safeguard the health of her family and to protect the environment.

loans.use: to build a household latrine.

loans.name: Patriotas De Patria Group

texts.es:
La socia Micaela pertenece al banco comunal PATRIOTAS DE PATRIA.

La socia Micaela tiene 42 años de edad y es casada, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de frutas, la socia vende platanos, manzanas, papayas entre otros, la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia a la vez se dedica a la agricultura, la socia es una persona responsable, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de eta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de frutas como naranjas entre otros.
Los demás socios se dedican a la venta de granos, venta de madera, crianza de animales menores, venta de alimentos.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Member Micaela belongs to the communal bank Patriotas de Patria.  Micaela is 42 years old and married.  She alternates her time between her own activities and her business selling fruit. The other bank members work selling grain, raising small animals, selling wood, and selling food.

This member sells bananas, apples, and papayas, among others.  She has been doing this work for a while now.  It is going well for her thanks to the effort she puts into the business on a daily basis.  Micaela also works in agriculture.  She is a responsible person who wants to be able to keep on working, and so to keep on supporting her family.

Micaela is asking for a loan to buy fruit, such as oranges, among others.  Micaela feels thankful for the loan and is committed to making the payments that have been established.

loans.use: to buy fruit such as oranges, among others.

loans.name: Nickly

texts.en:
Nickly is married and she works hard to support her family.

She has a business selling school supplies in the Philippines and earns additional income from raising livestock. Nickly is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF in order to purchase more school supplies to sell.

Nickly has been sustaining her business activities through her past 21 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more school supplies to sell.

loans.name: Bwari

texts.en:
Meet 30 year old Bwari who is one of Juhudi Kilimo's farmers living in Kisii. She is married and has 3 children. She has farmed for 4 years to produce milk and eggs.She loves planting napier grass for her animals. Her greatest challenge comes during dry season when she experiences a low yield.
Bwari chose Juhudi Kilimo because of testimonies of other clients, who have benefited from the loans. She says that they give out loans that cater to client's needs. This loan will allow her to purchase a dairy cow to bring in more income to her family and she will be able to pay school fees for her children without difficulty.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Azeed's Group

texts.en:
Azeed is a 55-year-old, married woman and the mother of six children. Her husband is a driver by trade and provides transportation services, using his three-wheeled rickshaw. He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family's expenses, but now it requires proper maintenance to keep it functional. 

For this reason, Azeed has applied for a loan for her husband. He wants to buy new tires, fix the engine problem, and do a little bit of maintenance on the rickshaw body. This will help him drive more smoothly and provide better transport service to his passengers. 

Azeed is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: To fix the engine and body of their auto rickshaw.

loans.name: Zein

texts.en: Because Zein is a conservative woman, she asked her son to take her place in the picture. Zein was born in 1970. She is married and has four sons living in a sector in Jordan called Salt. Her husband is a taxi driver. One of her sons is a student at the university majoring in Anti-Crime and Deviance, and he is planning to work in his study field after graduation to start his work life. Because of the financial crisis Zein and her husband are facing, they couldn't pay their son's upcoming semester fees. For this reason, Zein has applied for this loan.

loans.use: To pay her son's upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Manana

texts.en: Manana is a 50-year-old married woman. She lives with her husband in the small village of Lanchkhuti district. Manana is provided with an invalid's pension from the government institutions of 70 Gel per month. Her husband works as a security guard at a local school. The family is involved in agricultural activities. In particular, they have a plot of agricultural land, where maize and nut trees are grown. Manana and her husband work hard to insure in a good harvest. They always have high quality products, which are sold to local retailers. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo enables her to get a loan of $ 800 for purchasing an used car for her husband. As the car is purchased, her husband will serve local people as a taxi driver and will be able to generate more income. With the increased income, the family will improve their living conditions. Manana awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase a car for her husband to start a taxi business

loans.name: Saeed

texts.en: Saeed is 21 years old. He is living in a sector in Jordan called Irbid with his family, consisting of five siblings and his parents. Saeed currently works in the Carrefour supermarket in Jordan. He is studying at university and majoring in medical labs. He is in his second year and is planning to find a job that suits his study field after graduation in order to start supporting his family financially. His family members are facing a financial crisis that does not allow them to pay for his upcoming semester fees. For this reason, he has applied for this loan.

loans.use: To pay for his upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Sabta

texts.en:
Because Sabta is a conservative woman, she asked her son to take her place in the picture. Sabta was born in 1970. She is married and has six sons living in a sector in Jordan called Madaba. Her husband is a retired man. 

One of her sons is a student at the university majoring in geography, and he is planning to work in his study field after graduation to start his work life. But because of the financial crisis Sabta and her husband are facing, they couldn't pay for their son's upcoming semester fees. For this reason, Sabta has applied for this loan.

loans.use: To pay for her son's  upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Duha

texts.en:
Duha is 19-year-old lady living with her parents and six siblings in a sector in Jordan called Irbid. She is working as a hairdresser and at the same time studying for her Bachelors’ degree, majoring in Applied Arts and Design. She is in her second year. 

She is planning to start her work life after graduation to support her family financially. To do so, she needs to pay for her upcoming semester tuition. But she doesn't have enough money. For this reason, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: To pay for her upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Hala

texts.en:
Hala is a 24-year-old lady living with her parents and four siblings in a sector in Jordan called Mafraq. She is studying for her Bachelors’, majoring in Business Administration. She is in her fourth year and is only one step away from graduation. 

Hala is planning to continue her study till she gets her Masters’. To do so, she needs to pay for her upcoming semester tuition. But she doesn't have enough money. For this reason, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: To pay for her upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Khushvakht

texts.ru:
Хушвахту 30 год. Он счастливый отец троих детей и верный муж. У Хушвахта два сына и дочка. Дочке 8 лет она ученица средней школы. Двум его сыновьям по 6 и 5 лет. В следующем году и они будут ходить в школу. Сейчас образование детей стала дорогим и Хушвахт хочет, чтобы его дети были образованными и имели все учебники. 
   Хушвахт активно готовиться посеву зимнего урожая. Он собирается на своей земле посадить зимнюю пшеницу. Для реализации посева ему не обходим кредит, на который он купит пшеничные зерна, минеральных удобрений и горючей смеси для трактора. Ему не хватает своих средств для посева. Если он не успеет посеять пшеницу, то весной он останется без урожая. Помогите ему! Он ждет Вашей помощи!
texts.en:
Khushvakht is 30 years old. He is a lucky father of three children and a faithful husband. Khushvakht has two sons and a daughter. His daughter is 8 years old and attends middle school. His sons are 5 and 6 and will be starting school next year. Nowadays education has become really expensive and Khushvakht wants his children to be well educated and have all the necessary text books. 

Khushvakht is actively preparing for the winter planting season. He plans to use his land to plant winter wheat. To make it happen Khushvakht needs to take out a loan with which he will buy wheat seeds, fertilizer and fuel for his tractor. His own savings are not enough to finance this venture. If he is not able to plant wheat in time, he will be left without a harvest in the spring. Pleas help him! He awaits your assistance!

loans.use: to plant winter wheat and buy wheat seeds

loans.name: Dao

texts.en:
Dao was born in a well-educated family. Her father and mother are teachers at secondary and primary schools respectively. In this picture, Dao is sitting next to her mother. She is the oldest child in her family and is studying at Banking Academy (http://hvnh.edu.vn/). 

Considering the demand of the market and her own passion, Dao has chosen to study Accounting and Audit. Dao expects that when she graduates, she will find a stable and well paid job. Consequently, she can provide better living conditions for her parents. However, as a requirement of her course, a laptop is essential, thus Dao is requesting a loan of VND 15,300,000 to buy a new laptop. Dao affirms that the new notebook computer would significantly increase her study results.

Through this program, she would like to express her appreciation to the help of people all around the world whose have contributed to this program. This has been supported a lot to the education of her individual and of the Vietnamese’s youth generation in general.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is 42 years old and married with six children.

Elena works hard to provide for her family. She runs a business to buy and sell charcoal in the Philippines and requests a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

Elena has previously borrowed and repaid 13 loans from NWTF. She has run a business to buy and sell charcoal for 10 years and earns additional income from buying  and selling firewood.

Elena aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira is 42 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by growing sugarcane in the Philippines. Elvira is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional fertilizer to sell.

Elvira has grown sugarcane for 20 years and earns additional income from buying and selling coconut wine.

She works tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream which is to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional fertilzer to sell.

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida is a 49-year-old married woman with six children; two are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Nida has a business to buy and sell bamboo in the Philippines. Nida requests a 7,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more bamboo to sell.

Nida has been in this business for 1 year. In the future, Nida would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more bamboo to sell

loans.name: Keng

texts.en:
Keng is 38 years old and a hard-working woman who owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops to make a living. Her husband has the same business and they have the support of their children. Having been in the business for almost 15 years, she is able to earn approximately KHR 20,000 per day, which she normally uses to provide for the needs of the family. 

At this time, Keng would like to borrow a loan from HKL to buy materials for the construction of a latrine, which is a form of sanitation improvement. Thanks to the water loan program with a special rate offered by Hattha Kaksekar Limited (HKL), Keng is encouraged to focus on ensuring healthy living conditions, to safeguard the health of her family and to protect the environment.

loans.use: to buy materials to construct a latrine.

loans.name: Islomjon

texts.en:
Islomjon was born in 1995. He is a smart and industrious man. Islomjon is not married and lives with his parents in the North part of Tajikistan. 

Now, he studies and lives in Moscow because he is a student in the first course at Russia Friendship University. He studies well and also he works after classes in an organization. He comes to Tajikistan for holidays. Islomjon must pay for tuition, and with this aim he is asking for a loan of $4,300. He awaits your support.

loans.use: To pay for tuition

loans.name: Esperanza Group

texts.es: El banco de emprendimiento ESPERANZA, está compuesto por ocho integrantes seis mujeres y dos varones,  todas ellas se dedican a distintas actividades, la presidenta del banco es la señora Rilda tiene 33 años, tiene dos hijos de las edades de siete años y un bebe de 10 meses,  ella se dedica a la venta de de libros, ella vende sus productos en distintas ferias de la ciudad de La Paz, este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la señora Rilda  va a usar este préstamo para compra de libros al por mayor y así surtir su negocio ya que se acerca la época de inicio de clases y esta época tiene mucha demanda, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es incrementar su mercadería, la señora Rilda enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la competencia y va a utilizar los beneficios en seguir comprando  mercadería y así de esta manera genera más ingresos económicos, se siente feliz ya agradecida por ella  ya que le dan una oportunidad para mejorar su negocio y también por sus compañeras de grupo ya que en muchos caso sacan solas adelante a su familias.
texts.en:
The start up bank, Esperanza, is made up of eight members, six women and two men. All of them make a living in different occupations.

The president of the bank is Rilda. She is 33 years old and has two children, a seven-year-old and a 10-month-old baby. She makes a living selling books. She sells her products at various markets in the city of La Paz. This is her first loan at the institution. Rilda will use this loan to buy books at wholesale and stock her business as classes are starting again soon and there is a lot of demand at this time.

She requested this loan to increase her merchandise. Rilda faces many challenges in her business including the competition. She will use the loan to continue purchasing merchandise and generate more income. She is happy and grateful that she has been given the chance to improve her business as well as for her fellow group members, who in many cases, are getting their families ahead by themselves.

loans.use: to buy merchandise and a variety of books at wholesale.

loans.name: Jecinta

texts.en:
Jecinta is 39 years old, married to Kilesi, and together they are blessed with six children, aged between 3 and 15 years, and they are also supporting three other children.

She is in a farming business, which she has practiced for sixteen years, and has applied for  her first loan from Vision Fund Kenya to enable her to buy fertilizer, pay for labor, and buy goats. With the anticipated profit, she plans to pay school fees.

In the near future, she hopes to prosper in her farming business to increase her income and also educate her children.

loans.use: buy fertilizer, pay for labor, and buy goats

loans.name: Debbie

texts.en:
Debbie wishes to keep on having good health, as she believes that health is wealth. Debbie is 58 years old, married and has three children. She has been selling grocery items in their village for 16 years. Debbie’s husband grows rice crops in their rice field. Profits earned from her store go toward their household needs.Sometimes, when she obtains greater income than usual, she uses it for another business as her additional income.

Debbie wanted to have enough capital in able to manage two businesses at once. Hence, she is requesting a loan of PHP 45,000 to buy grocery items to sell. She also plans to use her loan in buying raw meat and raw ingredients for her street food vending business. Income from the business will be used in education of her children and improving her financial stability.

loans.use: to buy grocery items to sell

loans.name: Marta

texts.en:
Marta is aged 52, married to a farmer, and blessed with three children. She has managed a business in which she sells frozen foods for almost eleven years and earns a net income of PHP 2,500 every week. Her income is usually spent on their payments on electric bills and purchasing their basic necessities. 

Due to financial constraints, she would like to avail herself of a loan amounting to PHP 35,000 to purchase hot dogs, cured pork, and sausages to sell. She's hoping that her business will continue to improve and earn more profits.

loans.use: To purchase hot dogs, cured pork,  and sausages to sell.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda strongly believes to her guiding principle: "what you sow is what you reap." After all the trials that she encountered, she is now reaping a comfortable way of living. She is 47 years old, married, and blessed with three children. Through vending of vegetables in the market, her children are successfully graduated from their schooling. 

But with her desire to support her children when they get married, Imelda continues to run her business, still aiming for growth. Imelda wanted to have additional capital for the business and believes by borrowing a loan of PHP 10,000, she will use the loan to buy vegetables like eggplant, bitter gourd, string beans and pepper to sell. She's hoping to improve  her business and make it profitable.

loans.use: to buy vegetables like eggplant, bitter gourd, string beans and pepper to sell.

loans.name: Tikarispa Group

texts.es:
La socia Rosa pertenece al banco comunal TIKARISPA, el banco está ubicado en Rumichaca Baja en el distrito de Urubamba, provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Urubamba.
La socia Rosa tiene 37 años de edad es casada y tiene 05 hijos, la socia alterna sus  actividades diarias con  el negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia vende diferentes tipos de productos como arroz, azúcar, leche, golosinas, gaseosas entre otros, la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada di a su negocio, la socia  la vez vende cerveza y chicha de jora(hecho a base de maíz),la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de cerveza para su negocio.
La persona que sale con la cara tapada no pertenece al banco comunal.
Los demás socios se dedican a la carpintería, crianza de animales menores, maestro constructor albañil, mototaxi.agricultura.
La socia se siente agradecida con el crédito otorgado y se compromete  a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Rosa belongs to the communal bank Tikarispa.  The bank is located in Rumichaca Baja, in the Urubamba district, Urubamba province, Urubamba region.

Group member Rosa is 37 years old.  She is married and has five children.  She alternates her time between her own activities and her business running a convenience store.  She sells different types of products such as rice, sugar, milk, snacks, and soda, among others.  She has been doing this work for a while now, and it is going well for her, thanks to the effort that she puts into it everyday.  She also sells beer and chicha de jora (a drink made from corn).  She is a responsible and diligent person, and this is the way that she gets her family ahead.

She is asking for the loan to buy beer for her business.  Rosa feels thankful for the loan and is committed to making her agreed-upon payments.

The other members of the bank work in carpentry, raising small animals, as a construction foreman, as a mototaxi driver, and in agriculture.

The person whose face is covered (in the photo) is not a member of the communal bank.

loans.use: to buy beer for her store

loans.name: Nezar

texts.en: Nezar is 21 years old. He is living in a rented house in a sector of Jordan called Rsaifeh with his younger sister and his parents. Nezar is studying for a bachelor's degree in Finance. He is in his second year and is planning to find a job in his field of study after graduation in order to start supporting his family financially. They are facing a financial crisis that is prohibiting them from paying for his upcoming semester fees. He has applied for this loan for this reason.

loans.use: To pay for his upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Boris

texts.en:
Boris is 31 years old and a married man who lives in the city Rustavi with his wife and little child. His wife is a homemaker and looks after her baby. Their only source of income is Boris's parents' help from the village where they run agricultural activities. Boris and his family have just settled in the city and he can't find any state job, despite his secondary education. 

Boris applied for this credit to MFO Credo. His request was approved in the framework of Start Up program, which is joint initiative with Kiva, permitting the rural poor to start or re-start businesses. Boris decided to start up a private activity. He will purchase a car that he has already chosen and start a taxi business. He will serve local people and will get daily returns. It will help Boris to satisfy his family's increased needs and provide financial stability.

loans.use: To buy a car and start a taxi business

loans.name: Suliko

texts.en:
Suliko is 52-year-old married man. He lives in a small village of Keda district with his wife and two children. Both of his children are employed at local supermarkets and get a small monthly income, which is the only source of income for the family. 

Suliko decided to start his own business and requested a loan. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo enables him to get a loan of $3000 for purchasing a minibus. When the minibus is purchased, he will be able to transport people and generate income. With increased income he will be able to cover everyday costs of the family and thus improve their living conditions. Suliko awaits your support.

loans.use: To purchase a minibus and transport people

loans.name: Murad

texts.en:
Murad is 22 years old. He is living in a rented house in a sector in Jordan called Irbid with his family, consisting of four siblings and his parents. Murad was working as a barber after school and currently works as a salesman at a mall in Jordan. 

He is studying for the bachelors’ degree, majoring in mechanical design. He is in his second half of his second year and is planning to find a job that suits his study field after graduation in order to start supporting his family financially as they are facing a financial crisis which is not helping them to pay for his upcoming semester fees. For this reason, he has applied for this loan.

loans.use: to pay for the upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Huikap Ningthou Shg Group

texts.en:
These fourteen women formed a group called Huikap Ningthou SHG to uplift them financially and economically. Ibetombi, with her hand raised, is the featured member of this group. She lives in Imphal East,which is 25 kms away from the city of Imphal in the Northeastern region of India. She takes care of and lives with her three daughters since her husband passed away. She is the sole income earner for the family.

Ibetombi used to make handmade mattresses. Since she could not afford to buy yarn, her customer paid for the yarn and she got only the making charges. It was very difficult to sustain the family with just a meager amount of income. Therefore, to access this loan she joined the group. With her first loan back in 2010 she bought yarn and started weaving traditional women's wrap-around skirts. She weaves and sells the products in the market town. She taught her daughters to weave as well and now they are also engaged in full-time weaving activities. 

From her second loan onwards, she was able to put aside savings from her earnings. She is very happy that she is doing well for the family and managing to cover the family's necessary expenditures. Now she has requested another loan to increase her inventory to sell. She wishes to weave the most desired and expensive wrap-around skirts with the third loan. Likewise, the rest of the group members have requested another loan to continue with their weaving activities.

loans.use: To buy more materials for weaving such as yarn and thread to generate more income.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily is 41 years old and married with three children, two are in school. Emily works very hard to provide for them.

Emily runs a general store in the Philippines and requests a 28,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional stock of rice, sugar, eggs, canned goods, and soft drinks, etc. to sell.

Emily has been in this business for 15 years.

In the future, Emily would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of rice, sugar, eggs, canned goods, and soft drinks, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Nilda

texts.en:
Nilda is 46 years old and married with two children.

Nilda works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requests a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more items like bread, coffee, sugar, cooking oil, and noodles, etc. to sell in her general store.

Nilda has previously borrowed and repaid 6 loans from NWTF. She has run the general store for 10 years and earns additional income from raising livestock.

Nilda aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items like bread, coffee, sugar, cooking oil, and noodles, etc. to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 29,500 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional stock of soap, shampoo, and coffee, etc. to sell in her general store.

Erlinda has been in this business for 7 years. Erlinda earns additional income from buying and selling charcoal.

Erlinda has sustained her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She wishes to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of soap, shampoo, and coffee, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Jasmin

texts.en:
As a married woman of five children, Jasmin works hard to support her family.

She has a manicure and pedicure business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from buying and selling livestock. Jasmin is borrowing 14,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase materials like nail cutters, nail polish, and acetone for her manicure and pedicure business.

Jasmin has sustained her business with 3 previous loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream which is to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase materials like nail cutters, nail polish, and acetone for her manicure and pedicure business.

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
Juanita is 46 years old and married with three children.

She works hard to provide for her family, running a general store in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 8000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock like rice, sugar, biscuits, eggs and canned goods to sell.

Juanita has borrowed and paid one loan from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for four years and also earns an income from farming sugarcane.

Juanita aspires to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock like rice, sugar, biscuits, eggs and canned goods

loans.name: Eleanor

texts.en:
Eleanor works hard to support her family. She is single and has a rice retailing business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for two years, now.

Eleanor requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF. She will use the loan to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell.

In the future, Eleanor would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Julio

texts.es:
Julio vive en casa propia  en un acabado de ladrillo y piso de cemento en la zona de Sopocachi de la ciudad de La Paz. El oficio que desempeña es de auditor independiente. Julio necesita el crédito para el mantenimiento de su herramienta de trabajo y así poder obtener mayores ingresos y poder cubrir  los gastos que tiene en su hogar.

El sueño de Julio es poder reunir el suficiente dinero para cubrir los gastos de su vejes.
texts.en:
Julio lives in a home of his own, made of brick and with a cement floor in the Sopocachi area of La Paz.  He works as an independent auditor and needs this loan to maintain his work equipment so he can increase his income and cover his household expenses.

Julio’s dream is to be able to save up enough money for his old age.

loans.use: to maintain his work equipment.

loans.name: Mehrangez

texts.en:
Mehrangez is a young and glorious woman. She is 18 years old. Mehrangez is not married. 

She is going to organize her own business and be a successful business lady. She wants to organize the new business with sewing because she can sew women's national dresses. 

Mehrangez took part in a course called "To Get Ahead" in a women's organization. She got a certificate. Mehrangez is smart and she showed good knowledge in the course process. She is asking for a loan of 1000 somoni to buy a sewing machine. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine for organizing a new business

loans.name: El Gran Chaparral Group

texts.es:
