Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “EL GRAN CHAPARRAL”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Paucartambo, perteneciente a la provincia de Paucartambo y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Olinda  ella es soltera y tiene 32 años y tiene; La socia trabaja en su negocio de venta y crianza de animales y tambien la socia tiene un terreno donde cultiva papa y maiz y los vende en los diferentes mercados, la socia tambien  cría los cuyes y gallinas los hace crecer y engordar y luego los vende en las diferentes ferias, por medio de este pequeño negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los cuyes y gallinas. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar cuyes y gallinas y alimentos para los cuyes y gallinas.
 
 
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de agricultura, negocio de venta de granos, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de animales.


La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These members belong to the communal bank El Gran Chaparral.  This bank is located in the Paucartambo district, Paucartambo province, Cusco region.

Señora Olinda is a member of the group.  She is 32 years old and single.  She works in her business raising and selling animals, and also has a plot of land where she grows potatoes and corn.  She sells them in various markets.  She also raises guinea pigs and chickens.  She raises them, fattens them, and then sells them in the markets.  Because of this business she is able to get her children ahead.  

Her dream is to have a stand or shop where she can sell the guinea pigs and chickens. Señora Olinda is thankful to everyone who has helped fulfill her dream in this manner, and she is committed to making her payments on the schedule that was set up. She is asking for a loan to buy guinea pigs and chickens, as well as feed for them.

The other group members work in agriculture, selling grain, running a convenience store, and selling animals.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs and chickens, as well as feed for the guinea pigs and chickens.

loans.name: Sohib

texts.ru:
Сохибу 44 года. Он имеет большой опыт в разведении кур, домашнего скота и  переработке  молока. Он живет со своей семьей  в сельской местности.  Важным источником дохода для семейства  является животноводство.
Жена  и дети  помогают ему в повседневной деятельности в разведении скота и производстве молочных изделий.  Сохиб имеет четверых  детей и для того чтобы удовлетворить потребности семьи  в питании, одежде и обучении детей , а также для поддержки пожилых родителей   ему нужно увеличить фонд зарплаты. Для этого Сохибу нужно увеличить поголовье скота и подготовиться к зимнему сезону т.е  сделать запас кормов. 
 С этой целю Сохиб обратился за кредитом в организацию Арванд.  Этот заем существенно поможет в достижении цели.  Семейство Сохиба заранее выражает благодарность   МДО «Арванд» в поддержке его бизнеса.
texts.en: Sohib is 44 years old. He has extensive experience in raising chickens and livestock as well as dairy production. Sohib's large family lives on a farm in the countryside and their main source of income are their animals. Sohib's wife and children help manage the family farm and produce dairy products. Sohib has four children and in order to provide for their nutrition, clothing and education, as well as help his aging parents, Sohib must increase his monthly profits. To increase his profits Sohib has to expand his herd and prepare them for the winter by stocking up on feed. In order to achieve these goals Sohib has turned to "Arvand" for a loan, which will make his goal a reality. Sohib's family are all very grateful to microfinance bank "Arvand" for the help.

loans.use: to buy a cattle and cattle feed

loans.name: Marhabo

texts.ru:
Мархабо женщина в возрасте 46 лет, живет в г.Канибадаме Согдийской области. Она замужем, имеет троих  детей.  Мархабо занимается приготовлением и реализацией гороха  на центральном рынке  города.  Имеет очень большой опыт в этой сфере деятельности так как, она занимается этим бизнесом несколько лет.  Её муж работает плотником а в свободное время помогает жене.  Бизнес  Мархабо стабильный.  Но доход от этого бизнеса  и зарплата мужа не может удовлетворить возрастающие потребности  этой большой семьи,  так как дети растут и вместе с ними растут потребности на  обучение, питание и одежду.  
В данное время Мархабо обратилась в организацию Арванд за кредитом. Так как наступили холода Мархабо нуждается в печке. На полученный кредит Мархабо планирует купить печку чтобы отапливать свой дом, и жить со своей семьей в теплоте и уюте.  Она очень надеется,что Арванд финансово ее  поддержит.
texts.en:
Marhabo is a 46 year old woman from Kanibadam in Sogdiy region. She is married and has three children. Marhabo sells peas at the central market of the town. She has extensive experience in retail as she has been working for several years. Her husband is a woodworker who helps his wife in his spare time. Marhabo's business is very stable, but the profits from her business and her husband's salary are not enough to pay for the needs of their large family. Marhabo's children are growing and their needs for education, clothing and nutrition are growing as well. 

Currently Marhabo is requesting a loan from Arvand to purchase a heating stove, which she will use to heat her home. She hopes that Arvand will be able to provide financial assistance.

loans.use: to buy a stove for heating

loans.name: Malika

texts.ru:
Малике 54 года.  Она замужем  и  имеет троих детей и уже подрастают внуки.  Основной  деятельностью  ее  семьи  является  разведение  скота. Невестки помогают ей в этом  деле. Но  фонд  зарплаты  семьи  тем  не  менее  не  достаточен  чтобы  содержать большую семью. И так как в этой семье мужчины являются главными добытчиками ,  муж и двое сыновей вынуждены были  уехать  на заработки в  Россию.   Малика   старается  как может и помогает  семье.  
Семья Малики растет  и поэтому надо расширять жилье. Также с приближением зимы  необходимо  запастись  топливом  для обогрева дома. Малика  хочет взять кредит для достройки дома и с этой целью обратилась в "Арванд". На полученный кредит она  планирует купить строительные материалы.
 Малика  более трех лет  сотрудничает с «Арванд» и имеет хорошую кредитную историю. Малика очень довольна этим сотрудничеством. Она  благодарна,  что  есть такие организации, которые при  необходимости  готовы оказать помощь.
texts.en:
Malika is 54 years old, married and has three children and a few grandchildren. Her family's main source on income is livestock and Malika's daughters-in-law help her with the animals. Unfortunately, livestock and dairy sales are not enough to provide for a large family, so all the men are now migrant workers in Russia, making money for everyone back home. Malika wishes she could help her family more, as the family is growing and the house needs to be expanded. In the face of winter the family also needs to stock up on fuel to warm the house. Malika would like to take out a loan to expand the house and has turned to "Arvand" for a loan. She plans to use the loan to buy building materials.

Malika has been working with Arvand for three years and has a good credit history. She is happy with the loan conditions and is grateful that there is an organization which is ready to provide help for people in need.
.

loans.use: to buy building materials

loans.name: Bishnu Priya Group

texts.en:
Kortipadar is a rural village in Nuapada district in Odisha, India. In the year 2013, five active women entrepreneurs from this village formed a group named Bishnu Priya to access a loan from Mahashakti Foundation to expand their existing business. Nakeshi is one of them. The lady standing in the middle of the photo with her hand raised is Nakeshi. She is an energetic lady of 44 years who lives with her husband, one son and a daughter in-law. 
Nakeshi has been running a paddy-milling unit in her village for the last 10 years. Apart from that, she is also cultivating vegetables and selling them in the daily market in the nearest town. Her husband and son are helping her in these businesses. She earns a daily net income of 300 INR from these businesses. Out of this income, she has been able to manage her household expenses in a decent manner. So Nakeshi is planning to increase her income by expanding the business. Looking into the demand of the locality, with the present loan, she wants to purchase a wheat roller milling machine. She is certain that this will generate a handsome income for her. With a portion of the loan, she also wants to purchase seeds and fertilizer for her vegetable cultivation. Nakeshi hopes to save enough money to build a permanent house for her paddy and wheat roller unit.

The four other members of the group are Tapaswini, Sarojini, Basanti and Sabitri who are running an electrical repair center and vegetable vending businesses, respectively.

loans.use: To purchase a wheat roller machine, seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Diana María

texts.es: Diana, con 36 años de edad, trabaja como comerciante independiente desde hace varios años, inició realizando manicure y pedicure a sus amigos y vecinos, posteriormente se le presentó la oportunidad de ubicarse en un local comercial en el centro de la ciudad y allí comenzó a vender mercancía por catálogo y ropa por encargos. Actualmente visita personalmente a sus clientes, por lo que no tiene un horario de trabajo establecido y, el local cumple la función de bodega y oficina. Solicita el apoyo del crédito para invertirlo en la compra de mercancía al por mayor (perfumería, jeans, blusas, chaquetas, zapatos, productos por catálogo, entre otros), así podrá tener mayor variedad para ofrecer a sus clientes y aumentar sus ventas en la temporada de navidad, aprovechando la ventaja de que los productos que ofrece son de muy buena calidad y económicos, haciendo más fácil su labor e incrementando su nivel de ingresos. Diana desea seguir trabajando con empeño y dedicación, pues es consciente de que en sus manos está su futuro, en el que anhela tener su casa propia y fortalecer su negocio, dándole permanencia en el tiempo; lo que le garantizará una entrada estable de recursos para aportar al sostenimiento del hogar y disfrutar una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Diana is 36 years old and has worked as an independent merchant for several years.  She started doing manicures and pedicures for her friends and neighbors and later she got the opportunity to set up in commercial space in the city center.  There she also started selling merchandise via catalog and clothing to order.  She visits her customers, doesn’t have a set working schedule, and the location serves as both a store and an office.  She is asking for a loan to buy merchandise in quantity (perfume, jeans, blouses, jackets, shoes, catalog items, and other things) so she can have a greater variety to offer to her customers, and increase her sales over the Christmas season.  She wants to take advantage of the fact that her products are of good quality and inexpensive, which makes her work easier and increases her income.  Diana wants to continue working with dedication and enthusiasm.  She knows that the future is in her hands and she wants to have a home of her own and strengthen her business, making it more permanent.  This will guarantee that she will have stable resources and enjoy a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Nandidra

texts.en:
Nandidra has always loved fashion.  As a hobby, she would coordinate clothing and accessories for family and friends, but professionally, she has experience with hair care, hair products and accessories. 

Following her passion, the young Nandidra opened her retail business four years ago when she was 20 years old. D’s Couture Co now offers clothing, jewelry, accessories, and hair care products.

Though she is a strong businesswoman, Nandidra needed a loan to continue serving the women in her community and reach a larger market, so she visited Accion Texas Inc. for a business loan. 

After hearing about the nonprofit organization from an Accion employee, she decided to apply for a loan.  Once approved for the loan, Nandidra was able to expand her business and services to offer a wider array of products while publicizing her business.

loans.use: to purchase inventory and market her business.

loans.name: Diego Israel

texts.es:
Diego tiene 21 años de edad es soltero no tiene hijos, vive con los padres en la ciudad de Ventanas provincia de los ríos.

La VRC 27 DE MAYO sus miembros se ddeican a la agricultura todos viven en el sector del recinto el Cadial Practicamente se han criado en esa zona se dedican a labores agrícolas u Pecuarias en su mayoria.

Diego  se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz. Solicita el crédito para comprar urea, insecticidas, líquido mata maleza y una bomba para fumigar. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar lo necesario para las siembras.

Las compras y las ventas las realiza en Ventanas.

El sueño es seguir sembrando para aumentar los cultivos. 

En el tiempo libre le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Diego is 21 years old, single, and has no children. He lives with his parents in the city of Ventanas in Los Ríos Province.

The members of the Communal Bank "27 de Mayo" (May 27th) are devoted to agriculture. All of them live in the area around the neighborhood of Cadial Practicamente where they grew up. Most of the members engage in farming and livestock breeding.

Diego is a farmer who grows corn and rice. He is requesting a loan in order to buy urea, insecticides, liquid weed killer, and a fumigation pump. With the help of this loan, he will be able to buy what he needs for his crops. His purchases and sales are conducted in Ventanas.

Diego's dream is to continue planting so that he can increase his crops. In his free time, he enjoys playing sports.

loans.use: to buy urea, insecticides, liquid weed killer, and a fumigation pump.

loans.name: Hang

texts.en:
Hang, 36 years old, is married and has two sons. Her husband is a worker in a local factory. She supports her family through the income she earns from processing and selling coffee beans at home. She has been in this business for 15 years. They live in Ho Chi Minh City. 

Hang intends to take a loan to increase her working capital and buy a larger quantity of coffee beans for processing and selling. The additional capital will enable her to increase her production for sales. She hopes her business runs smoothly and will help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy coffee beans for processing and selling to her customers.

loans.name: Utkirjon

texts.ru: Уткирчон добродушный и трудолюбивый мужчина в возрасте 45 лет. Он женат и имеет четверых детей. Живёт он со своей семьёй в небольшом кишлаке. Он очень любит свою семью и делает всё возможное для обеспечения своих детей всем необходимым. С юности он обучился делу, которое сейчас и продолжает и получает от этого доход. Он занимается посевом сельхозкультуры. От этого бизнеса он получает приемлемый доход. Также, чтобы иметь дополнительный доход, он отправил своего старшего сына  в Россию на заработки. Сам Уткирчон сотрудничает с Арванд вот уже более 5 лет и является ответственным клиентом. В данный момент ему необходимо закупить некоторые удобрения для земли, поэтому он обратился в Арванд и хочет получить кредит на покупку минеральных удобрений. Он заранее благодарит Арванд за финансовую поддержку.
texts.en: Utkirjon is a kind and hardworking, 45 year-old man.  He is married and has four children.  He lives with his family in a small village.  He loves his family very much and does everything possible to provide his children with all of the necessities.  Since his youth, he has learned the business that he runs now and earns an income from.  He is involved in sowing agricultural crops.  He earns a decent income from this business.  Also, to have an additional income, he sent his oldest son to Russia for work.  Utkirjon has been partnering with Arvand for over 5 years and is a responsible client.  At the present time, he needs to buy some fertilizers for soil and this is why he came to Arvand, and wants to obtain a loan to buy mineral fertilizers.  He thanks Arvand in advance for the financial support.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Behruz

texts.ru: Бехруз жизнерадостный и добродушный парень в возрасте 24 лет. Он женат и пока имеет одного ребёнка. Вместе со своей семьёй он живёт в маленьком кишлаке. Бехруз с малых лет помогал своему отцу пасти скот на пастбище. И сейчас сам он занимается бизнесом животноводством, и это дело приносит ему доход. Также он занимается и земледелием и по совместительству работает в военной части. Каждый бизнес приносит ему доход и он хочет как можно больше расширять своё дело, чтобы получать больше прибыли. На сегодня он имеет несколько голов скота. Его жена также помогает ему выращивать скот. Развивая бизнес животноводства Бехруз хочет увеличить доход семьи, а также построить новый коровник. Для этого Бехруз обратился в Арванд и хочет получить кредит на покупку несколько голов скота. Он надеется на положительный результат и заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку.
texts.en: Behruz is a happy and kind, 24 year-old young man.  He is married and has one child for now.  He lives with his family in a small village.  Since a young age, Behruz has helped his father to take livestock to a pasture.  And now, he is involved in the animal husbandry business himself, and this business yields him an income.  Also, he is involved in farming and concurrently works at a military base.  Every business yields him an income, and he wants to expand his business as much as possible to earn more profit.  Today, he has several heads of livestock.  His wife also helps to raise livestock.  Behruz wants to increase the family's earnings by developing the animal husbandry business and also wants to build a new cowshed.  Behruz came to Arvand for this purpose and wants to obtain a loan to buy several heads of livestock.  He hopes for a positive result and thanks Arvand in advance for the support.

loans.use: to buy livestock

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 21 years old and is married. She has two children. She earns her income through the sale of crops and livestock, and she receives a monthly wage as a Community Knowledge Worker (CKW). CKWs are trusted community members, who provide agricultural data and advice to rural farmers in their local area, including information about the weather, market prices, crop diseases, and agricultural tools.

On her land, Grace grows maize, beans, coffee, vegetables, and bananas. She also has pigs, goats and chickens. Grace has served as a CKW for the past two years, and she looks forward to renewing her CKW contract for the next three years.

As a CKW, she will use the materials in her business-in-a-box (smartphone, solar charging set, and weighing scale) to disseminate vital agricultural information to other members of her village. The information she supplies will help them to improve their crop yields and increase their incomes. With the additional money she will earn as a CKW, Grace will meet family needs, like buying decent clothes for her children, and she will invest in her farm. Her biggest dream in life is to become a prominent business woman, dealing in agricultural products in her district.

loans.use: To purchase a mobile phone, a solar charging set, and a weighing scale

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is 30 years old and lives in Caldwell; she is unmarried and has two children between the ages of 3 and 10. Her fiancée works at a tire shop. Their children are in school and live at home. 

For the past six years, Lydia has been selling shoes in the local market. One of the main challenges she  faces is that the  prices of shoes are getting higher every day because of the inflation in the USD rate. Sometime the consumers are fewer. She is requesting a loan to purchase more shoes for her business. She plans to save and build her house.

loans.use: to purchase more shoes for her business,

loans.name: Siempre Unidas De Smp Group

texts.es: Daria tiene 45 años ella es integrante del grupo “SIEMPRE UNIDAS DE SMP” alcancía conformada por  09 mujeres trabajadoras. Daria es comerciante tiene una bodega donde vende diversos productos entre abarrotes y bebidas. Su negocio tiene varios años funcionando y le ha permitido ayudar a su esposo con la manutención del hogar. Daría ha solicitado este préstamo para implementar su bodega con la compra de productos  ya que desea aumentar sus ventas en estas fechas que hay mucha demanda por parte de sus clientes, por las  noches tiene otro negocio de venta de comidas. Daría se siente feliz por el progreso que tiene y muy agradecida con los inversionistas KIVA que  permiten que ella y su grupo comunal accedan a este préstamo. Daria  es la ultima de la derecha viste chompa color fucsia.
texts.en: Daria is 45 years old. She’s a member of the communal bank “Siempre Unidas de SMP” which is made up of 9 women. Daria is a retailer and has a small store where she sells various items like groceries and drinks. She’s been running this business for some time, and it’s allowed her to help her husband with household costs. Daria has asked for this loan for the purchase of goods since she’d like to increase her sales. In this season there’s a lot of demand from her clients. At night she has another business selling food. Daria is happy about the progress she’s made, and she’s grateful for the Kiva lenders who’ve allowed her and her group to get this loan. In the photo she’s on the far right in the fuchsia sweater.

loans.use: to buy products for her store.

loans.name: Tunas Rahayu Group

texts.en: To continue and to increase their businesses, the Tunas Rahayu group decided to borrow another loan. They asked for the same loan size. This loan will be used to purchase piglets and feed. Ni Putu, the head of the group, has two school-age children. She lives with her husband. Ni Putu used her new loan to purchase two superior piglets and feed. The price for local piglets is down now, so she decided to borrow the same size loan. People prefer superior piglets. She hopes that in the next six months, the price will up again and she can earn a satisfactory price.

loans.use: to purchase two superior piglets and feed.

loans.name: Robajon

texts.ru: Робачон молодая мама четверых детей. Ей 40 лет. Старшему ребенку 5 лет, а младшему только годик. Ее муж работает маляром на стройках. Робачон, чтобы помочь мужу обеспечить семью занимается торговлей мужских штанин. У Робачон не хватает средств для аренды прилавки или место на рынке, поэтому она разместила свой товар на земле застеленном тканью. Ее товар становиться не сезонной одеждой и Робахон просит кредит, чтобы купить более теплую одежду для перепродажи. Робахон надеется на Ваше понимание. Ведь для нее это хоть и маленькая, но важная и значительная помощь семье и семейному бюджету.
texts.en: Robajon is a young mother with four children. She is 40 years old, but her eldest is five and her youngest is only one year old. Robajon's husband works as a painter on construction sites. Robajon helps her husband provide for the family by selling man's pants. She has not money to rent a market stall or a space at the market, so she displays the pants on a sheet of fabric she spread on the ground. Now the summer pants she has are out of season and Robajon needs to take out a loan to purchase winter pants for resale. Robajon hopes for your understanding, because even though her business is small, it provides a significant and important contribution to her family's budget.

loans.use: to purchase clothing

loans.name: Adan David

texts.es:
Adan David tiene 30 años de edad, vive junto a sus dos hijos en el distrito de Oyotún, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, costa norte del Perú.

El se dedica a brindar el servicio de carga, trasladando mercadería a los caseríos aledaños a su distrito en una moto-carguera, ocasionalmente se dedica a las labores agrícolas, ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 000 nuevos soles para comprar repuestos para darle mantenimiento a su vehículo.
texts.en:
Elizabet is 35 years old, she lives with her husband and her son in the Morropon district, an area characterized by its carob tree woods. Her community is located two hours away from the town of Piura, on the Peruvian northern coast, and they engage in agriculture, trading and animal breeding.

She sells beer and her activity is located in her house; she also sells plantain, a product she harvest in the lot of land she inherited form  her father. She has requested a loan of 1000 pen to buy her own bottles to sell beer, in order to avoid any problems in selling her product.

loans.use: Compra de respuestos para vehículo.

loans.name: Jose

texts.es: El señor José y su esposa son personas mayores,estan casados viven en una casa alquilada y tienen tres dependientes económicos que son sus hijos. El señor trabaja como chofer particular de un camión  y su esposa se dedica a la actividad agrícola, siembra y cosecha papa y arveja generalmente como 10 y 20 arrobas por año. Ambos manifiestan que son personas muy trabajadores y responsables en su actividad, quieren superarse e incrementar su producción agrícola, para tal efecto se ven la necesidad de solicitar un crédito para comprar un terreno agrícola que está vendiendo su vecino en su comunidad, de tal forma podrá obtener una mayor producción y lograra mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en: José and his wife are older. They are married and live in a rented house with their three children who are financially dependent on them. José works as a truck driver, and his wife does agricultural activities, planting and harvesting potatoes and peas, generally at 10 and 20 pounds a year. Both are hard workers and are responsible in their activities. They want to excel and increase their agricultural production. For this purpose, they see the need to obtain a loan to buy agricultural land that their neighbor is selling. This way, they will have greater production and will improve their quality of life.

loans.use: to buy agricultural land

loans.name: Zarif

texts.en:
Zarif is 28 years old. He lives in a rural village in the northern part of Tajikistan. He lives with his wife and son. 

Zarif requested loans from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected because of his low income and the family’s poor living conditions.

The only source of income for the family is from animal husbandry. Zarif feeds cattle at his home. He grows corn for his cattle on his home's property. 

Zarif wants to develop his business but he does not have enough money to buy more cattle. This loan will help him to increase the number of cattle that he owns and earn profits to improve his living conditions. He awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy cattle to increase the size of his herd.

loans.name: Incris Elena

texts.es: Doña Incris es madre de 2 hijos,  mujer trabajadora, con su actividad de comercio ha logrado independencia económica y también aportar a los estudios de su hija la cual ya es profesional y trabaja. Reconocida en la zona por la venta de bolsos, ropa, maquillaje, perfumes y cualquier cosa que le soliciten. Ha mantenido su negocio por más de 4 años en conjunto con su hermana, gracias a su clientela que la prefieren por los buenos precios y calidad. Tiene 5 años de experiencia, su actividad esta consolidada y un mercado en expansión. Su producto es de calidad y desea este crédito para comprar suficiente mercadería que le solicita su clientela. Eligió Fundación Mujer por la baja tasa de interés que ofrece.
texts.en:
Doña Incris is the mother of two children and a hardworking woman. She is a merchant who was able to achieve financial independence and also help with her daughter's education. Her daughter is already a professional who is working.

Incris is known in the area for selling purses, clothing, makeup, perfumes, and any other items that are requested. She has maintained her business for four years with the help of her sister and her customers who prefer to do business with her because of the good prices and quality that she offers. Incris has five years of experience and her business is already established with an expanding market. Since her products are of quality, she wants to request a loan so that she can buy a sufficient stock of merchandise that her customers are requesting.

Incris chose Fundación Mujer because of the low interest rate that was offered.

loans.use: to buy merchandise requested by her customers.

loans.name: Arevik

texts.en:
Arevik lives in Vanadzor town. She has been involved in the retail business for five years, selling clothing and dress-making accessories to locals in her area. She is a very enthusiastic woman who works hard to sustain her living. Taking into consideration the current high demand for winter clothing, Arevik decided to purchase a new stock of supplies to sell to her customers.

Arevik has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The business start-up loan program provides loans with flexible conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. This loan will greatly assist Arevik in purchasing a new stock of clothing to sell to clients. She waits for your support.

loans.use: to pay for a new stock of clothing to sell to customers.

loans.name: Rudy

texts.en:
Rudy is 58, married, and blessed with three children. He has been in the farming business for almost eight years; with this, he earned a net income of PHP 30,000 last cropping. His income is usually spent on the daily expenditures and school allowances of his grandchildren. 

He would like to avail a loan amounting to PHP 30,000 to purchase seedlings, fertilizers, and pesticides for his rice farm. He's hoping that his requested loan will be granted so that he can increase his net profits more.

loans.use: to purchase seedlings, fertilizers, and pesticides for his rice farm.

loans.name: Beverly

texts.en:
This is Beverly, 38, resident of Intramuros, Manila, Philippines. She is married to Reynaldo, a laborer, and they have children. She and her husband manage their household while operating the business. She is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Beverly operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling them by the piece. She also has a canteen and a direct selling business. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

She is requesting a PHP 30,000 loan to help her continue the operation of her business. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand her product inventory.

Beverly hopes to be more successful in business and dreams that her children will finish their studies.  She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
This is Rosa. She previously accessed a 30,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education and in their personal, household, and business expenditures.
 
She would like to apply for another 30,000 PHP loan for her to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages, and other products to add in her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and children’s education expense. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Rosa dreams to be more successful in business, and hopes that her family will always be in good health. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items, such as toiletries and beverages, needed in her business.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is a 42 year-old married woman with four children. The family resides in a rural community and makes their living through farming.

To earn additional income, Lolita works in a direct selling business that deals with AVON and other beauty products. She wants to acquire more stock of these products to sell but her capital is not sufficient.  Therefore, she is asking for a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy more stock of lotion, perfume, lipstick, face powder, jewelry, shoes and underwear to sell in her community.  She is hoping that her loan will enable her to improve her business and educate her children.

loans.use: to buy more stock of items such as lotion, perfume, lipstick, face powder, jewelry, shoes and underwear to sell.

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia is thankful for the financial assistance extended to her. It was helpful, not only in her business, but also in her everyday expenditures. There are some challenges in business, like customers not paying, but with the help of God, she is able to continue her business. She works hard to provide for her family's needs.

Letecia would like to apply for another loan, in the amount of PHP 20,000, to buy additional stocks of biscuits and dried fish needed for her business. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell should result in greater profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Letecia hopes to be more successful in her business and dreams to have good health. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from studying the Word of God.

* All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional stocks of biscuits and dried fish needed for her business.

loans.name: Nena

texts.en:
Nena is thankful for the financial assistance extended to her. She was able to buy the ingredients needed in her canteen. Her loan is also helpful in the education of her child, while her income from business is assisting their everyday household income. She continues to work to provide for their everyday needs.

She would like to apply for another 50,000 PHP loan for her to purchase ingredients like pork, eggs, rice, noodles, ham, and other products needed in her business. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and the educational expenses of her child. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Nena hopes to be more successful in her business, and dreams that her child will finish his education. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week, and she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for ingredients like pork, eggs, rice, noodles, ham, and other products needed in her business.

loans.name: Lizylda

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Lizylda works hard to support her family.

She has a general store in the Philippines and earns additional income from raising livestock.  Lizylda is borrowing 6,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional items like canned goods, noodles, cooking oil, soft-drinks, bread, and coffee to sell in her general store.

Lizylda has sustained her business with her past 2 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, which is to build and expand her business and secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items like canned goods, noodles, cooking oil, soft-drinks, bread, and coffee, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 16,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more stock of items to sell like soap, coffee, eggs, and canned goods for her general store.

Jocelyn has been in this business for 20 years. Jocelyn earns additional income from sugarcane farming and motorcycle transport.

Jocelyn has sustained her business through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She wishes to save enough money to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy more stock of items to sell like soap, coffee, eggs, and canned goods.

loans.name: Julia

texts.en:
Julia is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a retail gasoline business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase gasoline to sell.

Julia has been in this business for 10 years. She earns more income from a general store and farming rice.

Julia has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to build a house for her family in the future.

loans.use: to purchase gasoline to sell

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a buy-and-sell fruit business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy more fruit to sell.

Elsie has been in this business for eight years. She earns more income from a general store.

Elsie has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more fruit to sell

loans.name: Saturnina

texts.en:
Saturnina is 34 years old and married. She has two children. With both of her children in school, Saturnina works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for five years, selling a variety of items such as noodles, canned goods, sugar, coffee, eggs, and bread.

She has requested a PHP 21,000 loan through NWTF. She will use it to purchase more items to sell in her general store.

In the future, Saturnina would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Lizel

texts.en:
Lizel is 28 years old and married. She has two children. She earns a living by buying and selling livestock in the Philippines. She has been buying and selling livestock for 22 years, and she earns additional income from keeping a general store.

Lizel is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF. She will use the loan to purchase additional livestock to sell.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional livestock to sell

loans.name: Windy Mae

texts.en:
Windy Mae is 17 years old and studying for a Bachelor of Science in Information Technology. She is currently on her second of a four-year course.

Windy Mae needs 5,000 PHP to pay for higher education for the second semester of the school year 2013-14.

When she graduates, Windy Mae plans to be gainfully employed so she can help improve the quality of life for her family.

loans.use: to pay for higher education costs.

loans.name: Lina

texts.en:
Lina works hard to support her family. She is married, and has had a restaurant business in the Philippines for 25 years.

Lina requested a PHP 24,000 loan through NWTF to purchase ingredients like meat, vegetables, fish, etc.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients like meat, vegetables, fish, etc

loans.name: Linda

texts.en:
Linda works hard to support two children. She is married, and has a buy and sell rice business in the Philippines.

Linda requested a PHP 7,500 loan through NWTF to buy a solar lamp.

She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to have backup light in case of an emergency.

Linda is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to purchase a solar lamp

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es:
Pedro es un hombre casado de 32 años de edad , quien vive junto a su esposa y sus dos hijas la primera de 2 años y la segunda de tres años quienes viven en el Departamento de Sololá.
Pedro comenta que tiene una tienda de zapatos en la ciudad capital y viaja dos veces por semana para verificar como va su negocio y los otros días trabaja como jornalero en el campo. Como también ha tomado la iniciativa de seguir estudiando ya que por el momento estudia enfermería en Quetzaltenango, esto lo realiza con el propósito de brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia ya que cuando él era pequeño  no tuvo la oportunidad de tener a sus padres porque fallecieron.
Ahora por el progreso que ha tenido su negocio en cuanto a sus ganancias ha decidido terminar la construcción de su vivienda,  por lo que está solicitando un préstamo de Q 5,000.00 para la compra de materiales para acabados de construcción. Este préstamo lo pagara con el negocio de zapatos que cuenta ahora.
Su mayor sueño es graduarse de enfermero y poder terminar la construcción de su vivienda para que su familia viva mejor.
texts.en:
Pedro, 32, is married and lives with his wife and two daughters, ages two and three in the Solola region.  

Pedro has a shoe store in the capital city and travels there twice a week to oversee the business.  The rest of the time he works as a hired farm worker.  He is also continuing his education and currently studying nursing in Quetzaltenango.  His aim is to improve his family's quality of life because when he was young he was not fortunate enough to have his parents around long before they died.

Now, due to the progress his business has had as far as profits are concerned, he wants to finish building his house.  He is requesting a loan in the amount of 5,000 GTQ to buy construction finishing materials.  He will pay back the loan with income from his shoe business.

His greatest desire is to get his nursing degree and finish his house for his family's comfort.

loans.use: To buy construction materials.

loans.name: Garib Nawaz Group

texts.en:
The name of this Joint Liability Group is Garib Nawaz. All the members of this group belong to a minority community. This group was formed in the year 2013 and is composed of four active and able women from Khariar town in Nuapada district in Odisha, India. Akila is one of the members of this group. She is standing second from left with her hand raised in the photo. She is a very headstrong, confident lady.  She is 37 years old and lives with her husband, two sons (14 & 10 years old) and one daughter (12 years old) in a rented house. 

Akila has been running a tailoring unit with two sewing machines in her house for the last five years. Her husband is running a readymade garment selling business in the footpath in Khariar town. Akila earns a monthly income of 4,000 INR from the above business, which is very little to manage her family's educational expenses and other household expenses. So Akila want to earn some more income by expanding her business. With the present loan, she wants to purchase a pico (sewing) machine and some cloth to sew school uniforms for the students. She hopes this will help her to increase her income. Akila hopes to save some money to construct a house of her own.

The other three members of this group are Sabana, Rajiaa and Roshan who have poultry, tailoring and footwear businesses, respectively.

loans.use: To pay for a sewing machine and cloth.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
This is Editha. She previously accessed an 8,000 PHP loan that she used to buy more newspapers for her newsstand. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, house hold and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 8,000 PHP loan for her to buy more newspapers for her newsstand. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result for better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her sustain her daily needs and educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Editha hopes that her business will continue to grow and dreams that her children will finish their studies. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work. This is where she finds strength and inspiration by the word of God that they study as a group.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for more newspapers for her newsstand.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es:
Pedro tiene 52 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en el distrito de San Felipe, una comunidad ubicada en la carretea Belaunde Terry, lo que le ha permitido a su población a dedicarse a la venta de comida preparada a los pasajeros que transitan por la zona, comercio de frutas y cultivo de los mismos, ubicado a dos horas de la ciudad Jaén, costa norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la venta y cultivo de lima desde hace varios años, cuenta con clientela considerable en la zona, ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 500 nuevos soles para la compra de de abonos y de esta manera, mejorar la calidad de sus cultivos de lima para ofrecerlos a un mejor precio, generando mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Pedro is 52 years old, and lives with his wife in the San Felipe district, a community located on the Belaunde Terry highway, 2 hours away from Jaén on the north coast of Peru. This has allowed the population to find work selling prepared food to travelers passing through the area, growing and selling fruit. 

Pedro has worked growing and selling limes for several years, and has a considerable clientele in the area. He is asking for a loan of 1500 nuevos soles to buy fertilizers. This will improve the quality of his lime crops and he will be able to offer them at a better price, increasing his income for his family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer to maintain his crops.

loans.name: Mavjuda

texts.en:
Mavjuda is an industrious woman. Born in 1957, she is married and has four children. Mavjuda has been busy selling food items more than 10 years. She sells her goods, such as chocolates and biscuits, near the pedagogical college. She also works as security in the college at night. Her husband is a driver and her two sons work in Russia. 

Mavjuda and her family live in an old house. She wants to repair the house and with this goal she came to IMON. She is asking for a loan of 7,500 Tajikistani somoni (TJS) to buy building materials for home repairs. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy building materials to repair her house.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María, de 28 años, está casada y tiene un hijo de 7 años, vive en su casa propia junto a su familia. María se dedica al alquiler de mototaxi, el cual da a un chofer cada día muy temprano; también se tiene una segunda ocupación que es la venta de zapatos y sandalias, de manera quincenal o mensual, dependiendo de la demanda de sus productos. Para obtener su mercadería viaja a otra ciudad  en autobús por mas de 20 horas, desde ahí realiza el mismo viaje de retorno trayendo gran cantidad de artículos para venderlos entre sus familiares, amigos y demás personas. Realiza sus ventas de forma ambulatoria, recorriendo todos los días las principales calles de la ciudad en busca de clientes que deseen comprar algo de lo que ofrece o en ocasiones lo hace por pedidos hechos con anticipación. Desde que comenzó en éste negocio le ha ido muy bien gracias a su carisma y a la calidad de cada uno de los artículos que vende. En esta oportunidad solicitara S/.2000, por tanto agradece a quienes hacen posible su crédito para continuar con sus objetivos, por otro lado está muy comprometida una vez más a cumplir con el pago puntual de sus cuotas. Con el monto solicitado desea incrementar la variedad de sus productos comprando mayor cantidad de zapatos, sandalias y además diversas prendas de vestir para venderlos. También invertirá en el mantenimiento de mototaxi.
texts.en: Maria is 28 years old.  She is married and has a seven-year-old son, and lives with her family in their own home.  Maria works renting out a motorcyle taxi, which is provided to a driver very early every day. She also has a second occupation selling shoes and sandals, either biweekly or monthly depending on the demand for her products.  In order to obtain her merchandise she travels for more than 20 hours by bus to another city.  She then returns with a large number of products to sell to her family, friends and other people.  She works as a mobile vendor, travelling through the main streets of the city every day in search of customers who want to buy what she is selling.  Sometimes she takes orders in advance.  This business has been doing well since she started it, thanks to her charisma and the quality of each of the products that she sells.  She is now requesting a loan of 2000 PEN, for which she is grateful to those who will make it possible for her to continue with her goals.  She is very committed again to making her payments punctually.  With the sum requested she would like to increase the variety of her products by buying a larger number of shoes, sandals and articles of clothing to sell.  She would also like to invest in maintenance for the motorcycle taxi.

loans.use: to buy shoes, sandals and articles of clothing, among other things.

loans.name: Julie

texts.en:
Julie works hard to support her five children. She is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Julie requests a 1,800 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy a solar lamp.

She is purchasing the solar lamp because she wants to have backup lighting in case of an emergency.

Julie is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is not only saving money, but she is also helping the environment and reducing risks to her family.

loans.use: to buy a solar lamp.

loans.name: Leonisa

texts.en:
Leonisa is 49 years old and married with two children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Leonisa is borrowing 15,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Leonisa has been raising pigs for 3 years and earns additional income from working in a general store.

She works tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream which is to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is 47 years old and married with five children, two of whom are in school. Lorna works very hard to provide for them.

Lorna runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell like soap, milk, egg, noodles, etc.

She has been in this business for six years.

In the future, Lorna would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell like soap, milk, egg, noodles, etc

loans.name: Lucresia

texts.en:
Lucresia is 55 years old, married, and has seven children. She is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. 

Lucresia requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to purchase additional fertilizer for her farm.

She has been farming rice for 20 years now, and has borrowed eight times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Lucresia would like to save enough to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional fertilizer for her farm

loans.name: Emelie

texts.en:
Emelie is 33 years old and married with two children.

Emelie works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks to sell in her general store.

Emelie has borrowed and paid eight loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for four years, and earns additional income from raising livestock.

Emelie aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Ma. Jurie

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Ma. Jurie works hard to support her family.

She has a rice retailing business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from pig fattening. Ma. Jurie is borrowing PHP 10,500 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to resell in her rice retailing business.

Ma. Jurie has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to resell.

loans.name: Cabelen

texts.en:
Cabelen is 24 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by raising livestock in the Philippines. Cabelen is borrowing PHP 11,500 through NWTF to purchase feeds, vitamins, and vaccines for her livestock.

Cabelen has been raising livestock for five years and earns additional income from buy-and-sell bananas.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase feeds, vitamins, and vaccines for her livestock.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Jennifer works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from farming corn. Jennifer is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy items to resell, such as shampoos, milk, coffee, soap, etc. for her general store business.

Jennifer has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items, such as shampoos, milk, coffee, soap, etc. to resell.

loans.name: Leiver David

texts.es:
Leiver  tiene 22 años de edad es soltero tiene 2 hijos de 11 años y 7 años de edad, vive con la familia en la Ciudad de ventanas provincia de los Ríos.
Es integrante de la ventanilla Bruniquilde que se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Calabi, pertenece al Cantón Ventanas se dedica  a  labores agropecuarias.
Leiver  se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz. Las compras lo realizan en comercial Rodríguez. Solicita el crédito  para la compra de insumos como los abonos, ureas, fertilizantes  que es un apoyo económico. Su sueño es mejorar la economía de la  familia. Los desafíos que se  enfrentan  dificultades económicas. 
Le gusta realizar bingos para recoger dinero para obras del sector.
texts.en:
Leiver is 22 years old, single, and has two children (ages 11 and 7). He lives with his family in the city of Ventanas in Los Ríos Province.

Leiver is a member of the Communal Bank "Bruniquilde", which is located in the neighborhood of Calabi in the canton of Ventanas. The members engage in farm work.

Leiver is a farmer who grows corn. His purchases are conducted at the Rodríguez commercial district. He is requesting a loan in order to buy supplies such as compost, urea, and fertilizers. This will be a great financial help.

His dream is to improve his family's financial situation. The challenges he faces include dealing with financial difficulties. Leiver enjoys playing bingo in order to raise money for local projects.

loans.use: to buy compost, urea, and fertilizers.

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel is a 28-year-old woman from the town of Panglao, Bohol. She is married and has an 8-year-old child. She is a barbecue vendor. She sells chicken and pork barbecue to earn a living. Her business started three years ago. She is asking for a loan to buy materials and ingredients like chicken and pork meat and seasonings to continue her business and meet the family's daily needs.

In the future, Maricel hopes to expand her barbecue vending business to improve her income and also to improve her child's welfare.

loans.use: to buy materials and ingredients like chicken and pork meat and seasonings

loans.name: Egleen

texts.en:
Egleen is 23 years old and has one child. Egleen is married and her child is in school.

Egleen is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. Egleen requested a PHP 11,500 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her livestock.

Egleen has been raising livestock for three years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Egleen would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her livestock.

loans.name: Conchita

texts.en:
Conchita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy more items like biscuits, candies, snack foods, noodles, cooking oil, etc. to sell.

Conchita has been in this business for nine years; she earns more income from raising livestock.

Conchita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more items like biscuits, candies, snack foods, noodles, cooking oil, etc. to sell

loans.name: Ma. Elena

texts.en:
As the married parent of three children, Ma. Elena works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising livestock. Ma. Elena is borrowing PHP 50,000 through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell in her general store.

Ma. Elena has been sustaining her business activities through her past 32 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell in her general store

loans.name: Gladys Group

texts.en:
Gladys is in her early 30's and is single with one child who is still in school. She has been operating a business selling bags for six years. She works from 6:00 a.m. to 8:00 p.m. daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be Gladys's first loan from ID Ghana, and she wants to use it to buy bags to resell to customers. She dreams of buying her products from abroad.

Gladys will share this loan amount of 1700 GHS with her group of three members. They will hold each other accountable for repaying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy bags to resell to customers.

loans.name: Arman

texts.en: Arman lives in Kapan town with his wife and 2-year-old daughter. Arman has been providing renovation services to locals for the past four years. Over these years of hard work, Arman has gained a good reputation among locals who value the high quality work that Arman does. The tools with which Arman works are too old, and Arman needs to replace them with new ones. Therefore, he has decided to apply for this loan to be able to purchase new tools needed to provide renovation services. Arman has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. The loan will be a huge help for Arman, and he hopes for lenders' support.

loans.use: to buy tools for providing renovation services

loans.name: Asia's Group

texts.en:
Asia is a 25-year-old, married woman. She lives with her husband and son, in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband is providing transportation services for passengers, in his auto rickshaw. Her husband has been doing this work since about three years ago. To carry out his work, he gets up very early, because he has to look for passengers on the streets of his city. He has been driving by day and by night. This is the reason the rickshaw has experienced serious depreciation, due to his continuous driving.
 
Due to a lack of cash in hand, Asia requested a loan. With the loan funds, her husband will buy spare parts for the vehicle, such as headlights, bolts, tyres, tubes, and the like.
 
Now her husband feels tranquil and comfortable, because he has assurance of a regular income and more free time. This will be Asia's third loan with Kiva; she hopes that, with your cooperation, her husband will be able to carry out his plans. She promises to make the loan payments on time.
Note: Asia raises her hand in the picture.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for the auto rickshaw.

loans.name: Asaba

texts.en:
Asaba is 28 years old and is married with five children. She earns her income through the sale of crops and livestock. On her land, Asaba grows maize, beans, coffee, vegetables, cassava, and bananas. She also has goats and chickens.

Asaba also receives a monthly wage as a Community Knowledge Worker (CKW). Community Knowledge Workers are trusted community members who provide agricultural data and advice to rural farmers in their local area. This includes information about the weather, market prices, crop diseases, and agricultural tools. Asaba has served as a CKW for the last two years, and she looks forward to renewing her CKW contract for the next three years. 

As a CKW, she will use the materials in her business-in-a-box (smartphone, solar charging set, and weighing scale) to disseminate vital agricultural information to the other members of her village. This information will help them to improve their crop yields and increase their incomes. 

With the additional money she will earn as a CKW, Asaba will increase stock in her retail business and start rearing a wide range of livestock. Her biggest dream in life is to become a model farmer and free people in her community from poverty by helping them to adopt improved agricultural practices.

loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set, and a weighing scale

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is 50 years old, married, and has four children. She earns her income through the sale of crops and livestock. She also receives a monthly wage as a Community Knowledge Worker (CKW). Community Knowledge Workers are trusted community members who provide agricultural data and advice to rural farmers in their local area, including information about the weather, market prices, crop diseases, and agricultural tools. On her land Margaret grows maize, beans, coffee, vegetables, and bananas. She also has cows and pigs.

Margaret has served as a CKW for the last two years, and she looks forward to renewing her CKW contract for the next three years. 

As a CKW, she will use the materials in her business-in-a-box (smartphone, solar charging set, and weighing scale) to disseminate vital agricultural information to the other members of her village, which will help them to improve their crop yields and increase their incomes. With the additional money she will earn as a CKW, Margaret will be able to renovate her house and pay hired workers who help her on the farm. Her biggest dreams in life are to become a successful farmer with financial stability and to have the ability to free other people in her community from poverty.

loans.use: To purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set and a weighing scale

loans.name: Silo Marty

texts.es:
Silo Marty tiene 33 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en el distrito de Oyotún, una comunidad tranquila, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, costa norte del Perú.

Junto a su esposa se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores en la parte posterior a su domicilio, Silo también ofrece servicios como jornalero en los cultivos de la zona, El ha solicitado un préstamo de 2 000 nuevos soles para la compra alimentos balanceados para engorde de sus animales y una segunda parte para la compra de cerdos y de esta manera incrementar su negocio, generando mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Silo Marty is 33 years old and lives with his wife and children in the Oyotún district, a tranquil community where its residents are farmers, merchants, and raise livestock.  It’s located two hours from Chiclayo, along the northern coast of Peru.

He and his wife raise and sell small animals in an area behind their house.  Silo also works as a field hand on the area farms.  He is asking for a loan of 2,000 Nuevos Soles so he can buy balanced feed for his animals and also use some of it to buy pigs, thereby generating more income for his family.

loans.use: to buy feed and pigs.

loans.name: Gabriel Maribel

texts.es:
Marible tiene 43 años de edad, vive con esposo, en el distrito de Oyotún, una comunidad que se caracteriza por cultivos de algodón, yuca, maíz, arroz, comercio y ganadería, ubicada a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta de productos de primera necesidad, menestras, azúcar, arroz, leche entre otros, es una mujer emprendedora ha solicitado un préstamo de 2 000 nuevos soles para la compra de mercadería para abastecer su negocio y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Marible is 43 years old and lives with her huband in the Oyotún district, a tranquil community where its residents are farmers, merchants, and raise livestock.  It’s located two hours from Chiclayo, along the northern coast of Peru.

She sells primary needs products such as food, sugar, rice, milk, and other things.  She is an enterprising woman and is asking for a loan of 2,000 Nuevos Soles to buy merchandise to stock her business so she can increase her family income.

loans.use: to stock her store.

loans.name: Jose Manuel

texts.es:
José Manuel tiene 43 años de edad, vive junto a sus hijos en el distrito de Nueva Arica, una comunidad que presenta grandes depósitos de arena, piedra y ripio, que su población lo emplea en construcción, tiene un relieve llano, rodeo por cerros debido a los contrafuertes andinos, su población se dedica a la a agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicado a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo, costa norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la crianza de animales de corral patos, pollos, cuyes, en su domicilio, con muchos años de experiencia, sus hijos le apoyan en esta labor, José Manuel ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 000 nuevos soles a Edpyme Alternativa para la compra de alimentos balanceados para engorde de animales y de esta manera tener una mejor producción de los mismos para ofrecer a sus clientes, generando mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
José Manuel is 43 years old and lives with his children in the District of Nueva Arica. This community is known for having large deposits of sand, stone, and gravel. As a result, the area provides construction jobs. The topography is flat since it lies at the foothills of the Andean mountains. The people in this area engage in agriculture, trade, and livestock breeding. This area is located an hour away from the city of Chiclayo, which is on the northern coast of Peru.

José Manuel raises domesticated animals such as ducks, chickens, and guinea pigs from his home. He has many years of experience and his children help with the work. José Manuel is requesting a loan of 1,000 PEN from Edpyme Alternativa in order to buy balanced feed for fattening his animals. This will result in better production so that he can offer animals to his customers, thereby generating more income for his family.

loans.use: to buy balanced animal feed.

loans.name: Irlanda

texts.es:
Irlanda tiene 39 años de edad, vive junto a sus dos hijos en el distrito de Nueva Arica una comunidad que presenta grandes depósitos de arena, piedra y ripio, que su población lo emplea en construcción, tiene un relieve llano, rodeo por cerros debido a los contrafuertes andinos, su población se dedica a la a agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicado a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de animales, como pollos, gallinas, gallos, patos; con más de 15 años de experiencia en el negocio ubicado en su mismo domicilio, ha solicitado un préstamo de 4 000 nuevos soles para la compra de más animales, dicha inversión le servirá para tener mayor variedad y productividad en animales, generando mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Irlanda is 39 years old, and lives with her two children in the Nueva Arica district, a community an hour away from the city of Chiclayo on the north coast of Peru. The Nueva Aria district offers large deposits of sand, rock and rubble, which the population use in construction, and it has a flat landscape surrounded by hills due to the Andean spurs. Its population works in agriculture, business and raising livestock.

Irlanda works raising and selling animals such as hens, roosters, and ducks, and she has more than 15 years experience in the business, which is located at her home. She has asked for a loan of 4000 nuevos soles in order to buy more animals. This investment will be used increase the variety and productivity of the animals, and so increase the income for her family.

loans.use: to buy animals such as chickens and ducks.

loans.name: Hermila

texts.es:
Hermila tiene 65 años de edad, vive junto esposo y sus hijas, en el distrito de Cayalti, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la preparación y venta de comida arroz con pollo, cabrito, arroz con pato entre otros, en el mercado de la zona, es conocida por los exquisitos platos que preparado, es una mujer emprendedora, ha solicitado un préstamo de 2 500 nuevos soles para la compra de ingredientes para sus preparos y de esta manera seguir generando ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Hermila is 65 years old and lives with her husband and daughters in the Cayalti district which is located 2 hours away from the city of Chiclayo on the north coast of Peru. The population works in agriculture, business, and raising livestock.

Hermila works preparing and selling food such as rice with chicken, goat or duck, among other things. She is known in the local market for the delicious dishes she prepares. She is an enterprising woman, and she has asked for a loan of 2500 nuevos soles in order to buy ingredients for preparing her food, and in this way continue earning an income for her family.

loans.use: buy ingredients for food preparation.

loans.name: Nelida Herlinda

texts.es:
Herlinda tiene 29 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo e hijos en la zona rural de Zaña, una comunidad ubicada cerca al valle del rio Jequetepeque, a una hora con cuarenta minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la crianza de ganado vacuno y venta de leche desde hace más de 5 años, comercializando la leche en su domicilio y mercado de la zona, ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 500 nuevos soles para la compra de alimentos balanceados para su ganado y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Herlinda is 29 years old and lives with her husband and children in the rural region of Zaña, a community located near the Jequetepeque river valley, an hour and forty minutes from the city of Chiclayo on the northern coast of Peru.

Herlinda has been raising cattle and selling milk for the past five years.  She sells the milk from her home and in the local market.  She is requesting a loan of 1,500 nuevo soles to buy feed for her cattle and thus generate more income for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed for her dairy cows.

loans.name: Zulfiniso

texts.ru: Зулфинисо порядочная женщина. Она пережила много тягости жизни. Ее муж умер несколько лет назад. Зулфинисо осталась вдовой с маленькой дочкой. Ее дочери 10 лет. Она учится в средней школе. Зулфинисо упорно работает для того, чтобы зарабатывать деньги и обеспечить свою дочь. Зулфинисо не имеет высшее образование. Она данное время работает дворником в местной больнице. Она получает ежемесячную зарплату. Зулфинисо хочет купить телевизор для своего домохозяйства, но не имеет денег. Она хочет, чтобы ее дочь смотрела телевизор и была информирована от новшества мира. Зулфинисо запрашивает займ на сумму 3800 сомони для покупки телевизора. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Zulfiniso is a respectable woman. She lived through a lot of hardship in her life. Her husband died a few years ago. Zulfiniso was left as a widow with a young daughter. Her daughter is 10 years old and goes to secondary school. Zulfiniso works persistently in order to earn money to support her daughter. 

Zulfiniso does not have higher education. She currently works as a cleaning lady at the local hospital. She receives a monthly income. Zulfiniso would like to purchase a TV for her household, but does not have the money. She would like her daughter to watch TV and be informed about innovations in the world. 

Zulfiniso requests a loan in the amount of 3,800 somoni to purchase a TV. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To buy a TV for her household

loans.name: Monica

texts.es: Mónica, de 35 años, está casada y tiene 03 hijos con quienes vive en su casa propia. El trabajo de Mónica, consiste en al venta de productos dulces, específicamente de golosinas, su puesto está ubicado en su casa propia, es muy concurrido por sus clientes, ya que esta muy bien situada en su barrio y ella es muy conocida por su buen humor y carisma, lo cual ha hecho que sus ventas le den los ingresos que necesita. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus clientes y hacerlos reír, lleva 03 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que vender bajo los fuertes rayos solares de la mañana, le encantaría tener una tienda de golosinas donde pueda vender con más comodidad y ofrecer otros tipos de productos a sus clientes. En esta oportunidad solicitara S/.600, por tanto esta muy contento de saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá seguro de avanzar con su negocio. Con el monto solicitado comprará productos al por mayor como golosinas para ofrecer a sus clientes, además de empezar a aumentar con algunos productos comestibles e iniciar con su nuevo proyecto.
texts.en:
Mónica, 35 years old, is married and has 3 children with whom she lives in her own house. Mónica's work consists of selling sweets, specifically candy. Her stand is located in her own house. It is well frequented by her customers, because it has a good location in the neighborhood. She is also very well known for her good humor and charisma, which have allowed her sales to provide her with the income she needs.

What she likes most about her work is conversing with her customers and making them laugh. She has been in this business for 3 years. She would love to have a candy store where she can sell more comfortably and offer other types of products to her customers.

At this time, she is applying for a loan of S/600, and is very happy knowing that she will have financial support, because she will feel secure moving forward with her business. With the requested amount she will buy wholesale products like candy to offer her customers, as well as begin to expand with some eatables and begin with her new project.

loans.use: to buy candy and eatables.

loans.name: Edona

texts.en:
Edona is 59 years old and married. She has four children. She earns a living by raising livestock in the Philippines. She has been raising livestock for three years, and she earns additional income from a general store.

Edona is borrowing PHP 5,000 through NWTF. She will use the loan to buy feed and vitamins for her livestock.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her livestock

loans.name: Josamie

texts.en:
Josamie is 18 years old and is the first of four children in her family. Her mother, Josephine, supports the family with her fishing business in the Philippines.

Josamie is studying for a Bachelor of Science in Information Technology. Currently she is in her second semester of this four-year course. She is borrowing PHP 5,000 to pay her tuition for the second semester of the school year 2013-14.

When she graduates, Josamie plans to be gainfully employed. She wants to help improve the quality of life of her family.

loans.use: to pay her tuition for the second semester of her first year, studying toward a B.S. in Information Technology.

loans.name: Trinidad

texts.en:
Trinidad is 51 years old and married with six children. Trinidad works hard to provide for her family. 

She runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell.

She has been running the general store for two years, and also earns an income from farming sugar cane.

Trinidad has borrowed and paid two loans from NWTF before this loan. 

Trinidad aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
