Jocelyn works hard to support her family. She is married, and has a general store business in the Philippines. Jocelyn has been in this business for three years now.

Jocelyn requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items like canned goods, laundry soap, shampoo, etc. to sell.

She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more items like canned goods, laundry soap, shampoo, etc. to sell

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace works hard to support her family. She is married, and has had a food vending business in the Philippines for two years.

Grace requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

In the future, Grace would like to save enough to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Jeanette

texts.en:
Jeanette works hard to support six children. She is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Jeanette requested a PHP 1,800 loan through NWTF in order to buy a solar lamp. She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to have a good light source that is waterproof during the rainy season.

Jeanette is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is not only saving money, but also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to buy a solar lamp.

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel is 32 years old and married, with two children.

She earns a living by having a pig-fattening business in the Philippines. Maricel is borrowing PHP 13,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Maricel has been in the pig-fattening business for two years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Menjil

texts.en:
Menjil is married with five children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Menjil is 47 years old and has two children who are in school.
business buying and selling used clothing in the Philippines. Menjil requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of used clothes to sell.

Menjil has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Menjil would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase adiitional sacks of used clothes to sell

loans.name: Darlina

texts.en:
Darlina works hard to support her family. Darlina is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Darlina is borrowing PHP 4,600 through NWTF to buy a solar lamp. She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to have a good light-source that is waterproof during the rainy season.

Darlina is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is saving money, she's helping the environment, and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to buy a solar lamp.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Delia works hard to support her family.

She has a soft drinks vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling fish. Delia is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to purchase additional cases of soft drinks to sell for her soft drinks vending business.

Delia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 17 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional cases of soft drinks to sell

loans.name: Emee

texts.en:
Emee is 32 years old and has two children. She is married and has two children who are in school. Emee is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. 

Emee requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional livestock, feed, and vitamins for her business.

Emee has been raising livestock for one year now, and has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Emee would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional livestock, feed, and vitamins for her business

loans.name: Majida

texts.en:
Majida is 38 years old; she lives with her husband and her two children in Jinen, where they live with her husband’s family.  Her dream is to build a separate house.  

She has been selling clothes and shoes for six months; she works hard to support her husband and to provide good living conditions for her children.

Majida is asking Ryada for this loan to buy goods to sell (shoes and clothes); this will allow her to increase her stock.  

Her dream is to expand her business, and she desires to use part of the profits on her children’s education in the future.
 
Majida is very grateful to everyone who helps her. Her husband, appears in the photo; for cultural reasons, she can’t publish her photo online, so she apologies.

loans.use: to buy shoes and clothes to sell.

loans.name: Gilma Ines

texts.es:
Gilma  tiene 45 años de edad es soltera vive con sus tres hijos en el Cantón  Ventanas Provincia Los Ríos.
Es integrante de la ventanilla Bruniquilde que se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Calabi, pertenece al Cantón Ventanas se dedica  a  labores agropecuarias.
Gilma  se dedica a la siembra de maíz y a la crianza de pollos y cerdos. Solicita el crédito para el arriendo de terreno para la siembra.  Las compras realiza en el  Cantón Ventanas en el  Comercial  García. Su sueño es comprar un terreno para el cultivo para no arrendar. El desafío que enfrenta es  el trabajo contra la maleza. En el tiempo libre le gusta reunirce los fines de semana en la casa con toda la familia.
texts.en:
Gilma is 45 years old, single, and lives with her three children in the canton of Ventanas in Los Ríos Province. She is a member of the Communal Bank "Bruniquilde", which is located in the neighborhood of Calabi in the canton of Ventanas. The members engage in farm work.

Gilma grows corn and raises chickens and pigs. She is requesting a loan in order to rent farmland for planting. Her purchases are conducted in the canton of Ventanas at the García commercial district.

Gilma's dream is to buy a plot of land for her crops so that she no longer has to rent. The challenge she faces is having to deal with crop diseases in her work. During her free time on the weekends, she enjoys spending time with her entire family at home.

loans.use: to rent farmland for planting.

loans.name: Delia Cristina

texts.es:
La señora  Delia, vive en la zona sur de Honduras, se dedica a tiempo a su negocio, el cual es una tienda de abarrotería que funciona desde hace 20 años. 
Doña Delia  su negocio se encuentra ubicada en su casa de habitación atendiendo en la comodidad de su hogar a las personas que llegan a la tienda en busca de la variedad de productos. 
Doña Delia  el crédito lo necesita para la compra de: frijoles, café, leche, arroz, azúcar, refrescos, pan, huevos, manteca, etc. El impacto esperado con el financiamiento, es que sus ventas se incrementen ya que comprará variedad de producto con el fin de poder satisfacer las necesidades de cada uno de sus clientes.
 Doña Delia  los planes a futuro, es seguir creciendo en su actividad, y generar mejores ingresos para tener una mejor calidad de vida, al mismo tiempo ayudar a su familia en cualquier problema que surja.



Choluteca, Honduras  de  Diciembre del 2013
texts.en:
Sra. Delia lives in southern Honduras and has been in business for quite some time. Her grocery store has been in operation for 20 years.

Doña Delia's business is located in her home, which allows her to comfortably attend to her customers. They come to her store in order to find a variety of products.

Doña Delia needs this loan in order to buy beans, coffee, milk, rice, sugar, soft drinks, bread, eggs, lard, and other products. The expected impact of this loan is that her sales will increase. She already buys a variety of products so that she can satisfy the needs of each individual customer.

Her plans for the future are to continue growing her business and to generate more income so that she can have a better quality of life. At the same, she wants to help her family with any problems that may arise.

Choluteca, Honduras - December 2013

loans.use: to buy beans, coffee, milk, rice, sugar, soft drinks, bread, eggs, lard, and other products.

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en:
Jackson is a farmer who lives in Kisii, an area known for banana- and sugarcane-growing. He has practiced farming for four years, producing and selling milk, eggs, and bananas. He enjoys farming so much, because he gives his dairy cows the right treatment so they will produce more milk.

Jackson chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, because they will help him purchase a dairy cow that will produce more milk for him, and the interest rate on their loans is affordable for small-scale farmers. During the training he received from Juhudi Kilimo, he learned how to develop a savings culture. This loan will give him more milk, and thus more income, which in turn will improve his living standard.

loans.use: to purchase another dairy cow.

loans.name: Nabijon

texts.en:
Nabijon was born in Tajikistan in 1985. He has no higher education. Nabijon always wanted to be higher educated but he does not have the opportunity. 

Nabijon is a builder and builds houses for his neighbors and friends. He has ‘golden hands’. His clients are happy with his work. 

He earns additional income from growing agricultural products. This year, he didn't have a good harvest. His income was small, and he does not have enough money to buy clothes for his two small children and to buy food items for his large family including his parents and brothers. 

Nabijon is asking for a loan of 1500 TJS to buy clothes for his children and food items for his family. He awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy clothes for his children and food for his family

loans.name: M. Iqbal

texts.en:
M. Iqbal is 57, living with his family in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 

He has been running a small general store for five years; earlier he had a job in a government sector. After retirement, he established a general store with the help of a graduity amount (small bonus) so that he can equally participate in household expenses. His shop is situated in a populated area, and there are a lot of customers available here to buy miscellaneous general store items. He wants to offer all those products which are necessary and consumable for daily usage. He wants to offer additional bakery items such as bread, jam, milk, cookies, butter, sandwiches, pattis, etc. But the major problem is the shortage of funds.

Therefore, M. Iqbal requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so he would be able to buy additional bakery items such as bread, jam, milk, cookies, butter, sandwiches, pattis, etc.

He is very glad after taking this loan, hopeful that he will be successful in fulfilling each request for any item, and abstain from the disappointment of his customers. In this way he will be able to generate maximum profit from the sale of additional bakery items. 

M. Iqbal is very thankful to Kiva and their field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy additional bakery items for his general store.

loans.name: Hanan

texts.en: Hanan is 20 years old. She lives with her retired parents and four siblings, in a sector in Jordan called Mafraq. Hanan is studying for her Bachelor's Degree. She was majoring in Mathematics initially, and then she changed her major to Earth and Environment Science. She is in her third year. She is planning to start her professional life after graduation, to support her family financially and to improve herself. To do so, she needs to buy the stationery, books, and other tools for her study, and to pay for her upcoming semester tuition. But she doesn't have enough money. For this reason, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: to pay her university tuition and buy the stationery, books, and other learning tools she needs for her study of Earth and Environment Science.

loans.name: Guliko

texts.en:
Guliko is from the village of Aghaiani. She is 21 years old, married, and lives with her husband, infant son, and mother-in-law. 

The only breadwinner in the household is Guliko's husband who works at a car wash for a monthly salary.

It’s often difficult for the family to cover food costs, so Guliko has decided to purchase a milking cow and start a dairy business. She will produce cheese for selling as well as for the family's consumption. 

This loan will be a great support for her family since it will help generate income. Guliko hopes for your kindness.

loans.use: to buy a milking cow and start a cheese making business

loans.name: Hatice

texts.en:
Hatice is married with four children.  She had made trousseaux and knit gifts at home for her friends and neighbors.  

When she learned the municipality had opened an arcade for housewives to sell their handicrafts, she was thrilled.  “Why don’t I sell what I make?” she thought.  She applied to open a stall in the arcade.  Now she sells the tulle and lace sets, as well as knitted items, that she makes at home at her booth.  She also makes handicrafts during her spare time at the booth.  Sometimes she makes items to order, she says.  

With the loan, she wants to increase her variety of products.  She’ll use her loan to buy supplies for lace, tulle and knitting.  With a greater variety of goods her sales will rise.  For now, she likes selling items at the arcade.  In the future she would like to open a store with her daughter.


Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff 

Hatice Hanım,evli ve 4 çocuğu var.  Evde, çevresine hediyelik çeyizlik işler,örgüler yapıyordu.  Belediye’nin ,ev kadınlarına  el işlerini yapıp satmaları için açtığı bir pasajı görünce çok etkilenmiş.  Neden  yaptıklarımı satmıyorum diye düşünmüş.  Müracaat edip pasajda tezgah istemiş.  Evde tülden ve küpürden yaptığı oda takımlarını,örgü işlerini şimdi tezgahında satıyor.  Burada da boş durmuyor hem satış hem de el işlerini yapıyor.  Bazen sipariş verirler o zamanda sipariş üzerine çalıştığını söylüyor.
Aldığı kredi ile çeşidini arttıracak.  Küpürler,tüller,örgü için yünler alacak.Çeşit çok olunca satışları artıyor.Şimdilik burada ki tezgahında satış yapması hoşuna gidiyor .İleride kızı ile birlikter dükkan açmak istiyor.

loans.use: to buy supplies for lace, tulle and knitting

loans.name: Amal

texts.en: Amal is a conservative woman, so she asked her son to take her place in the picture. Amal was born in 1977. She is married and lives in a sector in Jordan called Mafraq, with her six sons and daughters, and her retired husband. One of her sons is studying for a Bachelor's Degree, majoring in Sports Training and Management. He is in his first year. He is planning to start working in his study field after graduation, to improve himself. But Amal doesn't currently have enough money to pay for his upcoming semester fees, as a result of financial problems they are facing. For this reason, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: To pay her son's upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Bertsetseg

texts.en:
Mrs. Bertsetseg, 51 years old, lives with her younger son in Darkhan, the second largest city of Mongolia. They live in a house on a plot of land. 

She has been working as nurse for a state hospital for 33 years; her younger son studies at university in his second year. The house they live in has a poor floor made with planks, and during winter, the house becomes so cold. 

So she is requesting a loan of 2,000,000 MNT to install a low pressure heater in the house. 

This will make the house more comfortable, and a warmer place to live. Also, she will burn less coal for heating, thus release less pollutants into the air. 

The borrower is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to install a low pressure heater

loans.name: Gulshan

texts.ru: Гулшан живет и работает в столице Таджикистана. Она родилась в 1956 году. Гулшан вдова и имеет 2 детей. Гулшан сама вырастила своих детей с большим трудом, так как она имеет маленькую зарплату. Гулшан работает в местной больнице уборщицей. Гулшан и ее дети живут в старом доме, которое имеет плохое состояние. Гулшан не имеет достаточно денег, чтобы сделать ремонт. Она хочет отремонтировать дом и с такой целью она обратилась в ИМОН. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 1000 долларов США для покупки строительных материалов как цемент, древесина, краски и т.п. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Gulshan lives and works in the capital of Tajikistan.  She was born in 1956.  Gulshan is a widow and has 2 children.  Gulshan raised her children herself with a lot of difficulties because she has a small salary.  Gulshan works as a janitor at a local hospital.  Gulshan and her children live in an old house that is in a bad condition.  Gulshan does not have enough money to make repairs there.  She wants to repair her house and came to IMON to achieve this goal.  She is requesting a loan in the amount of 1000 US dollars to purchase construction materials, such as cement, wood, paint, etc.  She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials, such as cement, wood, paint, etc., to repair her house

loans.name: Nazaria

texts.es:
Nazaria agradece a los inversionistas por el préstamo y por el apoyo brindado, ella continua con el negocio de la crianza de animales menores, a la ganadería y a la agricultura y le va excelente. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar animales menores como cuyes y gallinas. 

Nazaria nació en el distrito de Challabamba pero vive en la comunidad de Majopata anexo de la comunidad de Carnicero y pertenece al banco comunal “El Balcon”. (La comunidad de Majopata está ubicada en el distrito del Challabamba en la provincia de Paucartambo dentro del departamento de Cusco, Perú).
texts.en:
Nazaria is grateful to the Kiva lenders for the loan and the support that has been provided.  She continues her business of raising animals, breeding livestock, and farming.  Nazaria is doing well in all of these activities.  She is taking this opportunity to request a loan in order to buy small animals, such as guinea pigs and chickens.  

Nazaria was born in the District of Challabamba, but currently lives in the community of Majopata, which is next to the community of Carnicero.  She is a member of the Communal Bank "El Balcon".  The community of Majopata is located in the District of Challabamba, which in Paucartambo Province in the Department of Cusco, Peru.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs and chickens.

loans.name: Saira Yamileth

texts.es:
La joven Saira  Yamileth  de 27 años de edad, vive con su esposo  y sus tres  hijos tiene casa propia, se dedica desde hace 02 años al negocio de venta de abarrotería sus clientes le prefieren por su buen trato y buenos precios.
Saira Yamileth su venta es de lunes a domingo, desea crecer más en su negocio y espera que con el préstamo que solicita a Prisma pueda suplir la necesidad de financiamiento.
Saira Yamileth está solicitando el préstamo para compra de arroz, frijoles, papas, lechuga, plátanos, refrescos, jabón, detergentes, maíz, etc. con el apoyo de este crédito ella pretende mejorar sus ingresos y también su calidad de vida, es su primer crédito que solicita a prisma.
Saira Yamileth su sueño es mejorar su condición de vida.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Noviembre del 2013.
texts.en:
Saira Yamileth is a 27-year-old young woman. She lives with her husband and their three children and owns her home. She has been working selling groceries for two years. Her customers prefer her because she treats them well and offers good prices.

She sells groceries Monday through Sunday. She wants her business to grow and expects that the loan she is requesting from Prisma will cover her need for financing.

She is requesting this loan to buy rice, beans, potatoes, lettuce, plantains, soft drinks, soap, detergents, corn, etc. She plans to use this loan to help improve her income as well as her quality of life. This is the first loan she requests from Prisma. Her dream is to improve her living conditions.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - November, 2013

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, potatoes, lettuce, plantains, soft drinks, soap, detergents, corn, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Jacqueline Alexandra

texts.es:
Jacqueline tiene 32 años de edad es soltera tiene dos hijo, vive con los hijos en la ciudad de Ventanas provincia de los ríos.

La VRC 27 DE MAYO sus miembros se ddeican a la agricultura todos viven en el sector del recinto el Cadial Practicamente se han criado en esa zona se dedican a labores agrícolas u Pecuarias en su mayoria.

Jacqueline  se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y a la crianza de gallinas ponedoras. Solicita el crédito para comprar urea, insecticidas, líquido mata maleza y una bomba para fumigar ademas de morocho y balanceado para las gallinas. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar lo necesario para las siembras.

Las compras y las ventas las realiza en Ventanas.

El sueño es seguir sembrando para aumentar los cultivos. 

En el tiempo libre le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Jacqueline is 32 years old, single, and has two children. She and her children live in the city of Ventanas in Los Ríos Province.

The members of the Communal Bank "27 de Mayo" (May 27th) are devoted to agriculture. All of them live in the area around the neighborhood of Cadial Practicamente where they grew up. Most of the members engage in farming and livestock breeding.

Jacqueline is a farmer who grows corn and raises egg-laying hens. She is requesting a loan in order to buy urea, insecticides, liquid weed killer, a fumigation pump, as well as maize and balanced feed for her hens. This loan will be a great help since she will be able to buy what she needs for her crops. Her purchases and sales are conducted in Ventanas.

Jacqueline's dream is to continue planting so that she can increase her crops. In her free time, she enjoys playing sports.

loans.use: to buy urea, insecticides, liquid weed killer, a fumigation pump, as well as maize and balanced feed for her hens.

loans.name: Benjamín

texts.es:
Benjamín, a sus 63 años de edad, es una víctima más del desplazamiento forzado por la ola de violencia que se vivía en su ciudad natal, se trasladó con su familia dejando atrás todo lo que había construido durante muchos años de trabajo. Luego de radicarse comenzó a vender frutas de manera ambulante, como una alternativa que le permitiera generar recursos para sustentar las necesidades básicas de su esposa y sus 3 hijos; poco a poco fue adquiriendo clientela y logró reconocimiento en el sector, trabaja solo todos los días de 4 am a 4 pm, generando los recursos necesarios para apoyar económicamente a sus hijos durante los 20 años que lleva laborando de manera independiente.
Benjamín sueña con poder tener su negocio en un local comercial en el que pueda ofrecer muchos más productos y, con el firme propósito de seguir luchando para cumplir ese sueño, encuentra en el crédito un apoyo para lograrlo, con el dinero desea comprar surtido al por mayor (frutas, mecato y dulces), así podrá diversificar los productos que ofrece y ampliará su mercado poco a poco, mejorando las ventas y los ingresos que percibe; con los que espera tener la capacidad para brindar mejores condiciones de vida y bienestar a sus familiares y, en un futuro tener la oportunidad de disfrutar una vejez tranquila y sin preocupaciones monetarias.
texts.en:
Benjamín, age 63, is a victim of displacement that was forced upon him by a wave of violence that hit his hometown. As a result, he moved his family and left behind everything he had built up over many years of work. After the move, he began selling fruit as a street vendor. This provided the means of generating income for meeting the basic needs of his wife and their three children. Little by little, he began acquiring customers and achieved recognition in the neighborhood. He works alone every day from 4:00 A.M. to 4:00 P.M. Throughout the 20 years he has worked independently, he has been able to generate the necessary income to financially support his children.

Benjamín dreams of having his own business at a commercial center where he can offer more products. He fully intends to keep striving in order to fulfill that dream. Having a loan will help to achieve that goal. The money will be used to buy inventory in bulk such as fruits, pastries, and sweets. This will enable him to diversify the products he offers and gradually expand his market. As a result, his sales and income will improve. He hopes to be able to provide better living conditions and improved well-being for his loved ones.

In the future, Benjamín hopes to have the opportunity to enjoy a peaceful retirement with no financial worries.

loans.use: to buy fruits, pastries, and sweets in bulk.

loans.name: Zulaykho

texts.ru: Зулайхо родилась в 1960 году. Зулайхо прекрасная женщина и заботливая мать 3 детей. Она разведена и сама вырастила своих детей. Ее дети Давлат, Саидчафар и Зулола совершеннолетние. Зулайхо имеет высшее образование. Она педагог-психолог. Зулайхо более 30 лет работала педагогом. Данное время она работает психологом в детском садике. Зулайхо гордится своей работой. Она использует свою зарплату для обеспечения семьи. Ее дочь Зулола скоро выходит замуж и она должна дать ей приданное и провести свадебное торжество. Однако Зулайхо не имеет достаточно денег. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 7500 сомони для проведения свадебного торжества своей дочери и купить приданное. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Zulaykho was born in 1960. She is a wonderful woman and loving mother of three children. She is divorced and raised her children by herself. Her children, Davlat, Saidchafar and Zulola, are adults now. Zulaykho has higher education. She is an educational psychologist. She has worked as a pedagogue for more than 30 years. Currently she works as a psychologist in kindergarten.

Zulaykho is proud of her work. She uses her pay to support her family. Her daughter, Zulola, is getting married soon, and Zulaykho needs to give her dowry and hold a wedding party. She does however not have sufficient funding for this. 

Zulaykho requests a loan in the amount of 7,500 somoni to hold her daughter's wedding party and to purchase dowry. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To hold a wedding party for her daughter, and to buy her dowry

loans.name: Mahfizakhon

texts.ru: Махфизахон порядочная женщина. Она родилась в 1984 году. Махфизахон замужем и на воспитании имеет 2 не совершеннолетних детей. Махфизахон занимается шитьем женской одежды. Она этим бизнесом занимается уже более 7 лет. Махфизахон шьёт национальные женские платья. Она предоставляет свои услуги дома. Клиентами Махфизахона являются ее друзья и соседи. Она старается предоставлять свои услуги на высшем уровне. Махфизахон также шьёт платья и продает на местном рынке. Она хочет развевать свой бизнес. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 5000 сомони для покупки ткани. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Mahfizakhon is a decent woman. She was born in 1984. Mahfizakhon is married and raising two children. Mahfizakhon works with sewing women's clothing. She has worked with this business for 7 years already. 

Mahfizakhon sews women's national dresses. She provides this service from her house. Mahfizakhon's customers are her friends and neighbors. She tries to provide a service of the highest quality. Mahfizakhon also sews dresses and sells them at the local market. She would like to develop her business. 

Mahfizakhon requests a loan in the amount of 5,000 somoni to purchase fabric. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To buy fabric for sewing dresses

loans.name: Jose

texts.es:
José tiene 31 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa en el distrito de Zaña, una comunidad conocida por dedicarse a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería ubicada cerca al valle del rio Jequetepeque, lo que le ha permitido tener un buen desarrollo de agricultura, a una hora con cuarenta minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo, costa norte del Perú.

El se dedica a brindar servicio de transporte público en su propia mototaxi, trasladando a sus clientes a las zonas aledañas a su distrito, ha solicitado un préstamo de 2 000 nuevos soles para darle mantenimiento a su vehículo para seguir brindando este servicio.
texts.en:
José is 31 years old. He lives with his wife in the district of Zaña, a community known for making its living in agriculture, commerce and ranching. It is located close to the Jequetepeque River valley, which has allowed for good agricultural development. It is an hour and forty minutes from the city of Chiclayo, on the northern coast of Peru.

José makes his living offering public transport services in his own moto-taxi, transporting customers to areas neighboring his district. He has applied for a loan of 2,000 nuevos soles to maintain his vehicle, so that he can continue providing this service.

loans.use: to maintain his vehicle.

loans.name: Eleodoro

texts.es:
Eleodoro tiene 42 años de edad, vive en su casa propia junto a sus hijos y esposa en el distrito de Pucará, una comunidad que se caracteriza por su clima caluroso, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería a dos horas de la ciudad de Jaén, ubicado en la región Cajamarca, costa norte del Perú.

El se dedica a brindar servicio de labores agrícolas de arado, actividad que consiste en uncir a dos toros del mismo tamaño y colocar en el centro una herramienta que sirve para remover la tierra para prepararlo para los cultivos, también trabaja en siembra, cosecha, desyerbos te terrenos arroceros.

Ha solicitado un préstamo 1 000 nuevos soles para invertirlo en la compra de toretes para seguir brindando el servicio de arado y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Eleodoro is 42 years old. He lives with his children and his wife in a house that he owns in the district of Pucará, a community known for its warm climate. The people there work in agriculture, commerce, and livestock production. It is two hours from the city of Jaén in the Cajamarca region on Peru's northern coast.

Eleodoro earns his living providing agricultural plowing services. This business consists of yoking two bulls of equal size with a tool centered between them to remove soil and prepare the land for planting. He also works in planting, harvesting, and weeding rice paddies.

He has requested a loan of 1,000 nuevos soles [PEN] to invest in the purchase of young bulls to continue providing his plowing service so that he can generate a better income for his family.

loans.use: to buy a young bull

loans.name: Marie

texts.en:
Marie is 23 years old and lives in Caldwell. She is married and has two children ages two and five who go to school and live at home.

Over the past six years Marie has been selling oil, bitter balls (a type of meat-filled snack), pepper, etc. in the local market. A poor income is her major challenge.

Marie is applying for a 30,000 LRD loan through BRAC Liberia to buy extra oil, bitter balls, pepper, etc. to sell. She plans to build a shop and educate her children.

loans.use: to buy extra oil, bitter balls, pepper, etc. to sell.

loans.name: José Rigoberto

texts.es:
José de 27 años de edad, es un hombre muy trabajador que a pesar de  haber estudiado hasta 6 grado de educación básica por su situación económica, él trata de buscar la forma de obtener ingresos para apoyar a su familia, la cual esta compuesta por su madre, dos hermanas y un hermano. También apoya  mediante su fuerza de trabajo, en su tiempo libre en las actividades agrícolas que desarrollan sus hermanos; anteriormente trabajaba en un agro-servicio, hoy en día se dedica a brindar sus servicios de seguridad en el Destacamento Militar.


José, también ha trabajado en la agricultura y sabe lo duro que es obtener los ingresos necesarios de tal labor, sumándole a esto el tiempo que se tarda en obtenerlos, por lo que él se motivo a buscar una fuente de ingresos mas estable, logrando encontrar trabajo en un agro servicio, en el cual trabajo durante tres años, hasta que decidió  prestar su servicio de seguridad dentro del Destacamento Militar,  en el cual lleva laborando ocho meses, de donde obtiene una fuente de ingresos mas segura.

Con el crédito se  le estará ayudando al cliente, para que pueda comenzar a construir una pequeña vivienda, la cual le servirá  mucho tanto a él como a su familia y también le servirá para  formar su propia familia en un  futuro.


 José  quiere en un futuro poder construir una casa digna y propia, donde pueda formar una familia a la cual pueda darles una mejor calidad de vida, teniendo su casa bien  equipada y amueblada.
texts.en:
Jose is 27 years old. He is a hardworking man despite having only studied until the 6th grade due to his financial situation. He tries to look for ways to obtain income in order to support his family, which is composed of his mother, two sisters, and one brother. He also supports them through his hard work. In his free time he works on agriculture projects that his siblings develop; he previously worked in agro-service. Nowadays he makes a living providing security services to the military detachment.

Jose has also worked in agriculture and knows how difficult it is to make the necessary income in that line of work. Due to this, it is taking a long time to make sufficient income. Because of that he was motivated to look for a more stable source of income; he was able to find agro-service work, in which he worked for three years until he decided to lend his services to security inside the military detachment. He has been working there for eight months and is receiving a more stable income. 

This loan will help the borrower be able to begin building a small home, which will help both him and his family; it will also help in the future when he starts his own family.

Jose wants a future in which he can build his own respectable house where he can start a family and give them a good quality of life, having a well-supplied and furnished house.

loans.use: to build a small home.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a furniture-making business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy additional materials like bamboo, wood, paint, etc. for her furniture-making business.

Alicia has been in this business for 10 years. Alicia earns more income from farming sugarcane, corn and vegetables and buying and selling charcoal.

Alicia has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams  of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional materials like bamboo, wood, paint, etc

loans.name: Marcela

texts.en:
Marcela is 60 years old and married with two children. She earns a living by raising cattle in the Philippines. Marcela is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to purchase vitamins and other supplies for her cattle.

Marcela has been raising cattle for six years and also earns additional income from buying and selling bananas.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase vitamins and other supplies for her cattle

loans.name: Jubelyn

texts.en:
Jubelyn is 35 years old and married, with two children who are in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

Jubelyn runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to purchase items to sell like shampoo, soap, canned goods, spices, bread, chips, etc.

She has been in this business for 14 years.

In the future, Jubelyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase items to sell like shampoo, soap, canned goods, spices, bread, chips, etc

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a married woman with four children. She is 45 years old, and has two children who are still in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Elizabeth raises goats in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy vitamins and vaccines for her business.

She has been in this business for five years. 

Elizabeth would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy vitamins and vaccines for her livestock business

loans.name: Leonar

texts.en:
Leonar is 37 years old and married with three children; she works hard to provide for her family. 

She runs a buy and sell accessories business in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock of accessories to sell.

Leonar has borrowed and paid 14 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the buy and sell accessories business for ten years, and also earns an income from computer gaming.

Leonar aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of accessories to sell

loans.name: Josie

texts.en:
Josie is married and works hard to support her family. For the past three years she has had a food vending business in the Philippines.

Josie is applying for a 5000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional ingredients like sugar, milk, flour, rice, etc. for her business. In the future she would like to have saved enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients like sugar, milk, flour, rice, etc.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is a hardworking entrepreneur. For the past three years she has sold Avon and Natasha products in the Philippines. She also earns money raising livestock.

Rowena is applying for a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more Avon and Natasha products to sell such as lotion, shampoo, body soap, lipsticks, etc.

Rowena has been sustaining her business through her own efforts and the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more Avon and Natasha products to sell

loans.name: Eva Carolina

texts.es:
Eva tiene 30 años de edad, es una mujer preparada académicamente, no tiene hijos y en un estado civil de unión libre siendo ambos maestros de educación media que actualmente ejercen su carrera en un instituto de su comunidad. Ella es una mujer visionaria y emprendedora por lo que también se dedica a la caficultura desde hace 5 años comenzaron con un pedazo de tierra en cual fue una herencia que le dieron los padres de su compañero de hogar poniendo mucho esfuerzo y dedicación para que hacer crecer sus cultivos de café. Al salir de su jornada educativa se dirigen hasta el campo donde juntos trabajan la tierra ya que fue su pareja quien le enseñara las diferentes actividades del campo. Sus metas y planes poco a poco los ha ido cumpliendo ya que ella es muy optimista y luchadora teniendo como meta la compra de un vehículo de paila para poder trasladar el grano cosechado hasta el lugar de venta como también los insumos que son requeridos para que sus cultivos de café se mantengan sanos y fuertes con un excelente follaje y un buen tamaño en el grano. Sus metas poder construir una plancha de cemento en donde pueda secar y lavar el café para su posterior venta.
Por lo que hoy en día ella ha solicitado financiamiento a la cooperativa COMIXMUL con el cual comprara los insumos necesarios para poder dar asistencia a sus cultivos de café así como también el pago de mano de obra para recolectar el grano evitando de esa manera se seque o se pudra en la rama del palo.
texts.en: Eva is 30 years old.  She is educated, she doesn't have kids, and she lives with her common law husband.  Eva and her husband are both middle school teachers currently teaching at a school in their community.  She is a visionary and enterprising woman, which is why for the past five years she and her husband have been growing coffee.  They started with a piece of land which her husband inherited from his parents, and have put a lot of work and dedication into growing coffee.  When the school day is over they go out to the country where they work their land together.  It was Eva's husband who taught her how to farm.  Her goals and plans have gradually been coming to fruition since she is very optimistic and hardworking.  A goal she has is to buy a pickup truck with which to transport the harvested coffee beans to the place where they will be sold, as well as the inputs she needs to keep her coffee plants healthy and strong, with excellent foliage and good-sized coffee beans.  Her goal is to be able to install a cement patio where she can dry and clean the coffee before selling it.  Today she is requesting a loan from COMIXMUL cooperative with which to buy the inputs she needs to tend her coffee fields, as well as to pay laborers to harvest the coffee beans so they don't dry out or rot on the branch.

loans.use: to buy inputs and pay laborers to harvest coffee beans

loans.name: Sheryll

texts.en:
Sheryll is married; her husband is a seafarer. She operates a sari-sari (general) store in her village, which she has been doing for almost two years. She sells a variety of goods including rice grain. Her profits sustain the family's basic needs.

Sheryll wishes to expand her business to increase her income and is requesting a loan for 30,000 PHP, which she will use to buy grocery items and rice grain to sell. She hopes that someday her income will cover all their needs so that her husband will no longer work abroad.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items and rice grain to sell

loans.name: Agustin

texts.es:
Agustin tiene 42 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en el Caserío La Polvareda del distrito de Oyotun, la cual es una zona rural, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, costa norte del Perú.

Junto a su esposa se dedican a la crianza de animales de corral y borregos, en la parte posterior a su domicilio, también brinda servicios de albañilería, ha solicitado un préstamo de 600 nuevos soles para la compra de un terreno y así poder trasladarse a vivir en Oyotun y tener la oportunidad de brindar sus servicio de albañilería en esta zona.
texts.en:
Agustin is 42 years old. He lives with his wife and children in Caserío La Polvareda, in the district of Oyotun, which is a rural area located two hours' distance from the city of Chiclayo, on Peru's northern coast. Residents in this area work farming, trading, and raising livestock. 

Alongside his wife, he works raising farm animals and lambs in the back of their house. He also offers his services for construction work. He has requested a loan in the amount of 600 nuevos soles to purchase a plot of land so that he can move to Oyotun. Living there will give him the opportunity of offering his construction services in that area.

loans.use: to buy a plot of land.

loans.name: Nukra

texts.ru: Нукра молодая и трудолюбивая женщина. Ей 23 года. Она разведена и не имеет детей. После развода она вернулась к своим родителям. Нукра по совету своей матери начала учится шитью женской одежды. Она была ученицей некоторое время. Постепенно она изучила все тонкости своего дела. Теперь она работает в ателье. Нукра шьёт женские национальные платья. Она шьёт по новым фасонам. Нукра хочет купить новую швейную машинку и таким образом улучшить качество своей работы. Она запрашивает займ с такой целью. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 5000 сомони для покупки швейной машинки. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Nukra is a young and hard-working woman. She is 23 years old. She is divorced and does not have children. After her divorce she returned to her parent's home. Nukra started sewing women's clothing on the advice of her mother. She was an apprentice for a while. Gradually she learned all the details of her activity. Currently she works from an atelier. Nukra sews women's national dresses. She sews new styles. 

Nukra would like to purchase a new sewing machine and this way improve the quality of her work. With this aim she requests a loan. She requests a loan in the amount of 5,000 somoni to purchase a sewing machine. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To purchase a new sewing machine for her sewing business

loans.name: Matluba

texts.ru: Матлуба целеустремленная женщина. Она родилась в 1967 году. Матлуба замужем и имеет совершеннолетних детей. Матлуба уже более 20 лет занимается собственным бизнесом. Она продает мужскую обувь на местном рынке. Ее муж помогает введению бизнеса. Матлуба имеет большой опыт и с легкостью справляется своим бизнесом. Матлуба должна провести свадебное торжество своей дочери, а также ей дать приданное мягкую мебель. Матлуба запрашивает займ на сумму 7500 сомони для проведения свадебного торжества и покупка мебели. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Matluba is a purposeful woman. She was born in 1967. Matluba is married and has adult children. She has had her own business for more than 20 years. She sells men's shoes at the local market. Her husband helps her managing the business. Matluba has great experience and deals with her business with ease. 

Matluba needs to hold a wedding party for her daughter, and also give her furniture as dowry. Matluba requests a loan in the amount of 7,500 somoni to hold the wedding party and purchase furniture. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To hold a wedding party for her daughter and purchase furniture as dowry

loans.name: Franklin Mariano

texts.es: Franklin, tiene 19 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su esposa, vive en la comunidad de Morazán,  Yoro.  El  se dedica a la producción de maíz, actividad que realiza desde pequeño pero hace 3 años  tiene su propio cultivo y lo tiene ubicado en los campos productores. La producción la vende en el mercado local. Este préstamo  que solicita es por 10,000 lempiras y lo invertirá en la compra de fertilizantes para el mantenimiento del cultivo de maíz.  Su meta es tener siempre dinero para darle mantenimiento a cada cosecha y obtener ingresos para mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Franklin is 19 years old and in a common-law relationship with his wife.  He lives in the community of Morazán, Yoro.

Franklin has been growing corn from a very young age.  He has his own crops that he grows on land located in the productive countryside.  Whatever he produces is sold at the local market.  The loan he is requesting is in the amount of 10,000 HNL and will be invested in the purchase of fertilizers for maintaining his corn crop.  

His goal is to always have money for maintaining each crop so that he can generate income to improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for his corn crop.

loans.name: Elvie

texts.en:
Elvie is 42 years old and married with seven children (she is seen here with her youngest daughter). She has been raising livestock for two years and earns additional income from farming corn.

Elvie is applying for an 8,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more livestock to raise. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more livestock to raise.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 38 years old and married with seven children.

She earns a living by buying and selling livestock in the Philippines. Jocelyn is borrowing PHP 11000 through NWTF to buy additional livestock to sell.

Jocelyn has been buying and selling livestock for 10 years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional livestock to sell.

loans.name: Jinky

texts.en:
Jinky is 42 years old, married, and has five children. She earns a living fattening pigs in the Philippines, which she has been doing for four years. She earns additional income from her general store.

Jinky is requesting a loan from NWTF for 25,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs. She hopes to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Abdulmalek Group

texts.en:
The Abdulmalek Group consists of four women from Sana`a, Yemen. Each member has her own type of business. They are requesting a group loan for 200,000 YER and they hold each other accountable for loan repayment. 

Sadah is 43 years old, married, and has children. She is an uneducated woman from a poor family. Her husband's income is not enough to cover their living expenses and the rent of the house, so she is requesting a loan from AMB for 50,000 YER, which she will use to buy a refrigerator  to use in her house. She hopes to open a general store to make more profit and to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a refrigerator

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina is 62 years old, married, and has five children. She works hard to provide for her family. She operates a general store in the Philippines, which she has been doing for 18 years. She earns additional income from raising livestock.

Rosalina is requesting her sixteenth loan from NWTF for 17,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase more stocks such as bread, canned goods, shampoo, vinegar, detergent soap, fabric conditioner, etc. to sell. Rosalina aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase bread, canned goods, shampoo, vinegar, detergent soap, fabric conditioner, etc. to sell

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en: Parveen is a 40-year-old woman, living with her three children and spouse in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband is a driver by profession and provides transportation services by using a three-wheeled auto rickshaw. With the help of savings, he has purchased a used auto rickshaw. Its engine quality is good, but the body is fully damaged. He does not have a sufficient amount to buy a new body and seat covers. He wants to start driving but is looking for a lump sum amount to buy a rickshaw body.Therefore, Parveen requested a loan for her husband so he can buy a new rickshaw body and some spare parts for his rickshaw. She hopes that now her husband will be able to have more income. She is very happy after receiving this loan; she thanks Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy rickshaw's body and some spare parts.

loans.name: Robina Shaheen Group

texts.en:
Robina Shaheen, a 40-year-old hardworking woman, lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan, with her husband, four sons, and two daughters. A son and two daughters are studying, and her husband is an auto mechanic. His income is insufficient to meet the family's needs, so Robina Shaheen is trying to help him meet their needs by stitching clothes. 

She herself is a tailor, and she wants to generate more income by purchasing a new sewing machine. She will extend her business if she gets a good amount of profit in the future.

Robina Shaheen is a member of a two-person group and she has requested a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan to purchase a sewing machine to stitch more dresses and to satisfy the needs of her clients more professionally. She hopes, with the help of the loan, to reach her desired net income and be able to save for their future. She dreams of giving her children a quality education.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is 32 years old and is married with four children. She earns her income through the sale of crops and livestock, and she receives a monthly wage as a Community Knowledge Worker (CKW). Community Knowledge Workers are trusted community members who provide agricultural data and advice to rural farmers in their local area, including information about the weather, market prices, crop diseases and agricultural tools. On her land, Betty grows maize, beans, coffee, vegetables, cassava and bananas. She also has pigs, goats and chickens.

Betty has served as a CKW for the last two years, and she looks forward to renewing her CKW contract for the next three years. As a CKW, she will use the materials in her business-in-a-box (smartphone, solar charging set, and weighing scale) to disseminate vital agricultural information to the other members of her village, which will help them to improve their crop yields and increase their incomes. With the additional money she will earn as a CKW, Betty will start up a retail business in her community to supplement her earnings from the sale of crops and livestock. Her biggest dream in life is to see her children study up to a university level, and get good jobs.

loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set and weighing scale

loans.name: Russian

texts.en:
Russian is 30 years old and is married with six children. He earns his income through the sale of crops and livestock, and he receives a monthly wage as a Community Knowledge Worker (CKW). Community Knowledge Workers are trusted community members who provide agricultural data and advice to rural farmers in their local area, including information about the weather, market prices, crop diseases and agricultural tools. On his land, Russian grows maize, beans, coffee, vegetables, cassava, sweet potatoes and bananas. He also has pigs, goats and chickens.

Russian has served as a CKW for the last two years, and he looks forward to renewing his CKW contract for the next three years. As a CKW, he will use the materials in his business-in-a-box (smartphone, solar charging set, and weighing scale) to disseminate vital agricultural information to the other members of his village, which will help them to improve their crop yields and increase their incomes. With the additional money he will earn as a CKW, Russian will invest in adding value to his farm produce before selling it. His biggest dream in life is to own a cassava grinding machine that will be used by him and other farmers in his community to add value to their cassava before sale.

loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set and weighing scale

loans.name: Moreene

texts.en: Moreene is a hard-working married woman living in Kamwenge, Uganda. She deals in fresh food sales, as well as farming. With the proceeds from her business activities she has been able to pay school fees for her children and boost her business. As a good mother she wants to educate her children so they attain degrees (as a minimum qualification) and set up sustainable, income-generating activities to secure their future. Like most traders in this business she is challenged by a high rate of perishability. Her business goals are to buy refrigerators and also diversify her business to include dry foods. Moreene intends to use this loan to buy fresh food to sell.

loans.use: to buy fresh food to sell.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence is a 37-year-old hard-working woman with 3 children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. She runs a bar on a busy market street, thus attracting many revelers. She started the business in order to raise income to support her family and has since reaped tangible benefits. Customers not paying on time and price fluctuations both affect her business. Her desire is to own an executive bar that attracts many clients. Florence is requesting a loan to buy beer, soda and local brews to sell.

loans.use: to buy beer, soda and local brews to sell.

loans.name: Avtandil

texts.en: This is Avtandil. He is 52 years old and lives in the town of Telavi. He is married with two grown children living with him. Avtandil looks after his retired mother as well. Avtandil’s son is a furniture manufacturer and earns a monthly salary. As the family earnings are not enough to cover utilities and food costs, Avtandil has decided to start a business and open a small café in his town. According to Avtandil’s estimation, sales will be high as the location where he plans to start his cafe is crowded with people. He has already hired the commercial space and needs money to purchase raw materials. The income from the café will be a great support for the family, as it will generate additional income. Avtandil appreciates your kindness.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials needed to open a cafe

loans.name: Dieu

texts.en:
Dieu is 32 years old and married with a son.  She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband has run a business selling and buying waste materials. She earns an income running a general store in front of their house. 

She started this business 15 years ago. She sells sugar, toys for kids, soft drinks, yogurt and other household items to people in her community. She is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying a greater variety of products, in particular, food and beverages, to stock her store and better satisfy her customers.

She hopes her business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy a greater variety of food and beverages to sell

loans.name: Riaz Hussain

texts.en:
Riaz Hussain is a 37-year-old married man. He lives in the rural area of Lahore, Pakistan with his wife and six children.

He has been in the business of selling milk since childhood. He learned all the techniques for getting milk from his father. This is the only source of income for the family. He has to devote his full time and energy for his dairy farm. He delivers milk in the market and door-to-door. For delivery purposes, he uses his bicycle. He loads milk cans on his bicycle and delivers it early in the morning. His customers like the fresh and delicious milk he delivers. His monthly savings has become too low due to a rapid increase in the household expenses; the excess utility bills, school fees, uniforms and the expensive books highly affected his savings. He wants to get additional income so that he can cope with the household expenses. However, he finds it difficult due to financial constraints.

Therefore, Riaz Hussain plans to purchase one more buffalo to increase his sales, so that he can generate more income and savings as well. He has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan. He hopes to provide a quality education for his children and to buy a motorbike to deliver the milk. He is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy an additional buffalo to get more milk.

loans.name: Meerim

texts.en:
Meerim is a freshman student in the International and Business Law Program. Here is her story:

I have chosen to study international and business law because I have always interested in studying law, and because I think every person should know their rights. In Kyrgyzstan the rights of people are often broken, and many of them do not know how to protect themselves. I want to know every single law of our country, and to use that knowledge to determine fairness. Nobody is going to let you win, and our lives are one long competition, with every loss and win making you stronger. I think every person should understand this. The rules of this competition are codified in state laws. To win this competition you must know these rules and use them for your profit. 

When I was deciding where to go to university, I found that AUCA has the department that fits me best. I am happy that I found what I really need and want. Many people say that our country has enough lawyers, but I think that only a few people can become worthy lawyers. It must come from your heart, and as for me, I cannot wait until I begin learning jurisprudence. I think it will be very hard, but when it is hard, it means that you are on the right path.

loans.use: to pay for her higher education.

loans.name: Enkhchimeg

texts.en:
Mrs. Enkhchimeg, 33 years old, lives with her husband and two children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She and her husband have been growing vegetables and crops since 2010. Before this, she used to work as accountant. Her elder son studies at high-school and her younger son stays at home. 

She is requesting a loan of 2000000 MNT to buy home appliances such as a refrigerator and a vacuum cleaner. By doing so, her family will live in comfortable and warm place. The borrower is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to buy home appliances.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en: Rosita is 58 years old and manages a sari-sari store in her local community. Her main goal in her business is to have higher sales and satisfy all her customer's demands. The income she gains from her general store is used for their daily consumption and maintenance of their rice field. To make her goal possible, Rosita decided to borrow a loan of PHP 20,000 to buy soap, shampoo, toothpaste, bread and drinks to sell. She believes that by borrowing additional capital, she will further improve her financial stability and her way of living.

loans.use: to buy soap, shampoo, toothpaste, breads and drinks to sell

loans.name: Patricio Salomon

texts.es:
Patricio Salomon tiene 23 años de edad vive junto a su esposa y padres en el distrito de Lagunas, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo, costa norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la fabricación de colchones de paja y algodón y los comercializa en diversos distritos aledaños a su comunidad, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 4 000 nuevos soles para la compra de una motocarguera para negocio con este equipo se ahorrará el servicio de carga mensual de 250 nuevos soles mensuales por carga de insumos para su fábrica y así generara mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Patricio Salomon is 23 years old and lives with his wife and parents in the district of Lagunas. The population of the city works in agriculture, business and livestock, it is an hour from the city of Chiclayo on the north coast of Peru. 
He makes straw and cotton mattresses and sells them in various districts around his community. He is asking for a loan for $1, 450 dollars to purchase a trailer for his motorcycle. With this equipment, he will save on the transportation service he pays for monthly so that he can take supplies he needs for his product from the factories to his workshop. He will be able to earn more money for his family.

loans.use: Purchase a motorcycle trailer for his business.

loans.name: Walther

texts.es:
Walter tiene 56 años de edad, vive junto a su hijo en el sector El Ocho una zona rural de Oyotun , es una comunidad tranquila, su población se dedica a los cultivos de arroz, yuca, maíz, ganadería y comercio a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, costa norte del Perú.

El tiene una bodega donde ofrece arroz, aceite, azúcar entre otros productos de primera necesidad, es un padre emprendedor que se esfuerza en la labor que desempeña, ha solicitado un préstamo de 4 000 nuevos soles para la compra de productos de primera necesidad y de esta manera abastecer su negocio, generando mayores ingresos para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Walter is 56 years old and lives with his son in the sector of El Ocho, a rural zone of Oyotun. It is a calm community, the population works cultivating rice, yucca, corn, livestock and business. It is two hours from the city of Chiclayo, on the north coast of Peru. 
He has a shop where he sells rice, oil, sugar and other basic necessities. He is an enterprising father who works hard. He is asking for loan for $1,450 dollars to purchase basic necessities to supply his store. By doing so, he will be able to earn more money and have a better quality of life.

loans.use: Purchase basic necessities.

loans.name: Felesta

texts.en: Felesta is a 30-year-old hardworking woman with three children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. She operates a bar business but also has a poultry project in order to raise money to support her family. Like most responsible mothers, she desires to educate her children up to the University. She is challenged by bad debtors and inadequate capital to meet the demands of her customers while her dreams are to own a hotel in town and diversify her business to include housing. Felesta will use the loan to buy beer, soda and local brew to sell.

loans.use: to buy beer, soda and local brew to sell.

loans.name: Efrain

texts.es: El señor  Efraín tiene 28 años, el se dedica  a  la crianza de ganado para su posterior venta, el vive en la localidad de Batallas, este préstamo es primero que tiene con la institución, el señor  Efraín va a usar este préstamo para compra de un ganado mejorado para tener una mejor producción, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es mejorar sus ingresos, el señor  Efraín enfrenta retos en su negocio que son mejorar su negocio y calidad de vida,  señor  Efraín va a utilizar los beneficios mejorar sus ingresos y también comprar forraje para su ganado, el señor  Efraín desea para su negocio crecer en la crianza y venta de ganado, El es una persona muy  trabajadora y emprendedora con ganas de seguir adelante y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en: Efraín is 28 years old. He works raising cattle that is later sold. He lives in the town of Batallas. This is the first loan he has with the institution. Efrain will use this loan to buy improved cattle in order to have better production. His reason for the loan is to improve his income. Efrain's business challenges are to improve his business and life quality. He will use this loan to buy fodder for his cattle. Efrain wants to grow his business of raising and selling cattle. He is a hardworking and enterprising person with desire to move forward and improve his life quality.

loans.use: To buy cattle

loans.name: Ma. Melda

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Melda works hard to support her family. She raises livestock in the Philippines and earns additional income from her general store. She is applying for a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy vitamins and other supplies for her livestock.

Melda has been successfully raising her livestock through her own hard work and her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes to attain her goal: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy vitamins and other supplies for her livestock.

loans.name: Mira

texts.en:
Mira is married and works hard to support her family. For the past twenty years she has sold food that she makes to the community.

Mira is applying for a 6,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy ingredients like flour, meat, sugar, vegetables, etc. for her food production business. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is 50 years old and married with six children. 

Lucia is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. Lucia requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to purchase vitamins, vaccines and other supplies for her livestock.

Lucia has been raising livestock for one year now and has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

Lucia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase vitamins, vaccines and other supplies for her livestock

loans.name: Mourice's Group

texts.en:
Ematiri Group is a group of four group leader farmers in Kakamega North District with Mourice selected as the Kiva representative. Mourice is on the right side in the photo with his hand raised.  Farming inputs will be delivered to him and the 41 other individual farmers represented by this group.  The credit consists of the necessary materials to plant ¼ acre of maize and ¼ acre of millet or sorghum.  The individual farmers are not pictured here but will be receiving an average loan of 5,349 shillings.
							
Mourice is a reliable member of the community.  He is married with 18 children.  Mourice is 68 years old and has been working as a farmer for the last 16 years to support his family.  In addition to this, Mourice is very active in his community and is involved in the savings group.  He described his harvest last year as good.  He hopes to continue working with One Acre Fund and enjoying the success he is having with the One Acre Fund farm packages.
							
Mourice first enrolled with One Acre Fund in 2012 and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2014 Long Rains season.  Mourice joined One Acre Fund in order to get the best seed prices, get new farming methods and earn enough to feed family.  He also volunteered to be a group leader and Kiva representative because he is an active community member who wants to help more farmers.  Mourice plans to use the money that he earns from his next harvest to send his children to school and save for the future.  He notes that working with One Acre Fund has led to many benefits for One Acre Fund farmers.  Mourice’s own life was improved because he was able to save money and feed the family.  
		
One Acre Fund focuses on working with smallholder farmers across Kenya.  The organization pre-purchases seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings onto the farmers.  Mourice and the Ematiri Group will use the Kiva loan to cover this initial cost of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer package from One Acre Fund.  One Acre Fund continues to provide training and support throughout the planting and harvesting season to ensure a good harvest and repayment.  With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits and improved lives.							

The field officer is also included in the photo and is standing on the left of the photo.

loans.use: to buy maize, millet, and sorghum seeds.

loans.name: Edisa

texts.en:
Edisa is 33 years old and married, with seven children. With four children still in school, Edisa works very hard to provide for them.

Edisa runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 7,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase more items to sell in her general store.

Edisa has been in this business for two years and she sells a variety of items, such as snack foods, biscuits, canned goods, noodles, and bread. 

In the future, Edisa would like to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira is 52 years old and married with seven children.

She earns a living by raising livestock in the Philippines. Elvira is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to purchase additional livestock, vitamins and other supplies for her business.

Elvira has been raising livestock for five years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional livestock, vitamins and other supplies for her business.

loans.name: Gertrudes

texts.en:
Gertrudes is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business raising cattle in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to buy additional cattle and other supplies for her business.

Gertrudes has been in this business for four years. Gertrudes earns more income from buying and selling bananas.

Gertrudes has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional cattle and other supplies for her business

loans.name: Joy

texts.en:
Joy is 24 years old and is married with one child. She earns her income through the sale of crops and livestock, and she receives a monthly wage as a Community Knowledge Worker (CKW). Community Knowledge Workers are trusted community members who provide agricultural data and advice to rural farmers in their local area, including information about the weather, market prices, crop diseases and agricultural tools. On her land, Joy grows maize, beans, coffee, vegetables, cassava, oranges, mangoes and bananas. She also has cows, goats, pigs and chickens.

Joy has served as a CKW for the last two years, and she looks forward to renewing her CKW contract for the next three years. As a CKW, she will use the materials in her business-in-a-box (smartphone, solar charging set, and weighing scale) to disseminate vital agricultural information to the other members of her village, which will help them to improve their crop yields and increase their incomes. With the additional money she will earn as a CKW, Joy will open up a retail business in her village to supplement income earned from the sale of agricultural products. Her biggest dream in life is to become a successful farmer and businesswoman able to guide other members of the village to work towards getting rid of poverty.

loans.use: To purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set and weighing scale

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en:
Harriet is 35 years old and is married with four children. She earns her income through the sale of crops and livestock, and she receives a monthly wage as a Community Knowledge Worker (CKW). Community Knowledge Workers are trusted community members who provide agricultural data and advice to rural farmers in their local area, including information about the weather, market prices, crop diseases and agricultural tools. On her land, Harriet grows maize, beans, coffee, groundnuts, cotton and bananas. She also has goats and chickens.

Harriet has served as a CKW for the last two years, and she looks forward to renewing her CKW contract for the next three years. As a CKW, she will use the materials in her business-in-a-box (smartphone, solar charging set, and weighing scale) to disseminate vital agricultural information to the other members of her village, which will help them to improve their crop yields and increase their incomes. With the additional money she will earn as a CKW, Harriet will buy more land to farm on and rear a wide range of livestock. Her biggest dream in life is to become a model farmer and free people in her community from poverty by helping them to adopt better agricultural practices.

loans.use: To purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set and weighing scale

loans.name: Yen

texts.en:
Yen is 36 years old and married. Her husband is a driver for hire. She has been running a beauty salon in front of her door for 15 years. She started this business to cover her expenses and raise her child. They live in Ho Chi Minh City.

Yen is requesting a loan to expand her business by offering more hair dye and better quality hair care products so that she will be able to increase the turnover of her business. 

She hopes that through the loan, she will be able to expand her business activities and have money to reinvest in her business in the future.

loans.use: To buy hair dye and better quality hair care products.

loans.name: Artyom

texts.en:
Artyom has been selling flowers from a small rented store in Gyumri town. He is a hard working and attentive father of a 19-year-old daughter. His wife works at a local school as a teacher. 

Artyom does his best to satisfy his customers' needs and gathers a good income for the family. Now, by asking for this loan, Artyom would like to purchase flowers, baskets and other materials needed for his work. Because of his family's many costs, he is not managing to save money for these kinds of purchases.
 
Artyom has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. The loan will be a great support for Artyom and he hopes for lenders' support.

loans.use: to pay for flowers, baskets and materials to sell flowers

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en:
Wilson is 34 years old and married with four children. He earns his income through the sale of crops and through livestock. He earns a monthly wage as a Community Knowledge Worker (CKW). Community Knowledge Workers are trusted community members who provide agricultural data and advice to rural farmers in their local area, including information about the weather, market prices, crop diseases and agricultural tools. 

On his land, Wilson grows maize, beans, coffee, cassava, vegetables, sweet potatoes and bananas. He also has cows, goats, pigs and chickens. 

As a CKW, Wilson will use the materials in his business-in-a-box (a Smartphone, a solar charging set, and a weighing scale) to disseminate vital agricultural information to the other members of his village, helping them to improve their crop yields and increase their incomes. With the additional money he will earn as a CKW, Wilson will be able to pay for extra labor on his farm to increase production. His biggest dream in life is to own an agricultural shop dealing in farm inputs.

loans.use: To purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set and a weighing scale

loans.name: Fely

texts.en:
At the age of 62, Fely still has an eagerness to work, in order to earn better income for living. In reality, Fely doesn’t need to work hard, since she has monthly support from her children. But, with her desire to stand on her own, Fely runs a general store business, selling a variety of grocery items in her village.

Fely wants to re-stock her retail store to earn greater income. With her determination to expand her retail store, she is seeking a loan of PHP 20,000. She will use it to buy coffee, sugar, milk, canned goods, and more kinds of merchandise. Fely hopes to satisfy her regular customers' needs and encourage more customers to buy the products she sells.

loans.use: to buy coffee, canned goods, and more kinds of merchandise, to sell in her store

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 28-year-old married man from Attel village, near Tulkarem City. he lives with his wife in a simple house. For the past five years, Ahmad has been working in a small store that he owns, selling carpets. He imports these products from outside Palestine. Ahmad would like to improve his business and increase the products in his store. 

Ahmad took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy more products for his carpet store. By taking this loan, Ahmad will be able to improve his store and also his income.

Ahmad appears in the photo while he was working in his store.

loans.use: to buy more products for his carpets store.

loans.name: Oscar

texts.es:
Oscar tiene 35 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa en una comunidad pequeña en la zona rural de Ucupe, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo, costa norte del Perú.

Junto a su esposa se dedican a la crianza de ganado vacuno y venta de leche, son una pareja que esfuerza en la labor que desempeñan, se despiertan temprano para ir a ordeñar sus vacas para ofrecer en su domicilio la venta de leche fresca para los desayunos.

Ha solicitado un préstamo de 3 000 nuevos soles para la compra de una vaca lechera y de esta manera incrementar la producción de leche, generándole mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
