Oscar is 35 years old and he lives with his wife in the small community in the rural zone of Ucupe. The population here works in agriculture, business and livestock. It is one hour from the city of Chiclayo on the north coast  of Peru. 
Along with his wife, he raises livestock and sells milk. There are a hard working pair. They work up early in order to milk their cows and to sell the fresh milk for breakfast from their home. 
He is asking for a loan of $1,050 dollars in order to purchase a milk cow and be able to increase production, making more money for his family.

loans.use: Purchase a milk cow.

loans.name: Elena

texts.es:
Elena tiene 57 años de edad, vive junto a su hijo en el Caserío Carrizal una zona rural de Oyotun, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta de queso, quesillo y frutas en los distritos aledaños, en la parte posterior a su domicilio se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de animales menores gallinas, cuyes y patos.

Ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 000 nuevos soles para la compra de alimentos balanceados para engorde de animales y una segunda parte para la compra de frutas de distintas variedades y así incrementar su negocio, generando mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en: Elena, 57, lives with her son in Carrizal, a rural area of Oyotun located two hours from the city of Chiclayo on Peru's north coast. The residents farm, run businesses, and raise livestock. Elena sells cheese, curd, and fruit in nearby districts. She raises and sells small animals like laying hens, guinea pigs, and ducks from her backyard. She has applied for a loan of 1000 nuevos soles to buy feed to fatten the animals and to buy various kinds of fruit so that she can grow her business and earn more money for her family.

loans.use: to buy animal feed and fruit.

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es:
Jorge tiene 40 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa y cuatro hijos en el centro poblado de Huacapampa una zona rural de Cañaris, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, costa norte del Perú.

El se dedica al cultivo de café desde hace diez años, ha solicitado un préstamo de 4 000 nuevos soles para la compra de abono, pago de jornaleros y podas que requiere su cultivo y de esta manera tener una buena cosecha de café, generándole mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Jorge is 40 years old and lives with his wife and four children in the center of the town Huacapampa in the rural zone of Cañaris. The population here works in agriculture, business and livestock. It is two hours from the city of Chiclayo, on the north coast of Peru. 
He has worked cultivating coffee for ten years. He is asking for a loan for $1, 450 dollars in order to purchase fertilizer, paying day laborers and young plants that need caring for. With these supplies he will be able to have a better coffee harvest and earning more money for his family.

loans.use: Purchase fertilizer and maintain his fields.

loans.name: Eli Noe

texts.es:
Eli Noe tiene 27 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa en el caserío de Playa azul, una zona rural del distrito de Pucará, una comunidad que se caracteriza por un clima caluroso, su población se dedica al cultivo de frutales, café, arroz, maíz y comercio de los mismos, ganadería ubicado a dos horas de la ciudad de Jaén, que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

El se brinda servicio de transporte público en su mototaxi desde hace diez años, trasladando a sus clientes a las zonas aledañas a su comunidad, también ofrece servicio de movilidad escolar, ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 000 nuevo soles para darle mantenimiento a su vehículo y de esta manera seguir brindado el servicio de una manera segura y generando ingresos para el sostenimiento de su familia.
texts.en: Eli Noe, 27, lives with his wife in Playa Azul, a rural area in the Pucará district that has a very warm climate and is located two hours from the city of Jaén, Cajamarca in Peru's northern mountains. The residents grow fruit, coffee, and corn; run businesses; and raise livestock. For ten years, Eli Noe has been driving customers to local destinations and schools in his motortaxi. He has applied for a loan of 1000 nuevo soles to maintain his taxi so that he can continue to offer safe service and earn money to support his family.

loans.use: to maintain his vehicle.

loans.name: Jorge Armando

texts.es:
Jorge Armando tiene 31 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa en el distrito de Oyotun, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, costa norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la compra y venta de animales de corral pavos, patos , gallinas en la parte posterior a su domicilio, ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 000 nuevos soles para la compra de alimentos balanceados y compra de cerdos y de esta manera incrementar su negocio, genrando mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Jorge Armando is 31 years old and lives with his wife in the district of Oyotun. The population here works in agriculture, business and livestock. It is two hours from the city of Chiclayo on the north coast of Peru. 
He buys and sells animals like turkeys, ducks and chickens behind his house. He is asking for a loan for $725 to purchase balanced feed to give to his animals and to purchase pigs and be able to expand his business. He will then be able to earn more money for his family.

loans.use: purchase foods for a balanced diet for his animals.

loans.name: Dje Ka Tagne Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe   DJE KA TAGNE   sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de  30 ans, 3 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à KADIANA, une des Sous-préfecture de la 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités à tout moment vente de cosmétiques, d'habits et de la restauration. Elles sont à leur premier prêt avec l’institution et compte bien le rembourser.
Mme   KOROTOUMOU  (1ère à gauche sur la photo) compte acheter avec son prêt 2 colis de condiments et 100kg de riz. Elle fait la restauration quotidiennement à Kadiana et est très sollicitée surtout le jour de foire.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 25 000FCFA.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the Dje Ka Tagne group are married women with an average age of 30 years and an average of 3 children each. They all live in polygamous families in Kadiana, one of the sub-prefectures of the third administrative region of Mali. They partnered with the microfinance organization Soro Yiriwaso in order to better run their businesses, such as the sale of cosmetics, clothing, and restaurant business. They are on their first loan with the organization and plan to fully repay it.

Korotoumou (the first woman on the left in the photo) plans to use her loan to purchase 2 packages of spices and 100kg of rice. She is in the restaurant business every day in Kadiana and is in high demand, especially on festival days. She hopes to earn an average monthly profit of 25,000 francs CFA. This will allow her to pay back her loan and also to help her husband with the daily expenses.

loans.use: to purchase rice and spices for her restaurant business

loans.name: Saream

texts.en:
Saream is a married woman with six children. She currently lives with her spouse in Pou Mongkol village of Ponhea Lueu district, Kandal province. She and her husband are employed as paid laborers at an offshore fishery, where fish are supplied to local retailers. She has been in this occupation since 2012 and earns a daily wage of $4 per day. 

Saream would like to boost her income by investing in the purchase of fish for making fermented fish (Prahok in Khmer), which she can sell into the markets at a reasonable price. Due to inadequate capital, she is asking for a $1,000 loan through HKL to buy fish. She hopes that the loan will bring her a high income, which she can use to expand her business and secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of fish for making fermented fish.

loans.name: Julie

texts.en:
Julie is 26 years old and has four children. Julie is married and has three children who are still in school.

Julie is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Julie requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Julie has been raising pigs for one year now, and has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Julie would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is 33 years old and she lives in Likoni area where she also does her business. She sells second-hand clothes and she has been in the business for more than five years. She started the business from the small savings that she made over time and the business has been feeding her and her family.

She heard about Milango from friends who encouraged her to join so that she would be able to access funding for her business. She now seeks a loan to buy bales of second-hand clothes to sell. She hopes that in the next five years she will grow her business to a point where she will be importing the clothes herself and selling them wholesale. 

The major challenges that she has faced in the business is unstable prices and inflation. The income that she will raise will improve her standards of living.

loans.use: to buy bales of second-hand clothes.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is a married woman with six children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Evangeline is 46 years old and has three children who are still in school.

Evangeline has an abaca weaving business in the Philippines. Evangeline requested a PHP 18,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional raw materials for her business.

Evangeline has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, Evangeline would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional raw materials for her business.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 30 years old and married with three children. With two children currently in school, Gina works very hard to provide for them.

Gina runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock like canned goods, noodles, soft-drinks, cooking oil, detergent soap, shampoo, etc. to sell.

Gina has been in this business for eight years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, noodles, soft-drinks, cooking oil, detergent soap, shampoo, etc. 

In the future, Gina would like to save enough money so she could afford to keep her children in school.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock like canned goods, noodles, soft-drinks, cooking oil, detergent soap and shampoo to sell.

loans.name: Patson's Group

texts.en:
Amani is a group of eight group leader farmers in Chwele District, with Patson selected as the Kiva representative of the group. Patson has volunteered to be the Kiva group representative and is on the right side of the photo, with his hand raised. Farming inputs will be delivered to him and the 93 other individual farmers represented in this group. The credit consists of the necessary materials to plant ¼ acre of maize and ¼ acre of millet or sorghum.  The individual farmers are not pictured here, but will be receiving an average loan of KES 5,349 (shillings).
							
Patson is a reliable member of the community. He is married, with 12 children. Patson is 54 years old and he has been working as a farmer for the last 25 years to support his family. In addition to this, Patson is very active in his community and is involved in the men's group. He described his harvest last year as being good. He hopes to continue working with One Acre Fund and to continue enjoying the success he is having with the One Acre Fund farm packages.
							
Patson  joined One Acre Fund in 2009 and he is now enrolling in the Long Rains 2014 season as a group leader. Patson joined One Acre Fund, so that he could get the best seed prices. Because he is an active community member, Patson has gotten more involved with One Acre Fund, as a group leader and as a Kiva representative. Working with One Acre Fund has improved Patson 's life because he has more farm training. In the future, Patson  hopes that his profits from 2014 can be used to send his children to school.  							

Patson and the Amani Group need a loan to cover the initial costs of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer through One Acre Fund. One Acre Fund will repay the Kiva loan on behalf of the farmers, through the profits from the farmers’ harvests. 

One Acre Fund pre-purchases the seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings to the farmers. Throughout the planting and harvesting season, One Acre Fund also provides training and support to the farmers, as they make payments back to One Acre Fund. With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits, and improved lives.
							
The field officer is also included in the photo and is standing on the left.

loans.use: to obtain hybrid seed and fertilizer for harvesting maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Henry

texts.en: Henry is a 22-year-old married man with two children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He is involved in the transport business. He started as a hired rider who would remit 80% of his daily earnings to his boss. After accumulating enough savings over time, he has been able to buy his own motorcycle. His plan is to have at least three motorcycles for business despite the challenges of the high cost of fuel and the poor road network. Henry is requesting a loan to buy a motorcycle for his transport business.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle for his transport business..

loans.name: Anh

texts.en:
Anh is 39 years old and is married with two daughters. She and her husband have been running a general store in front of her door for 13 years. She started this business to cover her expenses and raise her children. They live in Ho Chi Minh City.

Anh is requesting a loan to expand her business by offering more food and many kinds of soft drinks so that she will be able to increase the turnover of her business. 

She hopes that through the loan, she will be able to expand her business activities and have money to reinvest in her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy many kinds of foods and soft drinks to sell at her store.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is a 41-year-old married man with seven children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He is a farmer, and he started the business after accessing its lucrative nature, since agriculture is the backbone of Uganda's economy. 

A good father that he is, he dreams of educating his children to attain degrees as a minimum qualification. Pests and diseases highly affect his yields, while his desire is to venture into modern farming and animal rearing. 

Paul intends to use the loan to buy cows for rearing.

loans.use: to buy cows for rearing.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en: Paul is a 41-year-old hardworking man with three children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He is a farmer who does both crops and dairy farming. With the proceeds he has been able to pay school fees for his children and buy land to expand his business. Unpredictable weather changes and price fluctuation are his major challenges while his dream is to become a model farmer in the area. Paul intends to use the loan to buy cows for milk production.

loans.use: to buy cows for milk production.

loans.name: Nurkyz

texts.en:
Nurkyz is a freshman in the International and Comparative Politics Program at the American University of Central Asia. She is applying for an 1,100 USD loan to support her studies. Here is her story:

Since my childhood I have always wanted to be a diplomat and to serve my country. My dreams are becoming a reality now that I have passed the AUCA entrance exam and spent two years of hard work studying and improving my English.

Why did I choose International and Comparative Politics at AUCA? 1) I firmly believe that I will use all of the knowledge, skills and bright ideas from my university classes to develop diplomatic relations between the Kyrgyz Republic and other countries. 2) I am a very sociable person by nature, and I always try to find something in common with different types of people. I love working with people, and I hope to travel and work around the world studying the traditions, customs, and languages of different people. 3) Roza Otunbaeva and Chingiz Aitmatov are my idols. Their tremendous contribution towards the development of Kyrgyz diplomatic affairs makes me want to be a diplomat, and I hope to have the same influence that they did.

I am absolutely confident that I will be one of the well-known politicians or diplomats of Kyrgyzstan. The future of the country depends on our youth, and I believe that our young people will take the best practices and examples from around the world and use them to develop our country.

I also would like to thank my parents for their constant support. Thanks to them I could choose to study what I wanted.

loans.use: to pay for higher education costs

loans.name: Nadia Group

texts.en:
This group is called Nadia, and consists of four ladies who live in Sana`a, Yemen. They are hardworking women and applied for a loan of 150,000 YER. 

Nadia is the leader of the group. She is a 30-year-old married woman who lives in Sana`a, Yemen. She is employed and gets a small salary that is not enough to cover all the family's needs. She works hard to provide for her family. She feels tired when she does the laundry by hand because she doesn’t have enough money to buy a washing machine. Therefore she is requesting a loan from AMB to help her cover the cost of purchasing a washing machine in order to improve the living conditions in her house. 

Taking this loan will allow her and her family to feel comfortable, so they can enjoy living in their house.

loans.use: to help cover the cost of purchasing a washing machine.

loans.name: Reine Nelsa

texts.fr: Reine est une jeune femme de 26 ans célibataire, mère deux enfants. Elle est commerçante et a ouvert une parfumerie  qu'elle gère depuis un an déjà. Elle a souvent un problème du a l'absence de produits cosmétiques, mèches, et greffes dans son institut parce qu'elle achète ses produits en détail. Son but étant de satisfaire sa clientèle et de réaliser un grand bénéfice. Elle sollicite un crédit pour pouvoir acheter son matériel en grande quantité celui qui permettra d'atteindre ses objectifs. Le bénéfice tiré de ce crédit l'aidera a satisfaire ses besoins, ceux de son enfant, aussi d'épargner pour accroitre son activité dans le future.
texts.en:
Reine is a young unmarried woman, 26 years old, and the mother of two children. She is a shopkeeper and opened a perfume shop which she has operated for the past year. She often runs into the issue of a lack of cosmetic products, braids, and hair extensions because she has to buy these items at retail. Her goal is to meet the needs of her customers and to earn a large profit.

Reine is requesting a loan to be able to purchase her products in bulk which will allow her to meet these goals. The profit she earns from this loan will help her to meet her needs and those of her children, as well as to put money into savings to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to increase her stock of cosmetics, hair extensions, and braids

loans.name: Kingsley's Group

texts.en:
Kingsley, who is a single man in his mid-30s, has one child who is in school. 

For 16 years now, Kingsley has had a business selling salt to market women. He normally operates his business from 7:30 a.m. to 6:00 p.m. daily and is able to make a good monthly profit. 

This will be his fourth loan request from ID-Ghana. Kingsley repaid his previous loans fully and he purchased more business stock. With his business profit, he covered school fees, family food and medical expenses. Kingsley is also saving to buy a plot of land. 

With this loan, he will buy three big bags of salt to supply to three market women. 

He will share this loan with his loan group members. The group consists of three members who will hold each other accountable for repaying back the loan of GHS 1,800.

loans.use: To buy three big bags of salt to sell

loans.name: Surriya

texts.en:
Surriya is 53 years old and living with her spouse and eight children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 

Her husband has been running a general store in which he sells rice, sugar, cooking oil, detergent, soap biscuits, etc. He manages his household necessities from his own store. His few relatives like to purchase from his general store as well. He has built a good reputation among his customers. This good relationship positively impacts his sales but he does not have sufficient stock to cope with the consistent demand. 

Therefore, Surriya requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan for her husband so he can buy sacks of rice, sugar, flour, etc. She is very glad after taking this loan and hopeful that he will successfully fulfill each request for any item and prevent the disappointment of his customers. She is very thankful to Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan and assured that she will pay all due installments on time and with regularity.

loans.use: to buy inventory for her husband's general store.

loans.name: Edgardo

texts.en: Edgardo, is aged 54, married and blessed with three children. He owns and operates a fish selling business together with his wife at the public market. His profits are usually spent on their daily expenditures and food allowance. Due to financial constraints, he would like to take a loan amounting to PHP 30,000 to purchase additional fish to sell. He's hoping that his request for the loan will be granted so that he can improve his business to earn more profits.

loans.use: to purchase fish to sell.

location.town: Zipagan St. Dist. 1, Cauayan City, Isabela

loans.name: Lon

texts.en:
Lon, aged 32, is an experienced farmer from a rural village of Baray district, Kampong Thom province. She has been doing farming for more than 10 years and also works as a paid laborer for additional income. She has a common law relationship with her husband, who is a loving father of three children and who has the same business as she does. 

At the moment, Lon’s home is under construction and she needs more materials to have it finished. Due to a shortage of money, she is asking for a loan to buy wood for the construction of her home. She hopes that, through the help of the loan, she can provide everyone in her family with a suitable place to live and comfortable living conditions.

loans.use: to buy wood for the construction of her home.

loans.name: Nidal

texts.en:
Nidal is a 45-year-old single man from Nablus city.  He lives in a small house in the city.  For the past sixteen years, Nidal has been working in a small sewing workshop he owns.  It is a good business and Nidal has a good volume of orders for several traders.  Nidal would like to improve his business but he does not have enough money. 

Nidal took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new sewing machine for his workshop.  By taking this loan, Nidal will be able to increase his productivity with a better quality. Nidal and his family's living conditions will be improved. 

Nidal appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine for his workshop.

loans.name: Flavio Alfaro (Montecristi) Group

texts.es:
EL Grupo De Crédito  Flavio Alfaro se reúne cada quince días en Montecristi,  conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.
Este Banco Comunal está integrado por 10 mujeres y 2 hombres, son personas muy humildes y trabajadoras que al enterarse de los beneficios que les brinda la institución decidieron unirse y formar este grupo el cual les va a servir de mucho para salir adelante. Se dedican a diversas actividades tales como la artesanía, comercio en general, entre otras actividades.
Una de las socias de este grupo es la señora Maryuri,tiene 40 años de edad, está casada y de esa relación tiene 4 hijos de 20, 18,  17 y 13 años de edad, todos aun viven en su casa y dos de ellos estudian en colegio. Su esposo es ebanista. 
Doña Maryuri es una mujer muy luchadora que se dedica al comercio con la finalidad de ayudar a su marido en la dura tarea de sacar adelante a su familia, ella vende ropa de topo tipo y su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, ella sale en los momentos que está desocupada a vender y a cobrar ya que deja a crédito y cobra por semanas, este negocio lo empezó con el primer crédito que recibió y su clientela es muy buena y cumplida lo cual le permite ganar sus recursos de muy buena forma y utilizarlos en los estudios de sus hijos menores.
Este crédito es para comprar ropa de todo tipo. Este es su segundo ciclo en el Grupo De Crédito  y le gusta porque puede sacar adelante su negocio. Su sueño es darles lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The Flavio Alfaro communal bank meets every two weeks in Montecristi, a town known for its rich precolonial culture, for its nationally and internationally famous handicrafts, and for its toquilla straw hats. The communal bank comprises 10 women and two men. They are modest, hardworking people who together decided to form this group when they heard about the benefits the institution offered that would help them get ahead. The members have a variety of activities such as making handicrafts and running businesses.

Maryuri, 40, belongs to the group and is married. She and her husband have four children, ages 20, 18, 17, and13, who live at home, though two of them are in high school. Her husband is a cabinetmaker. Maryuri works hard at her business to help her husband support their family. She goes door-to-door selling many kinds of clothing whenever she is free. She offers credit and collects every week from her customers. She started this business with her first loan. She has excellent, responsible customers, and she earns a good income that pays for her younger children's education. 

She will use this loan to buy a variety of clothing. This is the group's second loan cycle, and the members are pleased to be able to continue running their businesses. Maryuri dreams of giving her children the best she can.

loans.use: to buy clothing.

loans.name: Yeredeme Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe  YEREDEME  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de  30 ans, 3 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à KADIANA, une des Sous-préfecture de la 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités à tout moment telle la vente des articles de beauté et faire de la restauration. Elles sont à leur premier prêt avec l’institution.
Mme  SALIMATA (1ère à gauche sur la photo) compte acheter avec son prêt 1colis de condiments et 50kg de riz. Elle fait la restauration le jour de foire au à Kadiana où elle est très sollicitée.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 17 250FCFA.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en: The members of the Yeredeme group are married women, who are on average 30 years old, have three children and all live in polygamous families in Kadiana, one of the sub-prefectures of the third administrative region of Mali. They have been working with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution in order to better run their businesses, which include selling beauty supplies and prepared foods, at all times. They are on their first loan with the institution. Ms. Salimata (the first to the left of the photo) expects to buy one package of vegetables and spices for sauces and 50 kilograms of rice. She sells prepared foods on the day of the fair in Kadiana, where she is very sought after. She expects to make an average monthly profit of 17,250 f CFA. This profit will allow her to pay back her loan and also to help her husband with the daily expenses.

loans.use: to purchase rice and vegetables and spices for making sauces for a restaurant business

loans.name: Ponsiano

texts.en: Ponsiano is a 28-year-old married man with 2 children living in Fort Portal,Uganda.  After assessing the need for a health center in his area (the government hospital is several miles away),  he decided to set up a medical clinic to serve his community and to earn money to support his family.  The high cost of rent and inadequate capital to meet the variety of patient's needs pose a challenge to his service.  He desires to expand his business into a hospital and educate his children.  Ponsiano intends to use the loan to buy drugs to sell.

loans.use: to buy drugs to sell.

loans.name: Ermek

texts.en:
My desire is to be a writer, to expand my knowledge, and to travel. Throughout my life I have participated in extracurricular activities from School Olympiads to flash mobs. I have striven for academic excellence, always wishing to make the most of my education. In addition, I have managed to work, and have covered some of my basic educational expenses.

Education has always been an important aspect of my life. While in high school and university I took challenging courses, such as Leadership and Critical Skills. Despite time-consuming practices for concerts, parades, musicals and exhibits, I was able to maintain a good GPA, allowing me to graduate with honors. I decided to stay near home and come to AUCA, because of the smaller class sizes and the good program offered in journalism.

During high school I was an active member of several clubs, such as Students in Free Enterprise. I enjoy the arts and participated in many concerts, often involving travel to other parts of Kyrgyzstan. I have also done community work, such as blood pressure screening, and offering information for those at risk for hypertension and diabetes.

All of these experiences have helped to shape me. I have faced many challenges, and I have willingly given my time. My goal is to become a good journalist or writer. I enjoy listening, working with others, and acting as a patient advocate and educator. I have known many excellent people, who helped and taught me. I would one day like to give back what they have given to me, by becoming an instructor, maybe. I know that when my goals have been realized, I will be able to provide something meaningful to the whole world.

loans.use: to pay his higher education tuition

loans.name: Josephat's Group

texts.en:
Mabadiliko Group is a group of seven group leader farmers in Kakamega North District with Josephat selected as the Kiva representative of Mabadiliko Group. Josephat has volunteered to be the Kiva group representative and is on the right of the photo with his hand raised. Farming inputs will be delivered to him and the 63 other individual farmers represented in this group. The credit consists of the necessary materials to plant ¼ acre of maize and ¼ acre of millet or sorghum each. The individual farmers are not pictured here but will be receiving an average loan of 5,349 shillings.

Josephat is 51 years old and has been a farmer for 31 years. Josephat works as a farmer to provide for his nine children. The community and other farmers know Josephat as friendly, hardworking and an experienced farmer. Other than farming, he is also involved in community groups such as the men's group. Josephat described his harvest last year as good, but hopes he can have an even better one with the support of One Acre Fund and the other farmers in his group.

The 2013 Long Rains season won’t be Josephat’s first season with One Acre Fund.  He first joined One Acre Fund in 2011 and has continued working with One Acre Fund in order to get the best seed prices, get new farming methods, get fertilizer and hybrid seeds, earn enough to feed family and send his children to school. As an active member in his community, Josephat also chose to be a group leader and Kiva representative because he likes being a leader, and as an active community member, he wants to help more farmers. Josephat plans on using future profits from the harvest to send children to school, save for the future and buy a cow. His life has improved by working with One Acre Fund because he has more profits from harvest, has more farm training and he is able to feed the family. Josephat also joined One Acre Fund because he wants more food surplus. Josephat’s life has also improved because he pays school fees.  
 							
One Acre Fund focuses on working with smallholder farmers across Kenya. The organization pre-purchases seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings onto the farmers. Josephat and the Mabadiliko Group will use the Kiva loan to cover this initial cost of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer package from One Acre Fund. One Acre Fund continues providing training and support throughout the planting and harvesting season to ensure a good harvest and repayment.  With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits and improved lives.

The field officer is also included in the photo and is standing on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To provide Kenyan farmers with increased access to hybrid seed and fertilizer for harvesting maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en: Mercy is 30 years old and lives in Caldwell. She is unmarried and has two children ages 4 and 10 years old. The children are presently in school and live at home. For the past eight years, she has been selling slippers and children's used clothes in the local market. She has lots of customers and makes lots of profit since she is one of those who sells quality slippers and used clothes, especially during the Christmas season. She is requesting a loan to purchase more slippers and children's used clothes for her business. She plans to expand her business and build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more slippers and used clothes to sell

loans.name: Zaven

texts.en:
Zaven is from Gyumri town, where he lives with his mother and wife. Over the last year, Zaven has been providing transportation service for locals in Gyumri town using his own car. Together with his mother, Zaven also is involved in sewing. They sew different types of clothing and receive orders. Zaven is really enthusiastic in his work and feels very responsible for sustaining his family's living. 

Now, by applying for this loan, Zaven asks financial support for being able to renovate the car and purchase new tires. The loan will also be used to purchase a new sewing machine, so he and his mother will be able to complete all the orders.

Zaven has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. 

The loan is very important for this young man, and he really hopes for lenders' support.

loans.use: to pay for new tires, renovation of the car and also to purchase a new sewing machine for his sewing business.

loans.name: Nguyet

texts.en:
Nguyet is 42 years old and married with three daughters. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband is working in the construction field. She earns an income running a general store in front of their house. 

She started this business 19 years ago. She sells sugar, toys for kids, soft drinks, yogurt and other household items to people in her community. She is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying a greater variety of products, in particular confectionery, milk, foods and beverages, to stock her store and better satisfy her customers.

She hopes her business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy confectionery, milk, foods and beverages for selling at her store.

loans.name: Krubo

texts.en: Krubo lives in Caldwell. She is 42 years old, married, and has four children between 14 and 22 years old. Two of her children are in school and live at home. She completed her education in the sixth grade and for the past 16 years she has been selling frozen fish and chicken in the local market. She started this business with help from her husband and learned this way of selling from her friends. She is requesting a loan to purchase cartons of frozen fish and chicken for her business. Krubo enjoys her business and the profit she receives every day. Her plan is to build a house for her children.

loans.use: to purchase cartons of frozen fish and chicken for her business.

loans.name: Bibiana María

texts.es:
Bibiana, a sus 25 años de edad, es una mujer dinámica y responsable, vive con su esposo y su pequeño hijo de 3 años.
Desde que terminó sus estudios secundarios, su madre le enseñó el arte de la confección, actividad que se ha convertido en su principal fuente de ingresos ya que actualmente trabaja en su propio taller de confección, ubicado en su vivienda, desde allí presta su servicio a terceros y así genera los recursos suficientes para apoyar a su esposo con la carga económica del hogar.
Bibiana tiene como propósito ampliar su taller y comprar más maquinaria para generar empleo, pero es consciente que para lograrlo debe trabajar arduamente, con empeño y disciplina. Esto la impulsa a solicitar el crédito para invertirlo en la compra de insumos al por mayor (telas, hilos, botones, entre otros), esto le permitirá tener material disponible para cumplir con los pedidos que tiene pendientes de una manera oportuna, lo que le abrirá paso a obtener nuevos contratos; dando como resultado un fortalecimiento de su negocio, con el que podrá tener una mayor rentabilidad y disfrutar mejores condiciones de vida y brindar a su hijo un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
Bibiana, at 25 years of age, is a dynamic and responsible woman. She lives with her husband and her small 3 year old son. Since she finished high school, her mother taught her how to sew, activity that has become her main source of income. Currently she works in her own sewing workshop, located in her home. From there she helps others and generates enough resources to support her husband with home expenses.

Bibiana's purpose is to expand her workshop and buy more machinery to generate employment, but she knows that in order to achieve this she has to work hard, with determination and discipline. This inspires her to request a loan to invest in the purchase of supplies at wholesale prices (fabrics, threads, buttons, among others). This will allow her to have the available material to finish her pending orders in a prompt way. Doing so she will be able to get new contracts resulting in a stronger and more profitable business, that will let her enjoy better life conditions and offer her son a better future.

loans.use: To buy supplies at wholesale prices (fabrics, threads, buttons, among others)

loans.name: Swapna

texts.en:
Swapna is a 44-year-old woman who is married to Ravi in Dhupguri village. Both of them are illiterate but can sign their names only. They are blessed with three children. All are studying in school. Swapna is managing household work all day long while her husband has been farming different kinds of seasonal vegetables for many years. Her husband sells his products to the village market hence he cannot generate sufficient income for his family. Swapna is facing many financial hurdles to leading a normal life, so that she is unable to run her family smoothly. She decided to give her husband financial support. She came to know that Kiva’s partner, BJS, lends money to rural women for business. 

Swapna applied for a loan from BJS to purchase potato seeds and fertilizers to grow potatoes and sell them in the local market. She lives in a kaccha house (made of mud and straw). In future she dreams of a concrete house of her own with the profits from her potato business. She sincerely thanks BJS and Kiva for the support.

loans.use: To purchase good quality potato seeds and fertilizers for cultivation of potatoes

loans.name: Anjana

texts.en:
Anjana is 45 years old, married, and has one son.  Anjana attended school up to class VIII (grade 8).  She lives with her husband Dilip, aged 45 years, and their son in the small village of Magurmari in Dhupguri in the district Jalpaiguri, in their own kachha house (made of mud, bamboo and straw).  Anjana's husband has a primary education.  Their son goes to college.

As a main source of income, Anjana's husband is engaged in agricultural business. He has inherited land where he grows different kinds of vegetables. He sells his produce in the local market and earns their livelihood.  As the prices of essential goods are growing day by day, it is impossible for him to bear all the expenses of their family.

Anjana, though a housewife, is very energetic and hard-working.  She is determined to help her husband financially. She has decided to start a milk supply and milk products business so she has taken a loan to purchase a dairy cow.  She will sell milk and milk products (butter, paneer/fresh cheese, curd etc.) in the local area, which she hopes will give her extra financial assistance to help her husband to run the family well.

Anjana plans to invest income from the loan in further propagation of her herd of cows, so as to further extend her business so that she will be able to give a decent lifestyle to her family.

She dreams of building a pacca house (brick-built) for the family with the profit from her business.

She gives her thanks to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow to start a business of milk supply and dairy products.

loans.name: Al-Aman Group

texts.en: This group is called Al-Aman and consists of 4 ladies who live in Sana`a, Yemen. Afrah, 30 years old, lives in Sana`a, Yemen. She is married and has three children. She has worked in the traditional agricultural business of buying and selling sheep for many years. She is a resourceful and honest woman dedicated to her work. She is experienced in sales, which allows her to make a better income. She is requesting a loan of 60,000 YER from AMB to buy sheep to resell. Afrah's goal is to increase her stock of sheep in hopes of offering a better life to her family.

loans.use: to buy sheep to resell so that she can increase her income.

loans.name: Arwa Alhodeida Group

texts.en:
Arwa Alhodeida group consists of four women from Al-Hodeida, Yemen.  Arwa, a 30-year-old married woman with three children, is the leader of the group. She lives with her family. She started a business  door to door selling clothes, perfume, incense, and henna five years ago when her husband was no longer able to pay essential living expenses.  

Arwa wants to expand her business, so she applied for a loan of 20,000 YER to buy perfume, incense, henna, and clothes. She looks forward to opening a store to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy perfume, incense, henna, and clothes to expand her business.

loans.name: Saima

texts.en: Saima is a 27-year-old woman. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of  four children. Her husband is a van driver by profession. For the past many days the engine of the van has not worked properly.  Because of this he is unable to generate any amount of income. He wants to repair it as soon as possible. However, due to the lack of money he finds it difficult to cover the cost of repairing the engine. Therefore Saima has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband cover the cost of repairing. This will help him to continue his business. Saima is very much thankful to KIVA.

loans.use: to help her husband cover the cost of repairing van's engine.

loans.name: Khursheed

texts.en:
Khursheed is a 30-year-old married man. He is an active borrower with BRAC Pakistan. He lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with his family. His wife is a very hardworking and responsible housewife.

Since 2009, Khursheed has been running a lace selling shop, which is the only source of income for the family. Currently he is interested in purchasing some of the latest variety of laces to grow his business, but finds it difficult due to financial constrains. Khursheed has requested a loan amount of 100,000 PKR from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan. This will not only help him to grow his lace selling business but will increase his net income and savings as well. He hopes to provide a quality education for his children. He is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to pay for latest variety of laces

loans.name: Adnan

texts.en:
Adnan is a very hardworking and active borrower of BRAC Pakistan. He lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with his wife and three children. His wife is a responsible housewife, and his children are students. 

Since 2003, he has been running a cloth-selling shop, which is the only source of income for the family. Currently he needs to purchase some new variety of cloth for his shop, but finds it difficult due to a lack of finances. 

Adnan has requested a loan of 100,000 PKR from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to purchase a new variety of cloth for his shop. 

He wishes to provide quality education for his children. He is very much thankful to all the staff of Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase a new variety of cloth.

loans.name: Karim

texts.en: Karim is a 35-year-old married man. He is an active borrower of BRAC Pakistan. He lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with his family. His wife is a very hardworking and responsible housewife. Since 2005, Sharif has been in the business of selling natural herbs, which is the only source of income for the family. Currently, he is interested in purchasing one more shop to grow his business but finds it difficult due to financial constraints. Sharif has requested a loan amount of 100,000 PKR from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan. This will not only help him to grow his milk selling business but will increase his net income and savings as well. He hopes to provide quality education for his children. He is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy a shop.

loans.name: Mayson

texts.en:
Mayson is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband appears in the photo. 

Mayson is a 29-year-old married woman from Nablus city.  She lives with her husband in a simple house in the city.  For the past five years, Mayson and her husband have been working in a small electrical store they own.  It is located in a good area in the city and they have their loyal customers. 

Mayson requested a USD loan from FATEN.   This loan helps Mayson to help her husband buy more products for their electrical store to resell.  By taking this loan, the store will be improved.

loans.use: to help her husband buy more products for their electrical store to resell

loans.name: Julio

texts.es:
Julio es separado y tiene dos hijos ambos estan en el colegio, viven en casa en la casa de sus hermanos, la casa se encuentra ubicada en la zona Villa Cooperativa de la ciudad de El Alto.
El estudio hasta el nivel secundario y actualmente el tiene un pequeño taller de carpinteria donde elabora juegos de dormitorios matrimoniales, con la ayuda de sus hijos.
El crédito lo requiere para  la compra de materia prima: madera, tableros, pinturas etc. Asi podra comprar al por mayor. En esta epoca de fin de año sus pepidos tienden a aumentar.
El sueño de Julio es que sus productos lleguen al interior del pais y el extranjero.
Es la tercera vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Julio is separated and has two children, both in school. They live in his brothers’ house, which is located in the Villa Cooperative area of the city of El Alto.

He studied until secondary school and currently has a small carpentry workshop where he makes double bedroom sets with the help of his children. He needs a loan to purchase raw material: wood, planks, paint, etc. Thus he will be able to buy wholesale. His orders tend to increase at the end of the year.

Julio’s dream is that his products will reach the interior of the country and even abroad. This is the third time he has applied for a loan from IMPRO and the first time from KIVA

loans.use: to purchase wood, planks, paints for his small carpentry workshop.

loans.name: Jose

texts.es:
Jose se dedica al servicio de la construccion como ayudante que pasara a contra-maestro. 
El vive en casa de sus padres, ubicada en El Alto en la z/ Villa Bolivar Michmi, del Departamento de La Paz a una hora de distancia  de la ciudad de La Paz.

El crédito que Jose requiere es para  comprar herramientas de trabajo, como ser picota,plomada, escuadra, carretilla, que le es de mucha necesidad para mejorar su  trabajo, asi poder brindar un buen servicio.

Es la segunda vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en: Jose works in construction as an assistant and will become a master tradesman. He lives in his parents' house on Villa Bolivar Michme in El Alto, about one hour from the city of La Paz in the department of La Paz. Jose needs a loan to buy work tools like a shovel, pick, plumb line, bracket, and wheelbarrow to improve his work and service. This is his second loan cycle with IMPRO and his first with Kiva.

loans.use: to buy tools like a shovel, pick, plumb line, bracket, wheelbarrow that will be useful in his work as a bricklayer.

loans.name: Edith Del Carmen

texts.es: Edith tiene 25 años de edad y es madre soltera de tres hijas de 10 años, 8 años y 4 años de edad y habita junto a ellas en casa propia desde hace mucho tiempo. Edith es una mujer emprendedora quien hace todo lo que este a su alcance para ganarse el pan d cada día y dar a sus hijas mejores condiciones. Ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta de sorbete artesanal y este negocio es su principal fuente de ingresos. Desea mejorar las condiciones habitacionales de su vivienda ya que como se muestra en la fotografía los pilares son de madera y se encuentran deteriorados por causa de los insectos que anidan en ella. Por lo anterior solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en el cambio de los pilares de madera por columnas de concreto y además, poner lámina en la cubierta del techo. Con el crédito comprará cemento, arena, hierro y lámina.
texts.en:
Edith is 25 years, and is a single mother of three daughters ages 10, 8 and 4.  Together, they live in a house that she has owned for a long time.  Edith is an entrepreneurial woman who does all that she can to earn her daily bread and provide her daughters with better living conditions.  She works making and selling artisanal sorbet, a business that is her primary source of income.

She wishes to improve her housing conditions, because as can be seen in the picture, the pillars are made of wood, and have deteriorated because of insects that nest in it.  For this reason, she is seeking a loan from FUSAI to invest in replacing the wooden posts with concrete columns, and put sheet metal on the roof.  With the loan, she will purchase cement, sand, iron and sheet metal.

loans.use: To purchase cement, sand, iron, and sheet metal to build concrete columns and change the roof on her house.

loans.name: Ashuraly

texts.ru: Ашурали великодушный человек. Он родился в 1955 году. Ашурали женат и на воспитании имеет 4 детей. Его дети совершеннолетние. Ашурали очень трудолюбивый человек и всегда старается для благо получения своей семьи. Ашурали занимается предоставлением услуги такси. Он предоставляет свои услуги местным жителям своего района. Он живет на юге Таджикистана. Ашурали привлекает клиентов благодаря хорошему сервису. Он должен провести свадебное торжество своей дочери, но не имеет денег. Он запрашивает займ на сумму 5000 сомони для проведения свадебного торжества. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Ashuraly is a generous person.  He was born in 1955.  Ashuraly is married and raising 4 children.  His children are of age.  Ashuraly is a very hardworking person and always tries hard for his family's welfare.  Ashuraly is involved in providing a taxi service.  He provides his services to local residents of his district.  He lives in the south of Tajikistan.  Ashuraly attracts clients thanks to his good service.  He has to hold a wedding party for this daughter, but does not have money.  He is requesting a loan in the amount of 5000 somoni to hold a wedding party.  He awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to hold a wedding party for his daughter

loans.name: Henry's Group

texts.en:
Henry is a member of Upendo Group in Kakamega North District.  He is pictured here in a group of six One Acre Fund group leader farmers.  The group leaders represent a total of 52 individual One Acre Fund farmers who are not pictured here.  Henry has been selected to act as the Kiva group representative and is standing on the right with his hand raised.  He and the other farmers represented in this group are each receiving farm inputs (hybrid seeds and fertilizer) for one quarter acre of maize and one quarter acre of sorghum or millet.  Each farmer is receiving an average loan of 5,349 KES.							

Henry is a reliable member of the community.  He is is 48 years old, married, with eight children.  Henry has been working as a farmer for the last 26 years to support his family.  In addition to this, Henry is very active in his community and is involved in a men's group and prayer group.  He described his harvest last year as good.  He hopes to continue to work with One Acre Fund and to enjoy the success he is having with the One Acre Fund farm packages.
							
The 2013 Long Rains season won’t be Henry’s first season with One Acre Fund.  He joined One Acre Fund in 2010 and has been working with One Acre Fund in order to get the best seed prices, new farming methods, fertilizer, and hybrid seeds.  As an active member in his community, Henry also chose to be a group leader and Kiva representative because he likes being a leader and is an active community member.  Henry plans on using future profits from the harvest to invest in a business.  His life has improved by working with One Acre Fund because he was able to feed his family and send his children to school.
  							
Henry and the Upendo Group need a loan to cover the initial costs of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer through One Acre Fund.  One Acre Fund will repay the Kiva loan on behalf of the farmers through the profits from the farmers’ harvests.  One Acre Fund pre-purchases the seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings on to the farmers.  Throughout the planting and harvesting season, One Acre Fund also provides training and support to the farmers as they make payments back to One Acre Fund.  With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits and improved lives.
							
The field officer is also included in the photo, standing on the left.

loans.use: To obtain hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Nilda

texts.en:
Nilda is 45 years old and married, and she has four children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. She has a general store business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for two years.

Nilda requested a PHP 7,000 loan amount through NWTF. She will use the loan to buy more stock to sell, like soft drinks, canned goods, shampoo, detergent, batch soap, etcetera.

Nilda would like to build and expand her business, to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell, like soft drinks, canned goods, and shampoo

loans.name: Guillerma

texts.en:
Guillerma works hard to support her family. She is widowed and has an abaca-weaving business in the Philippines.

Guillerma requested a PHP 8,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy more raw materials for her business, like abaca fiber.

Guillerma has been in this business for five years now. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more raw materials for her business, like abaca fiber.

loans.name: Loan

texts.en:
Loan is requesting a new loan to buy a range of new products, such as food and beverages, to restock her general store. This purchase will help her to better meet the needs of her customers. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business and offer her customers a greater variety of products.

She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing both the size of her store and sales, and will also help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a range of new products to sell at her store, particularly foods and beverages.

loans.name: Muoi

texts.en:
Muoi, 44, is married and has two sons and one daughter. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. She earns an income by operating a beauty salon from her house. She started this business 16 years ago.

She requests a loan to expand her business and plans to buy a greater variety of hair care and dye products. These products will help her to better satisfy her customer's needs. She hopes that her business continues to run smoothly and generates a higher income so that she can  improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy hair dye and hair care products to sell.

loans.name: Thao

texts.en:
Thao requests a  loan to buy a range of new products, such as household plastic items, blankets, and bedclothes. This purchase will help her to better meet the needs of her customers. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business and offer her customers a greater variety of products. 
She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her store and increase sales, and will also help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy different kinds of household plastic items, blankets, and bedclothes to sell in her shop.

loans.name: Labiba

texts.en: Labiba was born in 1980. She is married and has four sons and daughters living with her and her retired husband in a sector in Jordan called Southern Ghour. She decided to help her husband financially by running her mini-market one year ago. Now she wants to stock her mini-market with a larger quantity of food products in order to raise her sales and profit but she doesn't have enough money to do so. For this reason, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: To stock her mini market with food products

loans.name: Alia

texts.en: Alia was born in 1991. She is a single lady living in a sector of Jordan called Southern Ghour, with her parents and six siblings. Alia has been selling accessories for 2 years. She started her business as a result of the financial problems faced by her family. She began selling a small amount of her products and then she expanded her business. Now, she is planning to buy a larger quantity of accessories by adding variety, in order to raise her profit. She does not have enough money to do this on her own, so she has applied for this youth loan.

loans.use: To buy more accessories to add variety to her supply.

loans.name: Hanh

texts.en:
Hanh, 54, lives in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City with her family which includes two daughters and her husband. Her husband is a bricklayer. She earns money by operating  a general store. She would like to get a loan to buy a larger stock of beverages, sugar, milk and fast foods to meet her customers' needs.

She hopes that her business will ensure that her family members, especially her children, will have a better education and a better future.

loans.use: to buy beverages, sugar, milk and fast food to sell at her store.

loans.name: Van

texts.en:
Van is 31 years old and is married. Her husband is a driver for hire. Van has operated a general store (from her home) for 15 years. She started this business to cover her family expenses. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. 

Van requests a loan to expand her business by buying household items and many kinds of soft drinks to stock her store. She hopes that these products will enable her to attract more customers and that she will be able to increase her business. She hopes that she will be able to expand her business activities and have money to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to buy household items and soft drinks to stock her store.

loans.name: Deicy Yisel

texts.es:
Deicy es una campesina pujante y luchadora, nacida en el seno de una familia humilde que encontró en el campo una alternativa de vida y de la cual aprendió a realizar todas las actividades agropecuarias que hoy en día son su principal fuente de ingresos. A sus 27 años de edad, se dedica a la cría y comercialización de pollos y carneros, además tiene gallinas ponedoras cuyos huevos son vendidos en el mercado del municipio donde reside; así genera recursos suficientes para apoyar a su esposo con la carga económica del hogar y con el sostenimiento de su hijo de 5 años.
El crédito será invertido en la compra de 100 gallinas ponedoras y 8 carneros, así aumentará la producción y podrá satisfacer la demanda de sus productos, mejorando las ventas y el margen de rentabilidad del negocio. Así podrá avanzar para cumplir su mayor anhelo que es ampliar su galpón y tener una producción de huevos con 1000 gallinas y más carneros, además desea incursionar con la cría y comercialización de pescado para atender otro tipo de mercado, garantizando así una estabilidad económica favorable para dar un mejor nivel educativo a su hijo y disfrutar un futuro más próspero en compañía de los que ama.
texts.en:
Deicy is a hard-working and thriving farmer.  She was born into a poor family in the countryside where they found an alternative lifestyle and that's how she learned about working in agriculture.  Today, she is the main source of the family's income.  She is 27 years old and she raises and sells chickens and sheep.  She also has hens whose eggs are sold in the market in the region in which she lives.  This is how she generates sufficient money to help her husband with burden of the household expenses and how she supports her 5-year-old son.

This loan will be invested in the purchase of 100 hens and 8 sheep.  This will help her increase production and she will be able to meet the demand for her products, increase sales, and improve the profitability margin of her business.  She will be able to make progress in making her biggest dream come true - to expand her warehouse, to increase egg production to 1000 hens, and to sell more meat.  She also wants to dabble in breeding and selling fish so that she can reach another market, which would guarantee a stable economic situation so that she can provide a better education for her son and she can enjoy a prosperous future with the people she loves.

loans.use: to buy 100 hens and 8 sheep.

loans.name: Huikap Pukhri Mapan Women Weaving Shg Group

texts.en:
Weaving has always been the main activity to generate income for Ibemcha. She has been weaving since before her marriage and continues weaving after her marriage. Her friends commented that she is a good weaver. She joined Huikap Pukhri Mapan SHG with nine other women members and they are all hard working. She is the featured borrower for the group and she is pictured with her hand raised. All the members live in the same neighborhood, which is about 45 kms from the capital.

Ibemcha weaves all kinds of women's wrap arounds and shawls. During the festive season, which falls between October and March, Ibemcha’s weaving business is at peak. Women from neighboring villages, neighbors and women vendors in the market contact her for woven products for weddings, send-off ceremonials and other meitei celebrations. If she could deliver all the demands on time, then she could make a good income, but it is difficult because she weaves alone, and it takes three or four days to complete one women's wrap around skirts. To supply a dozen of them requires a month. The finished products are usually sold to the women vendors who sit in the main Imphal market in the capital town of Manipur, which is about 45 kms from where she lives. She supplies them at wholesale and that way the generated income is beneficial.

With the loan, Ibemcha is planning to buy lots of yarns and threads to weave. This is still the wedding season and she has a number demands from the women who sell her products in the main market. Before she took the loan, she used to get her yarn supplies from the shopkeeper on credit and repay  when the woven products are sold. She is happy that with the loan support she does not ask for credit and she can easily make a spot payment and get the full profit without paying half the share to the shopkeepers. She says thank you to Kiva. 

The rest of the group members are also engaged in weaving and vegetable selling businesses.

loans.use: To purchase more yarn and threads

loans.name: Abrar Alhodeida Group

texts.en: This group is called Abrar Alhodeida. It consists of five ladies who live in Hodeidah, Yemen. They have many clients, mostly women. Fatima is 31 years old. She is the coordinator of her group. She is a married woman and has children. She has been selling food for many years. She started selling in her business to assist her husband to cover expenses. Fatima's most important challenges are to work hard to gain extra income and to improve her business structure. She is receiving a loan from AMB to buy food to use for resale. In the future, she would like to expand her business to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy food for resale.

loans.name: Lateefan

texts.en:
Lateefan is a poor but hardworking woman, age 41, living in Lahore, Pakistan. 

Her husband has only a single source of income, which is sheltering services. Her husband provides sheltering services for the construction of roof's and houses. She wants to invest her all savings for the establishment of the business. Sometimes her husband signs two or three contracts for sheltering services at a time, which become the cause of shortage of sheltering material. 
 
Lateefan requested her fifth loan so that her husband can invest more money in the current business. She hopes that through loan amount her husband would be able to buy additional pillars and wooden boards and could get more profit.

loans.use: To buy sheltering material for services.

loans.name: Kalyani

texts.en:
Kalyani is a hardworking lady from a small village in Dhupguri in Jalpaiguri district.  She stays with her husband and one child (a son) in a small kachha house (house made of mud and straw). Kalyani and her husband are illiterate, but know to sign their name. She has only one son Jitu, studying in grade 12. Jitu is very studious. Kalyani is very ambitious for her son. She wants to give him a higher education and wants to see him in a good position in society.  As such, she and her husband work as hard as possible so that their son does not face any problems in achieving his education. 

Kalyani’s husband is engaged in agricultural activities. He grows different types of vegetables on their own land and sells them in the local market. Her husband’s income from the business is not sufficient to meet both the educational expenses of their son and the household expenses. She seeks this loan to support her son’s education. 

This loan would help her to pay the tuition fees, to purchase education equipment like books, pens etc. and to pay private tutorial fees for her son’s education. 

Kalyani and her son Jitu (as per photo), are thankful to BJS and Kiva for this loan.

loans.use: To pay the tuition fees and other educational expenses for her son

loans.name: Pratima

texts.en:
Pratima lives in a remote region in West Bengal.  She lives in the small town of Dhupguri in the district of Jalpaiguri. She is a 45 -year-old married woman.  She lives with her husband and one daughter, Priyanka. They live in their own small kachha house (mud, straw and bamboo made).  Pratima received an education up to class IV (Grade 4). Pratima could not complete her education due to poverty, but she is willing to provide her daughter with a higher education and desires that her daughter not face any obstacle in receiving her education. Pratima’s daughter Priyanka is now studying in class X (Grade 10) and is very serious about her studies. She aims to become a lawyer in the future.  

Pratima’s husband has been associated with agricultural activities for many years. But his earnings are hardly enough to cover the educational expenses after meeting the household expenses of their family. 

Pratima learned about BJS (Kiva’s partner) and applied for a loan of 15,000 INR for her daughter’s uninterrupted education. With the loan amount, she will pay the tuition fee and buy necessary articles like books, copies, pens, a geometry box etc. for educational purposes for her daughter.
 
Pratima and her daughter Prianka (as per photo) are very grateful to Kiva and BJS for this loan. They give hearty thanks to the lenders.

loans.use: To pay tuition fees and other expenses

loans.name: Minati

texts.en:
Minati is a housewife from the small village of Dhupguri. She has a daughter, Pratima, studying in class X (grade 10). In spite of being illiterate, she pays more attention to her daughter’s education. Her husband is a carpenter and he supports Minati in educating their child. Minati's daughter Pratima is very serious about her studies. 

Due to a lack of money, Minati was feeling helpless about  managing her child’s educational equipment, tuition fees, school fees etc. She wants the loan from BJS to purchase books, pens, exercise copies etc. and to pay all the tuition fees for her school. It will help her to give private tuition to her child for the subjects she needs.

Now, Minati is quite relaxed about her child’s education as BJS and Kiva came forward to help her financially.
Minati and her daughter Pratima (in the photo) thank BJS and Kiva for this education loan.

loans.use: To pay all the fees related to her daughter’s education.

loans.name: Sabanalamarino Unidos 1 Group

texts.en:
Fior is the leader of Sabanalamarinos Unidos 1, which is a group looking to take out a group loan. They are from the town of Sabana de la Mar, a coastal town in the northern part of the Dominican Republic. This is Fior´s twelfth loan.

Fior has been selling women's underwear for more than seven years. Her many years selling underwear have made it possible for her to find a good market to buy a bigger amount and a very good quality product. She sells in her house, by walking in different communities, and to other sellers. 

Fior and her husband are raising their three children in this coastal town located in the city of Hato Mayor. Her most important challenge now is to provide the best education for her children. 

Fior dreams to have an underwear store and to sell for the wholesale market. Her profits will be dedicated to provide for her family's needs and to save for her children's university. 

Fior and everyone in the Sabanalamarinos Unidos 1 group are excited to receive your help. They can make an increase in their business capital with this loan.

loans.use: to buy underwear for resale.

loans.name: Marcos

texts.es:
Marcos se dedica a la fabricacion de muebles y partes de muebles, principalmente de madera.
El vive en casa propia, ubicada en El Alto en la z/ Nueva Asuncion del Departamento de La Paz a una hora de distancia  de la ciudad de La Paz

El sueño de Marcos es, comprar un motor (Cortadora) que le es de mucha necesidad para mejorar su  trabajo, puesto que  el que tenia actualmente cumplio con su ciclo de vida util. Asi brindar mejor servicio a sus clientes  y una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.

Es la primeraa vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Marcos makes furniture and furniture parts, principally out of wood. He lives in his own house, located in El Alto in the Nueva Asunción area in the department of La Paz. It is one hour from the city of La Paz.

Marcos’ dream is to purchase a motor for his wood cutter, which he greatly needs to improve his work, because the one he currently has has completed its life cycle. Thus he will provide better service to his customers and a better quality of life for his family.

This is the first time he has requested a loan from IMPRO and the first time from KIVA.

loans.use: to purchase a motor for his wood cutter and continue with his furniture making business.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Carmen realiza trabajos por cuenta propia son mantas artesanales de vicuña realisadas con ruecas rusticas desde el hilado hasta el proceso de acabado de la manta cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo.
Ella vive en alquiler, ubicada en El Alto en la z/ San Felipe de Seke del Departamento de La Paz a una hora y quince minutos de distancia  de la ciudad de La Paz.

el crédito que solicita es para la compra de ladrillo, arena y cemento para construir un muro en el terreno que tiene, pues alcualmente está desprotegido y es muy peligroso dejarlo así, pues hay gente que puede tomar posesión ilegalmente.

El sueño de Carmen es, producir mas mantas de vicuña asi poder llegar a  exportar mantas artesanales de vicuña sin perder la tradicion y cultura Boliviana. Asi poder brindar una buena calidad de servicio al comprador y a su familia.

Es la segunda vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la segunda vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Carmen makes vicuna wool blankets using rustic distaffs. She does the entire process from spinning to finishing the blankets with her husband's help.  
 
She rents a house in San Felipe de Seke, El Alto, located an hour and 15 minutes from the city of La Paz in La Paz department. She has applied for a loan to buy brick, sand, and cement to build a perimeter wall on her land, which is now unprotected. It is dangerous to leave it that way because someone might take illegal possession of the land.

Carmen's dream is to make more vicuna blankets so that more of these handmade vicuna blankets could be exported without losing the Bolivian tradition and culture. She would be able to offer great service to the buyer and to her family. This is her second loan cycle with IMPRO and her second with Kiva.

loans.use: to buy brick, sand, and cement to build a perimeter wall on her land where she is thinking about building a small house for her family.

loans.name: Josè Amìn

texts.es: Esta es la historia de Josè Amìn, un hombre que fue capaz de descubrir que vivir bien vale la pena y que es mejor caminar por el buen camino. Josè Amìn nació en un pueblo de la costa pacífica, cerca de las selvas tropicales de Colombia y a la orilla de un inmenso rio con un caudal estremecedor. La familia de Josè Amìn, es una familia típica de esta zona del país, conformada por gente luchadora, trabajadora a pesar de las múltiples dificultades económicas.  La tierra chocoana donde nació Josè Amìn es brillante como el oro que sale del interior de las entrañas, es verde como la selva que adorna los paisajes, e inmensa como la majestuosidad de los atardeceres. Josè Amìn hoy está cumpliendo una meta, ESTUDIAR COCINA, porque siente que tiene el talento, la vocación y las ganas de ser mejor persona cada día. Necesitaría el convenio con kiva ya que para el es muy importante seguir con su carrera de cocina y por motivo económico no poderla terminar. Por lo tanto Jose Amin esta solicitando un credito con CampoAlto para estudiar concinar.
texts.en:
This is the story of Jose Amin, a man who was able to discover that living well is worth the effort and it is better to talk on the right path.

Josè Amìn was born in a town on the pacific coast, near the tropic jungles of Colombia and on the banks of an immense and powerful river. Josè Amin's family is a typical family in this part of the country, composed of resilient, hardworking people, despite the many economic difficulties they face. The Chocoana region where Josè Amìn was born is as bright as gold, as green as the jungles that adorn its landscapes and as vast as its majestic sunsets.

Josè Amìn wants to reach his personal goal of studying to cook, because he feels that he has the talent, the vocation and the desire to become a better person every day. He needs support from Kiva, as it is very important that he moves forward with his career, but for economic reasons he has not been able to finish it yet. Therefore he is now applying for a loan with Campo Alto to student cooking.

loans.use: to pay for his tuition to study cooking

loans.name: Suzan

texts.en:
Suzan is 25 years old and is married with three children. She earns her income through the sale of crops and through livestock. She earns a monthly wage as a Community Knowledge Worker (CKW). Community Knowledge Workers are trusted community members who provide agricultural data and advice to rural farmers in their local area, including information about the weather, market prices, crop diseases and agricultural tools. 

On her land, Suzan grows maize, beans, coffee, cassava, sweet potatoes and bananas. She also has cows, goats and chickens. 

As a CKW, she will use the materials in her business-in-a-box (a smartphone, a solar charging set and a weighing scale) to disseminate vital agricultural information to the other members of her village, helping them to improve their crop yields and increase their incomes. 

With the additional money she will earn as a CKW, Suzan will invest in expanding her coffee plantation for increased production. Her biggest dream in life is to see her children study up to university level.

loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set and a weighing scale.

loans.name: Khalida

texts.en:
Khalida is a 49-year-old married woman, living with her spouse and six children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.  Her husband is a milkman by profession. He sells milk in a shop in the nearby community, and is getting a reasonable income for his family. He has been purchasing milk from the market and selling it as a retailer from his shop. Nowadays, customers are making complaints about the freshness of the milk. This is the reason he wants to buy fresh milk from a wholesaler or from the farms, but their price is higher than market rates. He does not have enough cash in hand to buy fresh milk, but he does not want to compromise quality as well.
Therefore, Khalida requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so her husband would be able to purchase fresh milk from the farms to sell.
She hopes that she will be able to make savings through profit amounts. She thanks Kiva and the field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy fresh milk to sell.

loans.name: Ernestina's Group

texts.en:
Ernestina is 38, married and has three dependent children. She is a very brave and enterprising woman and has been able to make the most out of her work as a saleswoman selling cosmetics.
